She trades in canned vegetables: tinned tomatoes, oil, spices, rice, etc. She buys her products from Kumasi and sells on a table in her community market. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Faustina has been in business for over ten years. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure food items to sell

loans.name: Misericordia Del Señor Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Gloria Elena F. G., Karla Patricia B. N. y Ruth María A..

El grupo solidario Misericordia del señor son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya en la comarca Los Altos, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. Todas las miembros del grupo venden ropa ambulante desde hace varios años.

Doña Gloria es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. Ella es una madre joven de 1 hijo pequeño en edad escolar . Su esposo es agricultor en tierras familiares y la producción  la vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.

Doña  Karla vende productos varios como perfumes , ropas, zapatos, estos los ofrece en su comunidad y ya tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, el crédito lo utilizará para ofrecer perfumes en las festividades de las madres. No tiene hijos aún, ella sueña con tener su casa con comodidades y tener sus ingresos 

Doña Ruth María A. tiene dos hijos solteros que viven con ella, elabora nacatamales y los vende ambulante, expresa que hasta ahora logra obtener un crédito que es en base a la confianza y está clara que debe de ser puntual con su pago. Su esposo trabaja como artesano de madera y le ayuda con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.
Ella además vende productos de ropa y cosméticos que es otra actividad que le ayuda a percibir más ingresos.
texts.en:
Photo, left to right: Gloria Elena F. G., Karla Patricia B. N. and Ruth María A.. The Misericordia del Señor Solidarity Group is from the city of Masaya in the Los Altos. They have worked with ADIM through several cycles because they feel that it is an institution that has trusted them. They express that they feel like part of the family of ADIM. All of the group members have been selling clothing on foot for several years. Doña Gloria is the Group's Coordinator. She has been engaged in this activity for years and she knows the direction her business is taking. She states that she has seen how with each loan her business ends up with a larger inventory. She is a young mother with one small school-age son. Her husband is a farmer working their family's land and they sell what they produce for a good price in the market. Everything that they have achieved encourages them to continue working with ADIM and making a good impression. Her group knows this and so they take care to go and make their payments, so that they will always be on time. Doña Karla sells various products such as perfume, clothing and shoes. She sells these in her community and now has many customer who are giving her their orders. She will use the loan to stock up on perfume for the Mother's Day festivities. She doesn't have children yet. She dreams of having her house with amenities and to have her income. Doña Ruth María A. has two unmarried children who live with her. She prepares nacatamales and sells them on foot. She comments that thus far she has been able to obtain a loan that is based on trust and it is clear that she needs to be punctual with her payments. Her husband works as an artisan woodworker and helps her with the school expenses for her children. She also sells clothing and cosmetics which is the other activity which helps her to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo A. is thirty-seven years old. He is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. They are currently in the junior high and primary schools. Kwadwo lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Kwadwo's wife is a journalist.

Kwadwo deals in hardware – paints, glue, locks, carpentry tools, etc., which he sells in a shop at the market square. He buys his wares from big shops in nearby towns such as Kumasi.

Kwadwo has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in large quantities. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy hardware in large quantities

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: Aquilino es natural del departamento de Ancash, vive en Lima desde hace 9 años, con su pareja y su pequeño hijo Ángel de 6 meses, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles y de calzado, actividad que viene realizando desde que migro de su natal Ancash. Aquilino es un hombre muy trabajador y siempre le pone mucho empeño a las cosas que hace, es por eso que va progresando poco a poco, y ahora con su pequeño bebé, tiene más motivos para luchar en busca de un mejor porvenir. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que  puede disponer de tiempo para estar con su pequeño y su esposa, ya que no necesita ausentarse durante todo el día para conseguir el sustento diario. Además ha hecho muchos amigos en sus vecinos con los cuales conversa mucho y son muy fieles a su pequeño puesto. Aquilino quiere hacer crecer su negocio comprando más cantidad de productos y en un futuro tener una gran tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera ser de mucha ayuda para su banco comunal. Lo que él comprará con este dinero son productos no perecibles, como costales de arroz, azúcar fideos, etc. para venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a native of the Ancash department. He has lived in Lima for nine years. He lives with his wife and their six month old son, Angel. They live in their own house. He sells food and footwear. He has been doing this since he migrated from his native Ancash. Aquilino is a very hard working man. He always takes great care in the things he does. That is why he is progressing little by little. Now, with his small baby, he has more motivation to fight in looking for a better future. He likes his work a lot because he can arrange the time to be with his little one and his wife. He does not have to be gone all day to get the daily sustenance. Also, he has made many friends among his neighbors. They talk a lot, and they are very loyal to his little stand. Aquilino wants to expand his business by buying more products. In the future he wants to have a large grocery store. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he hopes to be of much help to his community bank. With the loan he will buy non perishable items such as sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, etc. in order to sell them and get a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Norvinda

texts.es:
NORVINDA P. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF” su domicilio está ubicado en la Av. centenario.  Km  4700 frente al SENATI, tiene 32 años, 1 hijo y su esposo es moto taxista (transportista).

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el mismo que invirtió en un pequeña brosteria (freidora), además compró unos cubiertos y manteles.  

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de Salchipapas, pollos Broster (comida al paso), entre otros.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá reparara su moto taxi, también comprará mesas, sillas, además parte del dinero servirá para dar como pago inicial para la compra de otro motocar (moto).

Agradece a Manuela Ramos porque le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante ya que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó.
texts.en:
NORVINDA P. C. is a client of the Communal Bank "ROAD TO SUCCESS-CAF" her home is located at Centennial Av. Km 4700 across from SENATI. She is 32 years old and has one child; her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she invested in a small fryer, some silverware and tablecloths. Currently she sells Salchipapas(sausage and French fries), broasted chicken, among others.

With this loan of $575, she will be able to repair the motorcycle taxi, buy tables, chairs, and will give the down payment for the purchase of another motorcycle. She thanks Manuela Ramos because with all her help she has been able to implement her business. She said “It is an interesting help because it has allowed me to keep going” she remarked.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and down payment for the purchase of a motorcycle.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu H. is forty-three years old. He is married and has eight children: three sons and five daughters. They are all still in school: some are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. Aminu lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Aminu’s wife is a trader.

Aminu is a butcher. He sells fresh meat such as beef, mutton, etc., in a shop at the market square. Most of his customers are food vendors. He buys live animals all the way from northern Ghana where the cost is economical.

Aminu has been in business for twenty-two years and wants a loan to buy more livestock. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock for his butcher shop

loans.name: Deizy

texts.es: Deizy tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Gracie de 17 años, Junior de 15 años y Ana de 14 en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa por pedido, ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinos, y es así como logra juntar sus ingresos para los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da libertad de realizarlo cuando ella disponga, y a su vez dedicarle tiempo a las cosas de su hogar. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que al  ofrecer sus prendas muchas veces algunos clientes no le pagan a tiempo, por lo que tiene que ir a cobrar casa por casa, siendo esto muy tedioso, pero lo bueno es que esos casos son mínimos y que el negocio le arroja buenos ingresos, siendo eso lo más importante. Es por ello que Deizy le pone tanto empeño y tiempo, sabiendo que de lo que haga hoy dependerá su futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que será muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus prendas en su casa, también arreglará un espacio de su vivienda para instalar un pequeño bazar, que es lo que más quiere.
texts.en:
Deizy is 42; she lives with her life partner and their children, Gracie (17), Junior (15) and Ana (14), in a house which they own. She has been selling clothes to order for a year. She sells to her neighbors, enabling her to supplement the family income to cover household expenses and pay for the children's education.

She likes the work a lot since she can do it in her free time while also attending to her chores in the house. However, she has some problems with customers not paying on time and has to go collecting debts door to door, which is very tedious. Fortunately, these cases are a small minority and the business is profitable, which is what matters.

Deizy works hard and devotes a lot of time to the business since she knows that her future depends on what she does today. This is her first loan from MFP, and she knows she must pay the installments punctually.

The money will be used to buy a glass cabinet to display garments in her house, and to outfit a small shop in the house.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display cabinet and outfit a shop in her house

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
NORA A. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO II-CAF” vive en el Asentamiento Humano EL ENCANTO.Mz.B.Lt.21, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 38 años de edad, 3 hijos y su pareja trabaja en una tienda de repuestos.

Su trabajo está en el rubro de venta de repuestos para motos lineales y  moto taxi, y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con este dinero  adquirió un poco de repuestos y los vendió a precio cómodo, con un margen de ganancia baja, pero eso le ayudo a conseguir muchos clientes.

Con el  préstamo de  S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  compra de mas repuestos. Es un negocio que en esta ciudad le está rindiendo ya que todo el mundo se transporta en moto taxi.

Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
texts.en:
Nora A. R. lives in the city of Pucallpa and is a member of the communal bank called "Rumbo Al Exito II CAF". She is 38 years old, and has 3 children. Her husband works in a spare parts shop. Nora works selling spare parts for motorcyles and motor taxis. With the first loan she received, she purchased a small quantity of spare parts and sold them at a comfortable price. Although she sold at low margins, that helped her win a lot of customers.

With the new loan she will purchase more spare parts. In the city where she lives, this is a good business as almost everybody moves around in motor taxis. Nora says that the loans have helped her generate additional income for her family and enabled her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anyash

texts.en: Anyash I. sells many kinds of electrical appliances such as VCD/DVD players, extension boards, bulbs, etc. in a store by the roadside. Anyash buys from Kumasi. He is 32 years old. He is not married but has a daughter who is currently in primary school. Anyash lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. His daughter lives with her mother. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He is hoping to expand his business and give his child a good education.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Magdalena P. C., Norma de la Cruz M. S. y Diomira Auxiliadora B. López.

El grupo solidario La Santiago es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, ellas por igual tienen sus actividades económicas y dependen solo de ellas, son bien conocidas por esta actividad en sus barrios.
Doña María Magdalena es la coordinadora del grupo, vende ropa variada, nueva y usada, como pantalones, camisas, fajas, etc. la eligieron coordinadora porque es comprometida con sus abonos y así anima a las miembros a no tener errores ni atrasos en sus pagos. Tiene cuatro hijos de edad escolar de  diez,doce, dieciséis y dieciocho  años, ellos van a la escuela mas cercana a la vivienda. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en una empresa embotelladora y le da para el sustento, ella expresa que su negocio es de ella y compra lo que ella quiere para ella y sus hijos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Doña Diomira es una mujer mayor con una familia 2 hijos adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela del barrio, le ayudan en el negocio de la venta de medicina natural, su esposo trabaja de chofer de taxi y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, del negocio ella asume gastos extras del hogar como ropa de los hijos, cuadernos, etc. Su negocio le garantiza la alimentación del hogar y es por esto que ella es muy importante en las decisiones del hogar.

Doña Norma de la Cruz  se dedica a la venta de fritangas en su casa todas las noches, ofrece platos como : pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos y helados. Es madre soltera con dos niñospequeños de tres años, vive con su mamá. Piensa trabajar para poder obtener sus propios electrodomésticos y así ser independiente.
texts.en:
Photos from the left to the right: Maria Magdalena P. C., Norma de la Cruz M. Dandigo and Diomira Auxiliadora B. Lopez. The group La Santiago is originally from the city of Masaya. Each of the women has her own work, and their respective businesses are well known in their neighborhoods. Dona Maria Magdalena coordinates the group, and she has a business selling new and used clothing such as pants, blouses, belts, etc. She was elected to lead the group because she complies with her payments and helps motivate the other members to make their payments on time. She has 4 children ages 10, 12, 16 and 18, who all attend school near their home. Her husband works in a bottling plant and helps with the household costs. She says that her business is her own, and she decides what to buy for herself and her children. She dreams of growing her business and being able to improve the quality of life for her family. Dona Diomira is an older woman with two adolescent children who study at the neighborhood school. They help her with her business selling natural medicines. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps with the household costs. Through her business, she can cover the extra costs for the family such as clothing and school supplies. Her work and income guarantee that they all have enough food in the house, and for that reason she plays an important role in all household decisions. Dona Norma de la Cruz prepares food which she sells from her house every night, offering such dishes as roast chicken, enchiladas, tacos, soft drinks and ice creams. She is a single mother with 2 small children. Norma lives with her mother. She wants to continue her work so that she can afford her own appliances and be more independent.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for their respective businesses, including clothing, natural medicines, and food supplies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 44 años, es natural de la ciudad de Huaral, vive con su hija Marina de 17 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años se ha venido dedicando a la atención de su pequeño bazar, el cual está instalado en su vivienda, y algunas veces cuenta con la ayuda su hija. Marcelina permanece en su negocio durante todo el día, y la mayor parte de la mercadería que ofrece es para mujeres, ya que vende productos de belleza, ropa, adornos, y otros. La demanda es buena, ya que Marcelina está siempre pendiente de innovar su negocio con artículos de moda. Por ello, quiere que su bazar se convierta en una gran tienda, tanto para su beneficio y como para su hija. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de más productos para su bazar, entre prendas de vestir, joyas, cosméticos, etc.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 44 years old and is a native of the city of Juaral. She lives with her 17 year old daughter in her own home. From the age of 23, Marcelina has dedicated herself to running her small shop, which she set up in her home. Sometimes her daughter helps her with the business. Marcelina works in the shop the entire day. Most of her merchandise is for women, such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and other items. There is good demand from her customers. She would like to update her stock with more fashion items, and convert her small shop into a big store, enabling her to improve the quality of life for herself and her daughter. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase more inventory, including clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for her shop, including clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
MARIA R. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA” vive en el Asentamiento Humano José Olaya. Jr. Los pinos Nº 183, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 26 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es moto taxista (transportista).

           Se inició en el negocio de venta chupetes (helados de hielo), refrescos, gaseosas y el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar insumos para preparar los chupetes.

Hoy ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de los chupetes ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.

Ella esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos, es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de mujeres, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Maria R. M. belongs to the community bank, "Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza" ["Our Lady of Hope"]. She lives in the settlement of José Olaya. Jr. Los pinos Nº 183 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 26 years old, has 1 son, and her partner is a taxi driver. She began with the business of selling "chupetes" (popsicles) and soft drinks. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy ingredients to prepare the popsicles. Today, she has progressed with her family, and the popsicle business has improved. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks and a showcase to display her products. Maria is grateful for Manuela Ramos, an NGO that supports a great deal of woman with small loans that allow the women from this region to begin or improve their businesses. And, "I am happy with that help," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and a showcase for her products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, es natural D. Chancay (ciudad al norte D. Lima), vive soL. en su casa propia. DesD. hace 13 años se dedica a L. atención D. su pequeña bodega, donD. ofrece paquetes D. piqueos diversos, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros productos, para solventar sus gastos, ya que trabaja soL.. Le gusta L. atención porque le permite hacer amigos y conversar con L. gente que llega a su bodega, ya que estando cerca D. una carretera muy transitada, muchos choferes y pasajeros se detienen para tomar alguna bebida para refrescarse y algún bocadillo para saciar su hambre. María considera rentable su negocio porque siempre tiene muy buena clienteL., y piensa en un futuro cercano, tener una tienda más granD. con productos D. primera necesidad y así saciar las necesidades D. sus clientes, que cada vez comienzan a ser más. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, además le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeras son sus amigas y trabajan muy bien juntas. Con el dinero que solicita abastecerá su tienda con diferentes productos y así logrará atraer a más clienteL..
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, is a native of Chancay (a city north of Lima), and lives alone in her own home. Since she was 13 years old, she has dedicated herself to tending to her small grocery store, where she offers packets of snacks, sweets, drinks, and other products to settle her expenses since she works alone. She likes the attention because it allows her to make friends and converse with the people that arrive at her grocery store. Since she is located close to a well-traveled highway, many drivers and passengers stop to have a drink to refresh themselves and a sandwich to satiate their hunger. María considers her business to be profitable because she always has good clientele. She thinks in the near future she will have a bigger store with essential products and in this way satisfy the growing needs of her clients. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is very punctual with her payments. In addition, she likes the work in her community bank since her partners are her friends, and they work well together. With the loan that she is asking for, she will supply her store with different products and in this way attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Status Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Zayda del Socorro G. O., Meyboll de Jesús L. O. y Concepción de María G...

El grupo solidario Status está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, en el Km 21, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Concepción de María es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en su casa  comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de tres hijos adolescentes que le ayudan en el procesamiento de las comidas, su esposo es carpintero y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Meyboll es una joven mujer vende cosméticos variados de diferentes marcas, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro perfumes, pinturas labiales, cremas perfumadas, etc. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los gustos de sus clientes. Su esposo le ayuda ya que vende truchas en Costa Rica y viaja tres veces a la semana.

Doña Zayda vende ropa variada de forma ambulante en el mercado de la capita Roberto Huembes, ofrece blusas de mujer de todos los colores y ropa menor como calcetines, medias, etc. Es soltera con dos hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando ellos crezcan.. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio, crecer en variedad de inventario.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Zayda del Socorro G. O., Meyboll de Jesús L. O. and Concepción de María G. The supportive group, Status, is comprised of 3 working women who are natives of the city of Masaya, in Km 21. They started to get loans with Adim through references by clients of the institution that told them that they loan to groups with supportive bonds when there are no other guarantees. Doña Concepción de María is the coordinator of this group. She has a business of selling food. She sells in her home foods that come from a pig, such as pork soup. She used the loan to buy live pigs and later process the broth with spices and plastic bags. She is a mother of three adolescents that help her in processing the foods. Her husband is a carpenter and helps her with expenses. She dreams of improving her home so that it is more secure and of protecting her family better. Doña Meyboll is a young woman who sells cosmetics of different brands. Through this activity she helps with the household expenses. With the loan, she bought perfumes, lipsticks, scented cremes, etc. Her sales have improved because she offers all tastes to her clients. Her husband helps her since he sells trout in Costa Rica and travels three times a week. Doña Zayda travels to sell various clothes in the market in the capital, Roberto Huembes. She offers women's blouses of all colors and undergarments such as socks, stockings, etc. She is single with two children. She dreams of having her own home for when her children grow. With this loan, she has been able to capitalize her business and increase the variety of inventory. The group is committed to being in good standing with Adim so that they can continue getting loans and continue working better.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy live pigs, cosmetics, and clothes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 46 años, es natural de Chancay (provincia al norte de Lima), vive con su pareja, Guillermo, de 50 años, quien se dedica a la carpintería, y tienen 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza para una empresa de cosméticos muy reconocida, la cual le brinda los catálogos que muestra a sus amistades, vecinas y demás clientas, y posteriormente manda estas solicitudes a la empresa, la cual le envía los productos a un costo promedio para que Rosa obtenga puntos y una comisión por la venta. Lo bueno de su trabajo, es que es un negocio que puede realizar desde casa y que no le demanda todo su tiempo, por lo que puede dedicarse a las labores de su hogar. Su esposo la apoya en todo y sus hijos también, es por ello es que tiene mucha fe en este negocio, y le gustaría escalar más alto en esta compañía, además de tener una tienda donde ofrezca gran variedad de productos de belleza. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos de belleza para tener mercadería en stock, la cual pueda ofrecer a sus clientas aparte de los pedidos por catálogo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old and a native of Chancay (the province north of Lima). She lives with her husband of 50 years, Guillermo, who works as a carpenter, and they have two children. Rosa sells beauty products for a renowned cosmetics company, which gives her catalogs that she shows to her friends, neighbors and other clients. She sends their orders to the company, and they send her the products at an average price so Rosa obtains points and a commission for the sale. The good part of her job is that it is a business that can be done from home and doesn't require all of her time, so she can spend time on her household chores. Her husband and children help her with everything, and because of this, she has a great deal of faith in her business. She would like to move higher in the company, in addition to having a store where she can sell a large variety of beauty products. With this loan, she will buy more beauty products to stock her business, which she can offer her clients in addition to the catalog orders.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2”, con domicilio en la  Urbanización Municipal Mz. G8 Lt. 7 tiene 33 años de edad y vive con  sus cuatro hijos menores.
Se inicio con la venta de comida hace varios años, la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró más víveres para la elaboración de sus alimentos, lo cual le permitió ganar mas clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 invertirá en arreglar su puesto de comidas y también comprará  víveres y utensilios para la cocina.
En el Tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente muy feliz porque gracias a ello su negocio esta creciendo  y sus hijos pueden estar en una mejor situación.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank "La Flor de la Canela 2", located at Urbanización Municipal Mz. G8 Lt. 7. She is 33 years old and lives with her four small children. She began selling food many years ago. The first time she obtained a loan of 300 soles, she bought more supplies to create her dishes, which allowed her to bring in more customers. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in repairs for her business and will also buy supplies and utensils for the kitchen. She has been happy working with Manuela Ramos, because thanks to them, her business is growing and her children can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and utensils for kitchen; infrastructure improvements

loans.name: Unidas Por Fé Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Guillermina Nicolasa R.., Justa Pastora S. y Digna Marina H..

El grupo solidario Unidas por fé está  conformado por las señoras: 

Doña Guillermina quien tiene una minipulpería en su casa, con el crédito logró comprar más productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Ella es mujer casada con cuatro hijos, estas le ayudan en el negocio y así ella puede salir a comprar al mercado. Piensa que con el crédito logrará tener una pulpería más grande.Además vende de forma ambulante en Managua pero ofrece especies como : canela. Clavo de olor, manzanilla, etc.
Doña Justa Pastora, es una madre soltera que vive con sus dos hijos jóvenes, ellos le ayudan en su negocio que es la elaboración de escobas, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y ella se lo ha enseñado a sus hijos. Sueña con tener un buen taller y darle estudios secundarios a sus hijos.Vende el producto en Managua, Tipitapa y otros departamentos de la región.

Doña Digna Marina vende productos derivados del maíz como: pìnolillo, pinol, tortillas, tamales, etc., entrega a varios clientes que le compran al por mayor, con sus cinco hijos procesan estos productos en su casa, aprovecha la mano de obra familiar, sus hijos son jóvenes que estudian y ayudan en el negocio. Su esposo trabaja en taller de calzado y le ayuda a los gastos del hogar. Espera con el crédito comprar materia prima como Maíz, azúcar y leña para la cocina.
.
Viven en condiciones de vida humildes, llegaron a trabajar con Adim por una promoción que se hizo en la comarca y les gustó la forma de trabajar porque ellas no tienen garantías que dar para un crédito y en Adim se les dio confianza.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Guillermina Nicolasa R., Justa Pastora S. and Digna Marina H. The "Unidas por Fé" ("United by Faith") solidarity group is comprised of the following women: Guillermina has a mini-grocery store in her house. With loans, she was able to buy more products to satisfy her customers' needs. She is a married woman with four children who help her with her business so she can go out shopping in the market. With this loan, she would like to establish a larger grocery store. She also does mobile sales in Managua, offering spices like cinnamon, cloves and chamomile. Justa Pastora is a single mother who lives with her two young children. They help her with her business, which is making brooms. She learned this activity from her parents and she has taught it to her children. She dreams of having a good workshop and giving her children a secondary education. She sells her products in Managua, Tipitapa and other departments in the region. Digna Marina sells corn products like pìnolillo/pinol (a traditional sweet cornmeal and cacao-based drink), tortillas, tamales, etc. She brings them to various customers who buy in bulk. She makes these products at home with her five children, taking advantage of the family's manual labor capabilities. Her young children are in school and also help her with the business. Her husband works in a shoe shop and helps her with household costs. With this loan, she hopes to buy raw materials like corn, sugar and firewood for the kitchen. They live in humble conditions, and came to work with Adim because of a regional advertisement. They like this way of operating because before they couldn't get guaranteed credit, but Adim gave them confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spices and brooms

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
ENCARNA Q. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS su domicilio está ubicado en la Urb. Municipal Mz. A2 Lt.15 Distrito de Calleria, tiene 63 años, 6 hijos mayores y su esposo trabaja junto a ella en la bodega.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió comprando gaseosas y golosinas, y los puso a vender en su casa, instaló una pequeña bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes tales como: azúcar, arroz, huevos, detergentes, gaseosas , golosinas etc.  con los cuales piensa atraer mas clientes a su bodeguita. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 5 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio y conocer a mujeres que como ella desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Encarna Q. G. belongs to the communal bank "Las Divinas" and lives in the district of Calleria. She is 63 years old, has six grown children, and her husband works with her in their grocery store. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, with which she bought soft drinks and sweets to sell from her home and installed a small grocery store. With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy groceries like sugar, rice, eggs, detergent, soft drinks and sweets, which she believes will attract more customers to her store. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, in the past five years she has been able to build her business and meet women who, like herself, wish to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodles, rice, eggs, soft drinks, sweets

loans.name: Flor Liz

texts.es:
FLOR R. SHUÑA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES” con domicilio en el Asentamiento Humano LOS ROSALES Mz.1 Lt.14 YARINACOCHA, tiene 38 años, 4 hijos, 3 menores y solo uno mayor de edad.  Su esposo trabaja  conduciendo su propio moto taxi (transportista).

Tiene un negocio de venta de comida regional por las noches  y la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compro; platos, cubiertos, manteles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizará para apoyar al negocio de su esposo,  invertirá en la compra de un nuevo motor para moto taxi y tapizará lo asientos para que  trabajen tranquilos sin ningún inconveniente.

En el  tiempo que esta trabajando con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Flor R. S. belongs to the "Las Flores" communal bank in Yarinacocha. She is 38 years old and has four children, three young and one grown. Her husband works driving his own motorcycle taxi. She has a business selling regional foods in the evenings. The first time she obtained a loan for 300 soles, she bought plates, cutlery and tablecloths. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will support her husband's business. She will invest in the purchase of a new engine for the motorcycle taxi and upholster the seats so they will not be an inconvenience. She has been happy working with Manuela Ramos because of the help they give to women in getting ahead. It helps her husband and children, and their home economics.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase engine for motorcycle taxi; upholstery and maintenance for other motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Martha Lorena A. G., Victoria del Carmen C. C. y Lucía del Carmen M. G...

El grupo solidario Victoria está conformado por tres señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias del departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. 
. 

Doña  Victoria vende ropa variada, nueva y usada, como pantalones, camisas, fajas, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad , ella tiene seis  hijos adolescentes y pequeños para quien ella trabaja, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de guarda de seguridad y le ayuda con los gastos. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo porque es muy responsable, vive con su mamá a la que ella le ayuda económicamente. Ella sueña con poder  tener un buen negocio para mantener bien a su hijo y darle estudios

Doña Martha Lorena  joven mujer vende cosméticos variados de diferentes marcas, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro perfumes, pinturas labiales, cremas perfumadas, etc. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los gustos de sus clientes. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña  Lucía del Carmen  vende productos varios como perfumes , ropas, zapatos, estos los ofrece en su comunidad y ya tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, el crédito lo utilizará para ofrecer perfumes en las festividades de las madres.Ella tiene tres hijos a los que mantiene sola y sueña con darles estudios a los tres y tener su propia vivienda, es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Victoria group is comprised of three women, all of whom are hard workers from the state of Masaya. Their living conditions are very modest. They work with Adim because they like the fact that "the organization trusts them," they said. "They are trustworthy neighbors who have known each other for many years and who are very united." Victoria sells a variety of clothing, new and used, like pants, shirts and sashes and has been working in the business for several years. She has six adolescent children to support. Her husband works at a business as a security guard and helps with the expenses. She is the coordinator of the group because she's very responsible. She lives with her mother who she also supports economically and dreams of having a good business in order to support her children and provide them with an education. Martha Lorena is a young woman who sells various brands of cosmetics and that helps with household expenses. With the loan she will buy perfume, lipstick, scented lotions, etc. Her sales have increased because she offers products to her clients to suit all tastes. Her husband helps her with the expenses at home. Lucía del Carmen sells a variety of products like perfume, clothing and shoes to members of her community and she already has many clients that place orders. The loan will be used to buy perfume to sell in the festivals where they celebrate motherhood. She has three children whom she takes care of alone and dreams of giving each of them an education and having her own home. She is a coordinator of the group because she is very responsible. This group is committed to pay on time in order to continue to receive loans from Adim. The members are sure that with the loan they will get ahead because they will increase their sales and their income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfume, clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es:
ILMER V. D. O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” con domicilio en el Jr. TRUJILLO  N° 252 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 47 años, 04 hijos, dos D. ellos menores, y su esposo trabaja en el área D. administración en una institución educativa.

La primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró golosinas y los ofreció en la vereda D. su casa para venderlos, pero el negocio no resultó debido a que había muchas bodegas cerca D. su casa y decidió cambiar D. negocio y empezó a vender  ropa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra D. ropas como; blusas, pantalones, etc. para luego salir a vender a sus amistades.

En los tres años que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, además se siente feliz D. ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Ilmer V. D. O. is a member of the "Las Divinas" Community Bank; she lives in the Callería district. She is 47 and has 4 children, two of them minors. Her husband works in the administrative area of a school.

With her first loan (300 new sols) she bought candy to sell outsiD. her house. The business was not successful as there were a lot of shops nearby, so she decided to change the business and began selling clothes.

With this loan of 1,800 new sols, she will buy clothes (blouses, trousers, etc.) for sale to acquaintances.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos NGO for three years and is very grateful for the assistance provided to women in order to succeed; she is also happy to be able to help her husband and children and, above all, the household finances.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing such as blouses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Yo Tengo Fé Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Dulce María T. Jiménez, Darling Johana T. y Lorenzo Isabel N..

El grupo solidario Yo tengo fé, está conformado por tres señores originarias de la ciudad de Masaya de la comarca de Pacaya, grupo con excelente record crediticio, sus actividades son diversas.
Doña Dulce María tiene un pequeño negocio de Taller de costura en su casa, le vende a dueños de tramos en el mercado de Matagalpa y Masaya, su esposo es sastre y ella es modista y es por eso que decidieron trabajar en este negocio. No tienen  hijos, solo tienen dos trabajadores contratados y junto a ellos realizan la actividad.
Ella es la coordinadora del grupo porque el grupo la eligió para este ciclo, ella sueña con mejorar su casa y su taller. El crédito lo ocupó para comprar telas e hilos.

Doña Darling, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo de 12 años que va a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Don Lorenzo se dedica al negocio de viveros, semilleros de plantas ornamentales y frutales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, tiene clientes en los pueblos blancos donde hay clientes fijos, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y sus dos hijos varones que además siembran granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Dulce María T. Jiménez, Darling Johana T. and Lorenzo Isabel N.. The solidarity group I have faith is comprised of three entrepeneurs from the city of Masaya in the Pacaya region; the group has an excellent credit history and their activities are diverse. Mrs. Dulce María has a small sewing business in her home, she sells to owners in the markets in Matagalpa and Masaya. Her husband is a tailor and she is a dress maker which is why they decided to work in this business. They have no children, they only have two employed workers, all together they perform this activity. She is the coordinator of the group because the group chose her this cycle. She dreams of improving her home and her business. The loan will be used to buy fabrics and yarn. Mrs. Darling sells fruit, she buys it wholesale and then sells it retail during the day. She has a 12 year old son who goes to school, her husband is a trader in the same market where they carry products, this helps them with household expenses. She has been dedicated to this commercial activity since she was very young, and she believes that her business can grow and one day she can make improvements on her home. Mr. Lorenzo is dedicated to his plant nursery business, with ornamental plant and fruit seedlings. He has been in this business for many years, he has customers in white villages where there are regular clients. His wife helps with the business and his two sons also plant basic grains to feed the family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, perfumes

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis E. sells CDs, VCDs, and cassettes. He sells in a store at the market square. Francis buys from Kumasi. He is 27 years old, single, and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He is hoping to expand his business and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy CDs and cassettes

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA Z. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL EXITO” vive en la Urb. Municipal. Mz F. Lt.2., en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad y no tiene hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de ropas, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas interiores y  las vendió a sus vecinos.

Actualmente ella continúa con la venta de ropas, además tiene un moto taxi que también le genera ingresos.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá  una parte del dinero en la compra de ropas para damas y caballeros, y también comprará repuestos para sus moto taxi.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Karina Z. S. is a member of the community bank "Rumbo al exito" and she lives in the municipality of Mz F. Lt.2 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 23 years old and she has no children.

Her business is sellign clothing and with her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, she purchase underclothes and sold them to her neighbours.

She continues to run the same business and she also owns a motorcycle taxi that also earns her an income. This loan of S/.1200 nuevos soles will be invested in part in the purchase of ladies' and mens' clothing and she will also invest in repairs to her motorcycle.

Karina says, "Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is an NGO that supports a vast number of families with small loans that permit women in the region to start or improve their businesses, and I am so happy with this support."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing. To repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Adu

texts.en: Adu G. runs a provisions store. He says his store is by the roadside. Adu buys his provisions from Kumasi. He is 50 years old, married and has four children: three boys and a girl. According to him, they are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. His wife is a farmer. He lives with his wife and children in a house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. He has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. Adu is hoping to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Erling José

texts.es:
El señor Erling M. se dedica desde hace 5 años a la actividad de crianza de pollos en su municipio de Nagarote donde a diario da lugar a la crianza de estos animales porque es el negocio por el cual percibe utilidades para su familia.

A diario, Erling da de comer a los pollos y también cuida por su salud ya que estos a medida que van creciendo, los va vendiendo o procede a comercializarlos. Hoy en día él espera en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los pollos, alimentación y desparasitación y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarlo.
texts.en:
Erling M. has been raising chicken for the past 5 years in the municipality of Nagarote. Every day he cares for his livestock because his business provides his family with what they need.

Every day Erling feeds his chicken but he also watches over their health. As they mature he sells them to the markets. He hopes that he will be given a loan by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) so purchase more chicks, food, and medication. He needs this support now more than ever to pull through with his business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and medication.

loans.name: Dina Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ana María C. B., Patricia del Carmen C. A., Mercedes Eugenia Rostran G., Candida Rosa S. y Leonor del Carmen H. C...

 Este grupo solidario es originario de la comarca San Francisco, del municipio de Nindirí, las cinco se dedican a actividades diversas y dentro de su comunidad, tienen muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, llevan varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han demostrado ser personas responsables y puntuales, están comprometidas para quedar bien en la institución.
 
Doña Ana María C., es una joven mujer, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en su casa  comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de un hijo adolescente y sueña con darle estudio y tener un mejor nivel de vida, está satisfecha de  haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza. 

Doña Patricia del Carmen C., es una mujer trabajadora desde muy joven,vende ropa a personas de la comunidad, es madre de un niño pequeño al que mantiene sola, ella es madre soltera y esto le ha dado mayor fuerza para trabajar y poder sacar adelante a su hijo, este estudia en la escuela de la comarca, piensa que la secundaria la pueda cursar en Masaya.

Doña Mercedes Eugenia R., es otra de las integrantes, ella también vende verduras ambulante, vende frutas peladas y entrega a clientes fijos, ella es conocida por vendedora en la comunidad, compra en Masaya al por mayor y  al detalle. Tiene  
 tres hijos pequeños que estudian en la escuela más cercana a su casa, ella se encarga de cuidarlos y desea que terminen estudios para que conozcan cosas que ella no conoce

Doña Candida Rosa S. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es muy responsable y el grupo le ha dado el cargo porque sabe leer más que las otras dos integrantes y puede firmar bien. Trabaja en el mercado desde muy joven junto con su mamá, vende frutas y verduras, ahora con el crédito ella ha invertido su propio dinero y tiene su propio puesto, donde ofrece naranjas, limones, tamarindo, cebollas, ajos, etc. Compra los productos en el mercado y en la zona donde vive.
Tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, con tres adolescentes y un pequeño, estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y uno estudia en Masaya, esto porque ella considera que debe de salir de la comarca y estudiar además otros cursos.
Su horario de trabajo es de las 3 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., cuando regresa a su casa lleva las provisiones para la comida, expresa que el crédito le permite comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y tener mayor margen de ganancia.
Ella anima a sus compañeras a quedar bien para que le sigan financiando y así seguir creciendo.


Doña Leonor del Carmen H., vende frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella sueña con poder mejorar su casa, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, uno de ellos le ayuda con el negocio. Con el crédito ella logró incrementar su inventario y poder comprar con rebajas de precio.
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Ana Maria C. B., Patricia del Carmen C. A., Mercedes Eugenia Rostran Guzman, Candida Rosa Sanchez y Leonor del Carmen Hernandez C.

This group is from the San Francisco region of the Nindiri municipality. All five members own different businesses and they have many years of working in their community. They have been with Adim (Kiva Field Partner) for many years and have demonstrated to be very responsible individuals, always on time with their payments. They are committed to the organization.

Ana Maria C. is a young woman. She sells food from her home, mostly pork dishes such as stews. The loan will be used to purchase pork to later make broths. She is mother of an adolescent son and she dreams of providing him with an education and to give him a better way oflife. She is so happy to have received help from this organization.

Patricia del Carmen C. is a very young woman and a hard worker. She sells clothing to individuals in her community. She is mother of a little boy who she supports by herself. She is a single Mom and this fact has given her the drive to work harder and put her son ahead of everything. She is going to school in Comarca, and she hopes to attend high school in Masaya.

Mercedes Eugenia Rostran is another member. She sells vegetables door to door, as well as prepared fruits. She delivers to her more steady clients. She is well known in her community. She buys in Masaya in wholesale markets. She has three young children that are going to school near their home. She takes care of them and she wishes to see them complete their studies so that they will know things she will never know.

Candida Rosa Sanches is the coordinator of the gorup. She is very responsible and the group has placed her in charge because she knows how to read better than the other members and she knows how to sign her name. She has been working in the markets since she was very young together with her Mom, selling fruits and vegetable. She coupled her loan with her own savings and now she has her own stand where she sells oranges, lemons, tamarind, onions, garlic, etc. She buys her products in the markets and in the regions close to where she lives.

She has three school-aged children, three adolescents and a little baby. They are attending school in the community and one goes to school in Masaya. She feels that one should move out of Comarca and study other courses there. Her work day starts at 3a.m. and ends at 2p.m.. On her way home from work she picks up groceries to make supper. She says that the loans have granted her the ability to purchase fruits in larger quantities and therefore increase her profit margin. She is alwaye encouraging her colleauges to be responsible so that they will continue to benefit from small loans for continued improvements.

Leonor del Carmen Hernandez sells fruits and vegetables in the Oriental market. She has been running this business for many years. She dreams of making some improvements to her home. She has two school-aged children, and one of them helps her with the business. With the loan she will increase her inventory and buy at better prices.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and clothing.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Juana M. habitante del municipio de Nagarote, a diario se dedica a su actividad de ganadería por medio de la crianza de cerdos siendo esta la actividad a la que se dedica de donde obtiene el ingreso para mantener a su familia.

Ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para invertir en su actividad tanto para la compra de los cerdos, alimentación y desparasitación. Es por esta razón que espera que Ceprodel le proporcione el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su actividad econoómica.
texts.en:
Juana M. lives in the municipality of Nagarote, and every day with a great deal of enthusiasm she works the farm raising pigs. She supports her family with the help of this business.

She has sought the help of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) so that she may invest in her business. She wants to buy more pigs, more food and veterinary medicines. She hopes Ceprodel will grant her the loan she has requested, to pull through with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
LILA I. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. CUSCO Mz.I. Lt.24.  Tiene 59 años de edad. Se dedica a la costura desde muy joven, es madre soltera, oficio con el que educó a sus 2 hijos, lo cual la llenan de orgullo y felicidad.

              Ella tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para dar mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, compra y vende ropa por los caseríos y pueblos que están a fueras de la cuidad.

             Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas de damas, caballeros y niños.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Lila I. V. is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Senora de la Esperanza" (meaning Our Lady of Hope). She lives in Jr. Cusco Mz.I. Lt. 24. She is 59 years old and she has been a seamstress since she was very young. She is a single mother. With her business she educated her two children who fill her with pride and joy.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 5 years. With her first loan of S/300 nuevos soles she invested in maintenance repairs to her sewing machine so that she could keep running her business. Currently she buys and sells clothes for the towns and villages outside the city.

With this loan of S/1500 nuevos soles she will purchase lady's, men's and children's clothing.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because no other financial institution has ever granted her a loan, and without too much paperwork, she received their trust and this motivates her to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es: La señora tiene una caseta en el Mercado Villa Sebastian Pagador, venD. variedad D. lanas y chinelas desD. hace 10 años, el puesto D. venta es D. su propiedad, sus clientes son generalmente D. la zona, quienes le tienen mucha estima. Su esposo es albañil, viven en anticrético, tiene un hijo que depenD. directamente D. ellos, sus otros dos hijos ya son mayores.
texts.en:
Eleuteria has a stand at the Villa Sebastian Pagador market where she has been selling yarn and sandals for the past 10 years. She owns her stand and her clients are mostly from the region and they love her very much. Her husband is a construction worker and they lie in Anticretico. She has a little boy that depends on them, while her other two children are adults.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of yarn and sandals for the summer

loans.name: Miriam De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Miriam de Los Ángeles Bernabé B. de 49 años de vida reside en San Martín junto a su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, Miriam posee este negocio desde ya hace cuatro años. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el capital necesario para aumentar los productos de su tienda, productos como pollo, carnes y cereales. Miriam es madre soltera y debe esforzarse mucho por sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Miriam de Los Angeles Barnabe B. is 49 years old and she lives in San Martin together with her 16-year old son. She owns a store where she sells convenience items and she has been running this business for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan to restock her store with products such as: chicken, meats, and cereals. Miriam is a singlem other and she must work very hard to provide for her son.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase convenience items.

loans.name: El Peñon Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Simona de la Cruz V., María Petrona H. V. y Johana Isabel  G. L..

El grupo solidario El Peñón está conformado por las señoras: Simona V. L.
María Petrona H. V., Johana Isabel G. L.. Todas ellas son mujer trabajadora, originaria de la comarca La Reforma, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confían en ellas, expresaron..

Doña Johana es una joven de 23 años, casada, madre de cinco hijos de las edades 9, 5, 3, una gemelitas de 9 meses. Doña Johana se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas, las cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Managua. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Con los créditos obtenidos ella expresa que ha podido capitalizarse y ha incrementado sus ventas.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.


Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Simona de la Cruz Vasquez, Maria Petrona H. Vasquez, and Johana Isabel G. Lopez.

This group is named "El Penon" and it is made up of these members. They are all hard working women, originally from the La Reforma region located in Masaya. Their living conditions are poor. They work with Adim (Kiva Field Partner) and they all agreed that they feel great to receive this trust.

Johana is a young woman of 23 years. She is mother to five children, aged 9, 5, and 3, and baby twin girls, only 9 months old. Johana buys and sells fruit harvests. She goes to sell in the Managua market. She dreams of buying a stretch of land where to build a little house. Currently they are living with her mother-in-law. She dreams of making her business grow and to provide her kids with a good education. With the loans granted to her she has managed to capitalize and increase her sales.

This group is committed to be on time with their payments and so to be able to receive further loans from Adim. They are sure that with the loans they will be able to increase their sales and their income.

This group forwards payments on Mondays because they feel it is the best day for it, especially because weekend sales are always the best.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase harvests of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia M. D. M. is the owner of a business that sells odds and ends in the city of Santa Rosa. This loan will be used to purchase goods from Brazilian suppliers, as their products are low price allowing a large profit on sales. The loan will be useful for the business and for the family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a general store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en: Luis Alberto R. M. is the owner of a bakery and deli located in the city of San Ignacio. This loan is for the purchase of raw materials like flour. The sale of bread increases during the fall and winter seasons.  Also, prices will be rising in the coming days.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: La Concepción Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Gladis V. R., Alma Nubia M. C. y Rosa Argentina S. Orozco..

El grupo solidario La Concepción, es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la venta de zapatos y uan de las integrantes vende comidas.

Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Gladis V., su activad económica es la compra y venta de zapatos el mercado, de forma ambulante, recorre todo el mercado ofreciendo sus productos.
Se propone pagar los créditos con mucha puntualidad y animar a las integrantes para salir adelante, ella es la coordinadora del grupo. Su meta es de mejorar su vivienda y dejarla como ella quiere, para cuando sea mayor tenga comodidades y con el crédito ella piensa seguir invirtiendo para tener mas clientes y mayores ventas.
Las integrantes expresan que han tenido buenas ganancias con los créditos obtenidos, estos los invierten en temporadas que saben que hay demanda y buen precio.
Doña Alma Nubia, vende zapatos de diferentes estilos, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su mamá a su mantención, ella desea fortalecer su negocio y hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es muy reponsable.

Doña Rosa Argentina S. se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella compra las frutas en la zona donde vive y algunas en el mercado, además vende comida en su casa, ya tiene muchos clientes que almuerzan en su negocio, es una mujer mayor. Sueña  con mejorar su vivienda para ella, vive con su esposo que es guarda de seguridad, no tiene hijos .
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Gladis V. R., Alma Nubia M. C., and Rosa Argentina S. Orozco

The group is named "La Concepcion". They are located in the city of Masaya and they all sell shoes, except on member that sells foods.

The three members trust each other completely. They are neighbours and they get together for the purchase of some products to get better prices.

Gladis V. buys and sells shoes in the market by walking about all over the market offering her products. She is committed to making her payments on time and to encourage her colleagues to work hard. She is the coordinator of the group. Her goal is to make improvements to her home so that when she is older she will have the comforts she will need. With this loan she will keep investing to earn more clients and improve her sales.

The members remark that they have had wonderful returns throuth past loans, especially because they invest during those times they know they will get good prices.

Alma Nubia sells shoes of all different styles. She is single and she does not have children but she helps her with the expenses. She wants to strengthen her business and to make improvements to her home. She is the coordinator of the group and she is very responsible.

Rosa Argentina S. sells fruits and vegetables. She buys the products from the region where she lives and sometimes in the markets. She also sells food from her home. She has many clients that come in and eat at her establishment. She is an elderly woman. She dreams of making improvements to her home. She lives with her husband who works as a security guard, and they do not have children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' and gentemen's shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria R. D. is the owner of a small grocery and convenience store. She lives in the city of San Ignacio. This loan is for the purchase of store goods for the fall and winter. The prices have not yet risen and she wants to take advantage of this and stock up on a large quantity of goods.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a store

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 53 years old and is married to Eladio Figueredo. They live in the San Miguel district of Carapeguá, and have four daughters who are university students.

Celina started working with handicrafts several years ago. She makes blankets and handkerchiefs from lace, and sends them to Buenos Aires, where her sister sells them.

Her husband is a chauffeur who charters his vehicle to different parts of the country.

With the loan from Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva, Celina will buy string and thread.

loans.use: Purchase string and thread.

loans.name: El Viñero Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Juana T. T., Johana C. M. y María de los Reyes P. A...

 El grupo solidario El viñero, es formado a través de mercado, según la cercanía de sus negocios y por su confianza entre ellas, tienen pequeños puestos de ventas en el mercado municipal de masaya.

Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas de tramos y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Juana T. , vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene tres hijos que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Johana C. vende perecederos en el mercado, ofrece productos como tomates, chayotes, remolachas, lechugas, etc.. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad. Tiene tres hijos pequeños que le ayudan en el puesto y además van a clases, su horario de trabajo es desde tempranas horas y termina hasta la tarde.

Doña Maria de los Reyes, es la coordinadora del grupo, la eligieron porque es muy responsable con sus pagos, ella ofrece también productos perecederos iguales a las de la otras dos integrantes, tiene dos hijos pequeños que ella mantiene, van a clase a la escuela mas cercana del barrio.Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor la verduras que llegan del norte del país y que   son de mucha demanda, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar las ventas,
texts.en:
Photo (Left to Right): Juana T. Torrez, Johana C. M., and Maria de los Reyes P. A. The group is named "El vinero" and they have stands set up in the market. They are such good companions that they have their stands together in the market in Masaya. The three members are neighbours and they sometimes get together to buy some products so that they will get better prices. Juana T. sells perishables in the market of Masaya. She sells fruits, having purchased them wholesale. She sells during the days. She has three children who are all going to school and her husband is a salesman in the same market where he carries a variety of products, contributing to the household expenses. Johana C. sells perishables in the market, such as tomatoes, chayotes, beets, lettuce, etc. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and he works as a taxi driver. She looks after her little boy while she runs the business. She has three young children that help her with the stand but they also go to class. Her work schedule starts in the very early mornings and to the late afternoons. Maria de los Reyes is the coodinator of the group. She was elected because she is very responsible with her payments. She also sells perishables, like her two other colleagues. She has two small children who she supports. They go to class in the nearest neighbourhood school. Her husband helps out with the household expenses. She dreams of making improvements to her home especially because in the winter the house floods. With the loans she has received she has purchased vegetables wholesale, those that are imported from the northern parts of the country. The products are of great demand and that has helped her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Soberana Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Margarita de los Angeles M. R., María Antonia S. G. y Josefa del Carmen P. V..

Les presento al grupo solidario Soberana, conformado por las señoras María Antonia S. G., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, la otra integrante es la señora Josefa del Carmen P. V., quien realiza  la activad de elaboración y venta de comida casera, refrescos naturales y jugos enlatados, y la señora Margarita de los Angeles, cuya activad económica es la venta de Zapatos de mujer estas mujeres son muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras, responsables, y semi-analfabetas, pero con muchos deseos de superación. Estas señoras abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores. 


Doña Josefa del Carmen P. V., es una mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, los cuales tiene las edades de 12, 7 y 6 años. Su negocio es la elaboración de venta de comida, para el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, dentro del menú se encuentran platillos tales como el tradicional gallo pinto, nacatamales, carne, pollo y cerdo asado, tajadas con queso, etc. Trabaja con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. El esposo de doña Josefa, se dedica a la manufactura de zapatos en un pequeño taller, cercano a su localidad. Piensa que con el crédito va a salir adelante, para seguir incrementando su negocio que siempre necesita de capital extra.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Margarita de los Angeles M. R., María Antonia S. G. y Josefa del Carmen P. V.. Meet the supportive Soberana group. María Antonia S. G. makes and sells bread. Another member, Josefa del Carmen P. V., sells home-made food, natural soft drinks, and canned juices. Margarita de los Angeles sells women’s shoes. These women are very hard working, enterprising, and responsible. They are semi-literate, but they have great desires to improve. These women shop every Monday; it is the best day to stock up, after the week end the sales are better. Josefa del Carmen P. V. is 31 and married. She has three children ages 12, 7, and 6. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. On the menu you will find dishes like the traditional rice and beans, tamales, meat, roasted chicken and pork, tajadas (fried plantain slices) with cheese, etc. She works with Adim because one of the customers encouraged her to join a supportive group. She formed her group with two close friends and got a loan. Josefa’s husband manufactures shoes in a small shop close to her place. With this loan she plans to get ahead by continuing to increase her business that always needs extra capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pastries, soft drinks, corn, etc.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is single and lives in the Espartillar district of Carapeguá. He is 33 years old and started working as a street vendor in Pilar five years ago. He buys and sells, bimonthly.

He says he has many clients in the area who bring him good products that are accepted by many people.

Edgar applied for a loan with Fundacion Paraguaya to buy seasonal clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Las 3 Flores Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ciliet M. S.,  Maritza de la Cruz P. y  Maritza Bonifacio C.
texts.en: Photo from left to right: Ciliet M. S., Maritza de la Cruz P. y Maritza Bonifacio C.

loans.use: Supplies like corn, bags, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.en:
Eladio V. is 40 years old and lives in the San José district of Carapeguá, in the María Lopez neighborhood. He has a young school age daughter. From a very young age Eladio worked with iron with his father. Later, he gathered enough capital to start his own blacksmith workshop.

In his workshop Eladio makes gates, grilles, railings, see-saws and more. He is very hardworking, responsible, and manages his clientele well.

Eladio applied for this loan to buy iron.

loans.use: Purchase iron.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña María de los Angeles F. es una persona conocida por su actividad de elaboración de calzado, tiene el taller en su casa, con 2 trabajadores que producen zapatos de mujer y de varón. Tiene varios años de tener su taller y hasta ahora ella obtiene un crédito para incrementar su producción.
Espera poder salir adelante, ella soltera madre de dos hijos pequeños, tiene vivienda propia y desea mejorar su taller para que en el invierno no se detenga la producción.
Con el crédito ella compró pega, cuero, hormas y adornos para zapatos de damas.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles F. is well known for her shoe making business. She has a shop in her house. She has two workers who produce women’s and men’s shoes. She has had the shop for several years. She currently has a loan to increase her production. She hopes to be able to get ahead. She is the single mother of two small children. She lives in her own home. She wants to improve her shop so that production is not detained in the winter. She used the loan to buy glue, leather, lasts, and decorations for women’s shoes.
