texts.es: La Señora Luisa Pérez, de 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres hijos los cuales  tiene como objetivo prepararlo en los estudios y que mejoren su nivel de vida. Junto con su esposo trabaja comercializando utensilios plásticos que vende ambulantemente, desde hace16 años, iniciando con fondos propios. Incrementar sus ventas con mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. Con el préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: mallas, cementos, hierro y perlines. Para enmallar su vivienda y ofrecerle mayor seguridad y protección su familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para enmayar su vivienda

loans.name: Berita Marina

texts.es:
BERITA , pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” vive en el Jr. Pucallpa. Nº 651, teléfono 961605664,  tiene 35 años de edad, 03 hijos, y su esposo trabaja como empleado de una empresa maderera.

Inició el negocio de comidas por las tardes y noches, vende  juanes, tacacho,  pescado asado , chaufa (comidas de la región) y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, se compró una parrilla e insumos, y como vive en una zona muy concurrida el negocio le esta  salido muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/ 2,000 quiere mejorar y ampliar su local, comprará mesas, sillas,  platos al por mayor, insumos para su venta y todo lo necesario para que su negocio se vea muy bien y pueda atraer mas clientes.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene, y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Berita belongs to The Divine Ones cooperative bank. She lives on Pucallpa Street, is 35 years old, has 3 children, and her husband works for a lumber enterprise. She started out selling food during the afternoons and evenings. She sells juanes, tacacho, pescado asado, chaufa (all typical regional foods). With her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, she bought a grill and supplies. Since she lives in a busy community, her business has done quite well. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, she would like to improve and expand her location. She will buy tables, chairs, dishes at wholesale, and all the necessary items so that her business runs efficiently and draws more customers. She states that Manuela Ramos is the only institution she works with, due to the low interest rates they offer and how they help to facilitate the process of obtaining credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, disposable plates, and supplies.

loans.name: Moyopata – San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios del grupo “MOYOPATA – SAN SEBASTIAN”, son 12 miembros, ellos son vecinos del barrio D. San Sebastián, situado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes labores con el comercio, ellos venden comida, venden peluches, albañil, venta D. plantas, carpintería, abarrotes, venta D. papa y carne, venta D. artefactos, venta D. diferentes cosas en el mercado D. pulgas. Los socios requieren el préstamo como capital D. trabajo, ellos invertirán en sus mismos negocios, ya conocidos por ellos y así seguirán creciendo poco a poco.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo facilitado y del mismo modo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago definitivo D. su deuda.
texts.en:
There are 12 members in the “MOYOPATA – SAN SEBASTIAN” group. They are neighbors from the area of San Sebastián, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Our members do different types of work, such as sales of food and stuffed toys, construction, plant sales, carpentry, groceries, potato and meat sales, handicrafts, and other items at the flea market. The members need a loan for working capital. They will invest in their own businesses, which are known to them, and continue to grow little by little. The members give thanks for the facilitation of a loan, and commit to making the payments on their debt.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement their different businesses.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una joven muy entusiasta y alegre, a sus 18 años ya tiene un negocio propio, vive en la casa de su madrina y  trabaja duro para mejorar su actual situación económica. Desde hace 3 años viene trabajando duramente, vende ropa todos los fines de semana en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), le gusta mucho vender ropa, sobre todo a las personas que buscan algo novedoso y llamativo, es muy alegre y divertida y las prendas que vende son de muy buena calidad. Beatriz desea que su negocio prospere y que crezca mucho, lo más difícil para ella es conseguir la ropa, puesto que adquiere sólo lo mejor porque tiene una reputación ganada, la cual le ayuda a vender mucho más. Beatriz esta en su segundo préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más jóvenes de su banco comunal y por eso recibe todo el apoyo de las demás para que le vaya bien en su negocio. Los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, serán empleados en la compra de más ropa, para así poder incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an enthusiastic and happy young woman who, at just 18 years of age, has her own business. She lives with her godmother, and works hard to improve her current economic situation. She has been working for 3 years, selling clothing on weekends at the Laguna Temporal Esplanade (the location where the markets of the city of Juliaca take place). She enjoys selling clothes, and especially helping out people who are looking for something new, eye-catching, and of good quality. Beatriz wants her business to prosper and grow a great deal. The most difficult part for her is acquiring the garments, given she only buys the best because she has a reputation to uphold that helps her make more sales. Beatriz is in her second loan with MFP, and is one of the youngest members of her cooperative bank. For this reason, she gets support from all the other members so that her business goes well. The eight hundred soles requested will be used to purchase more clothes, so she can increase her inventory supply.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es: Erica es una mujer de 26 años, muy alegre y conversadora, vive sola en un pequeño cuarto alquilado y es muy conciente de que tiene que trabajar duro para mejorar su futuro. Tiene una cevicheria (restaurante especializado en ceviche y platos marinos) en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que su sazón es muy especial y agradable al paladar, ella es muy alegre y amistosa, por lo cual siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Erica espera tener en el futuro una cevicheria más grande, donde pueda atender a más clientes y brindarles mejores comodidades, lleva 4 años en este negocio y sabe que lo más difícil de su trabajo es comprar el pescado, ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado en escoger lo mejor, para que su ceviche salga exquisito. Es el segundo préstamo de Erica con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y siempre está haciendo reír al resto. Utilizará mil nuevos soles en hacerle arreglos a su cevicheria, el resto del dinero solicitado lo invertirá en comprar más ingredientes para sus platos.
texts.en:
Erica is a 26-year old woman, very happy and chatty, who lives alone in a small rented room. She is very conscious that she must work hard to improve her prospects for the future. She has a “cevicheria” (a restaurant specializing in ceviche and other seafood dishes) at the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her business is very busy given her food is tasty and agreeable to the palate, and she herself is happy and friendly. She always greets her customers with a smile on her face. Erica hopes to have a larger cevicheria in the future, where she could tend to a greater number of customers and provide more comforts for them. She has been in this business for 4 years, and knows that the most difficult part of her endeavor is buying the fish itself. She has to be very careful to choose only the best so her ceviche turns out delicious. This is Erica’s second loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual with her payments, and hopes to be this way again. She is the happiest member of her cooperative bank, and always makes her colleagues laugh. She will use one thousand soles to fix up her restaurant, and the rest of the funds requested will be used to buy more ingredients for her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her restaurant, and buy the ingredients she needs to make her dishes.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Every Filipino, young or old, rich or poor, is a part and parcel of this fast changing world surrounded with political and economic crises nowadays. Every Filipino is aiming and focusing on something that would help her in everyday survival. Because of the above-mentioned reasons, Mrs. Charlotte B., 36 years old with three dependents, is applying for a loan amounting to 7,000 Philippine Pesos. The said loan will be used in her business, dried fish and fish vending, as additional capital. If her plans and desires for her business are successful, it will not only cater to the needs of the people but also the basic and important needs of her family--especially the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Rainero

texts.en:
"I previously made baskets and other native products. Now what I do is manage a small sari-sari store business together with my wife. We work so hard to sustain our family and provide for our daily needs," says Rainero G., a 45-year old father of three children. He would like a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock for his sari-sari store. He thinks that the loan will increase his profit and family income.

CEVI provides financial services to poor communities in the Philippines. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sari-sari store

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús es un joven de 23 años, vive en la casa de sus padres y aunque todavía es muy joven, ya sabe que si quiere tener una buena vida tiene que trabajar muy duro. No hay nada mejor que una comida acompañada de un buen vino y eso lo sabe muy bien Jesús, quien aprovechando la gran variedad de nuestra comida, se dedica a vender vinos de muy buena calidad, va de puerta en puerta en espera de que la gente le compre su producto, a él le gusta bromear con sus clientes, es muy amable y divertido. Para más adelante quiere tener una tienda de licores, donde pueda vender mejor y ofrecerles más variedad de productos a sus clientes. Ya son 3 años los que lleva en este negocio y considera que ya es hora de crecer, Jesús siente que lo más difícil de su trabajo es convencer a la gente de comprarle unos vinos, pero no se amilana sigue adelante seguro de lo que hace, sabiendo que va por buen camino. Es el segundo préstamo al que Jesús accede con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más y mejores vinos, para ofrecer a sus clientes solo productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Jesús is 23 years old. He lives in his parent’s house, and although he is still very young, he already knows that if you want to have a good life, you have to work very hard. There’s nothing better than a meal accompanied by a good wine, and Jesús knows this well. Enjoying the great variety of our cuisine, he sells wines of very good quality. He goes door-to-door in the hopes that people will buy his product. He likes to joke with his customers and is very friendly and fun. In the future, he would like to have a liquor store where he could sell more and offer a better variety to his customers. He already has three years in this business, and it’ll soon be time to grow. Jesús feels that the most difficult part of his job is convincing people to buy the wines, but he is not daunted and continues what he does, knowing that he is on the right path. This is the second loan that Jesús has obtained from MFP, and he has the capacity to meet all his payments. He is one of the most active members in his community bank. For this, he is appreciated and respected. With the thousand Nuevos Soles requested, he will buy more and better wines, to offer his customers only quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Lady

texts.es: Lady es una joven de 19 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para que pueda generarse sus propios ingresos. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se encuentra su negocio, tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende aretes, collares, anillos, etc. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, lo cual sumado al precio accesible de sus joyas, hacen que sus ventas sean muy buenas. Lady disfruta de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, con lo cual hace que sus jornadas de trabajo sean más amenas, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Son 2 años los que lleva con este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Es el segundo préstamo de Lady con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles de solicitados, comprará más joyas para mejorar su stock y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lady is 19, very happy, and a hard worker. She lives in her parent’s house. They have always helped her so that she can generate her own income. Her business is in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She has a small stand where she sells earrings, necklaces, rings, etc. She is a very cheerful and convincing sales person who sells jewelry at reasonable prices. Therefore, her sales are very good. Lady enjoys talking with her neighboring vendors, which makes her work more pleasant. What she likes the least is having to stay in her stand all day without being able to leave and do other things. She has been in this business for two years. It is going well for her, even though she still does not feel satisfied. She wants to set up a larger store where she can offer her customers better attention. This is Lady’s second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments, and she expects to be able to do so. Also, she does not want to cause problems for her Community Bank where she has been so well received. With the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for, she will buy more jewelry to improve her stock and be able to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, a sus 49 años ha logrado formar una familia y ser el principal sustento de ella, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos; Edwin de 25, Diana de 22 y Reydi de 19 años, y no pierde las esperanzas de mejorar su situación económica. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Santa Bárbara (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde vende papa, quinua, oca y todo lo que sean productos andinos, es la más carismática de todas la vendedoras, por lo cual tiene muchos clientes y vende casi toda su mercadería. En un futuro espera tener una tienda, donde pueda vender una variedad más amplia de mercadería, incluyendo sus productos andinos, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado. Lleva 12 años en este negocio y sabe que lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir los productos que vende, ya que tiene que disputárselos con otras vendedoras en espera de conseguir los mejores. Es el segundo préstamo de Maria con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer crédito y espera serlo ahora también, es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y siempre tiene algo que decir para hacer más agradable el ambiente grupal. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos andinos, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Maria is a very calm and hard-working woman who at age 49 has been successful forming a family and being its main provider. She lives in her own home with her three children — Edwin, 25; Diana, 22; and Reydi, 19 — and has not lost the hope of improving their economic situation. Her sales post is located in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market located in the city of Juliaca), where she sells potatoes, quinoa (a grain-like vegetable), goose and all other kinds of Andean products. She is the most charismatic merchant in the market, which is why she has many customers and sells nearly all of her merchandise. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell a more varied and expanded selection of goods, including her Andean products. What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her neighboring merchants and finding out about the things going on in the market. She has had the business for 12 years and knows that the most difficult thing about her work is getting products to sell, since she has to compete with the other merchants to get the best goods. This is the second loan for Maria with Kiva partner MFP, and she was very punctual with her first loan and hopes to be so again. She is the happiest member of her community bank and always has something to say to make the group environment more pleasant. With the 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy more Andean products to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza a sus 44 años tiene solo un hijo, Alexander de 8 años, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y darle una buena educación a su niño. Ella considera que la educación es un aspecto muy importante en la vida de un niño, es por eso que decidió poner una escuela para niños especiales (con síndrome de dawn o retardo mental), ya que siente que todos merecemos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación, ella es muy alegre y trata con mucho cariño a sus “Amores”, que es como ella llama a los niños que estudian en su Institución Educativa. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, puesto que es muy feliz educando a los niños, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es cuidar a los estudiantes de algún imprevisto. Espera en el futuro poder agrandar la infraestructura de su institución y así poder acoger a más niños y prepararlos para que sepan defenderse solos en la vida. Es el segundo préstamo de Maritza con MFP, siempre ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que siente que tiene que dar el ejemplo en su banco comunal, del cual es una de las fundadoras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar las instalaciones de su colegio, además renovará las carpetas y pizarras.
texts.en:
Maritza, at 44 years old, has just one child, eight-year-old Alexander. She lives in the house that her parents left her, and she has a drive to move ahead and giver her son a good education. She believes education is a very important aspect in the life of a child, and for this reason she decided to start a school for special children (with Down's Syndrome or mental retardation), as she feels that we all deserve the opportunity to have a good education. She is very happy and carefully tends to her "Loves", as she calls the children who study in her Educational Institution. She really enjoys her work, and is very happy teaching children. She has been working in this field for seven years, and the most difficult part is taking care of her students during unforeseen circumstances. In the future, she hopes to expand the infrastructure of her school and thus be able to take in more children and prepare them to be able to defend themselves in life. This is Maritza's second loan with MFP. She has always been responsible in her payments, as she feels the need to set an example in her communal bank, of which she is a founder. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she will repair her school facilities and renovate the carpets and blackboards.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve facilities and furniture

loans.name: Magife

texts.en: Magife S. is from the village of Dumagoc. She is 35 years old, married, and has two infant children. Magife sells specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately Php 7,000 a month. Magife joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of Php 6,000 which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 3rd loan from Paglaum MPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials and ingredients for her business

location.town: Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard S. is a carpenter and driver of a passenger motorcycle. He is 37 years old and has three children. He dreams of having another business to meet all his family's needs. He also wants to send all of his children to college to give them a brighter future.
Richard is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to repair his passenger motorcycle and for enrollment of his children.

CEVI provides financial services to the poor. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To repair passenger motorcycle and for the enrollment of his children

loans.name: Zahro

texts.ru: Захро 20 лет, еще не замужем. После окончания школы сразу стала заниматься предпринимательством. Продает мужские, женские и детские носки, а также мелкую одежду из хлопковой ткани. Кроме нее в этом бизнесе занята и ее мама. За товаром ездит Захро раз в неделю. Место для торговли непостоянное и поэтому кроме центрального рынка ездит на окрестные рынки по разным дням недели. Прибыль от бизнеса небольшая. Захро планирует немного увеличить ассортимент одежды и подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Zahro is 20 years old, she is not married yet. After finishing school she became an entrepreneur right away. She sells men’s, women’s and children’s socks and also some clothing made from cotton. In addition to her, her mother is also busy with the business. Zahro travels for products once a week. Her sales location is not permanent and because of this in addition to the central market, she travels to surrounding markets on different days of the week. The income from the business is not large. Zahro plans to increase her assortment of clothing a little bit and has applied to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Mumina

texts.ru: Мумина работает официанткой в одной из местных столовых города Исфары. У нее среднее образование и поэтому высокооплачиваемой работы не нашла. В этой столовой ей разрешили поставить маленький столик для продажи разных мелких товаров. Здесь торгует ее младшая дочь. Товары мелкие но приносят хорошую прибыль так как много клиентов. Мумине 49 лет, замужем и у нее 5 детей. Она подала заявку на КИВА и планирует увеличить запасы товара для своего маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mumina works as a waitress in one of the local cafeterias in the city of Isfara. She has a high school education and because of this could not find a high paying job. In the cafeteria they allowed her to place a small table to sell different small products. Her younger daughter sells here. The products are small, but bring a good profit because there are a lot of customers. Mumina is 49 years old; she is married and has 5 children. She applied on KIVA and plans to increase the quantity of products for her small business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Hamidahon

texts.ru: Хамидахон 51 год, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж имеет постоянную работу и содержит семью. Сама Хамидахон нигде не работает и занимается домашними делами. Так как имеются условия для содержания домашнего скота Хамидахон имеет несколько голов бычков и овец. Кроме откорма занимается куплей продажей скота на скотном рынке. По базарным дням ей помогает ее муж. Хамидахон, узнав о МикроИнвест, решила подать заявку на займ, и приобрести одного бычка и корм для него.
texts.en:
Hamidahon is 51 years old, is married and has 4 children. Her husband has a steady job and supports the family. Hamidahon does not have a job and takes care of the household chores. Because she has the right conditions for raising domestic livestock. Hamidahon has several heads of cattle and sheep. In addition to fattening livestock, she buys and sells livestock at the livestock market. On market days her husband helps her. Hamidahon, having found out about MicroInvest, decided to apply for a loan and to acquire one bull and feed for it.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza - Tipon Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lo conforman los socios del banco comunal "NUEVA ESPERANZA - TIPON", ellos nacieron en su mayoría aqui en la comunidad de Tipon, ubicado a 25 minutos de la iudad del Cusco.

Los socios comparten sus labores del hogar con sus restaurantes de venta de platos típicos como el cuy al horno con tallirin, y dos de los socios tiene una pollería restaurante, ellos tienen sus negocios en terrenos con mucha area verde, situados fura de la ciudad, por lo que se convirtieron en restaurantes campestres, son lugares de exparcimiento donde todos los fines de semanas las familias se trasladan a este sitio para disfrutar de platos típicos como (truchas al horno o ala vapor, sopa de gallina, sopas complejas, sopas de maíz, y choclo con queso), nuestros socios tiene como otro atractivo el complejo turístico de TIPON, que en la época de los INKAS fue un cntro ceremonial dedicado al agua, ellos adoraban al agua como parte de una gran deidad, compuesto de fuentes y canales que pese a los años tranzcurridos, aún sigue fluyendo agua d sus canales, que está situado caprichosamente en las laderas del cerro Pachatusan (sostén del mundo, ombligo del mundo), los socios solicitan el préstamo en calidad de capital de trabajo.

Nuestros socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These partners form the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza - Tipon" (New Hope - Tipon). The majority of them were born here in the community of Tipon, located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. The members split their work between home and their restaurants, selling local dishes like baked guinea pig with tallirin. Two of the partners have a chicken restaurant. They have businesses on land with much greenery, located outside the city, so they converted them to country restaurants. They are in scattered locations where every weekend families go to enjoy local dishes like baked or smoked trout, chicken soup, mixed soup, corn soup, and corncobs with cheese. These members have another attraction, the tourist complex of Tipon, which, in the era of the Incas, was a ceremonial center dedicated to water. They worshiped the water as part of a great deity, comprised of fountains and canals that continue to flow after all these years down the slopes of Pachatusan hill ("mainstay of the world", "the world's navel"). The partners are requesting a loan for working capital. The partners are grateful for this loan and promise to finish paying their debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inputs for guinea pig and chicken dishes

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима имеет торговую точку в одном из местных магазинов на центральном рынке города Исфары. Занимается продажей детской одежды и обуви. Опыт работы в этой сфере уже больше 10 лет. За товаром ездит на оптовые рынки раз в неделю. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 4 года. За это время ее товарооборот увеличился в несколько раз. Свой очередной займ Фотима собирается потратить на увеличение ассортимента детских комплектов для новорожденных и детской обуви.
texts.en:
Fotima has a sales location in one of the local stores at the central market in the city of Isfara. She sells children’s clothing and shoes. She has 10 years of experience in this sphere. She travels to wholesale markets for her products once a week. She has been working with MicroInvest for 4 years now. Her turnover has multiplied several times during this time. Fotima plans to use her next loan to purchase a variety of children’s outfits for newborns and children’s shoes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow product assortment

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina says, “Through hard work and patience in managing a general store business, one can achieve progress.” Rufina is 52 years old and married to Ricardo, who is a farmer in their village of Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She is managing a store in their village and she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP because she wants her business to grow. She has been running the business for eight years and she hopes she can continue to sustain it and even expand it.

She is thankful because she has been blessed with five children. Her two eldest are already married. Her third child, Rochelle, is 20 years old and a college graduate working at Centro mall as a sales lady. Rickson is 18 years old and has finished a two year course in college. The youngest, Russel John, is 16 years old. Rufina hopes that her children will some day develop her retailing business so that the family can afford to send Russel John to college.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita B. is a 55-year-old entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling slippers. She is a resident of Barangay Malibabag over Peñablanca, Cagayan. She wasn’t able to pursue her studies because of their family’s poor living conditions. When she got married she and her husband decided to invest their little capital into her current business. Aside from slippers, Charlita also sells bags, wallets, and purses to generate income daily.

With her desire to expand the business, she has decided to request a loan of PHP 6,000. She wishes to utilize the loan wisely so that her business can grow and expand. She hopes to use any extra income to support their children’s education and also hopes to employ others in her business someday.

“With God’s help, we were able to fight the challenges of life and now we can already, at least, sustain the needs of our family with the minimal income of our shop,” ended Charlita.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng T. currently drives a motorcycle taxi to earn a living. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and their two lovely children in the province of Siem Reap. In addition, his wife sells a few groceries from home. Pheng T. can only generate a little profit each day because his motor is not wide-size and he can only pick up a few passengers. In order to increase his daily income, Pheng T. has decided to ask for a Kiva loan to purchase a trailer motor (tuk tuk) which he can use to transport more passengers than before. He purposes to use the rest of his loan to increase his wife’s business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer motor

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and a responsible mother to her children. Her family is happily residing in the simple place of Barangay Malibabag in Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Rodrigo G. who is 50 years old and works as a bus driver in Tuuegarao City. Irene and husband work very hard so that their children may have a good future.

Irene runs a poultry-raising business to help her husband with their financial needs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional working capital to grow her business. Every 45 days she can sell her chickens to buyers and start over again. She hopes and expects her business to grow and expand in the long run. She knows that being patient is the key to success of every business.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital to grow her business

loans.name: Nozimchon

texts.ru: Нозимчон и его жена торгуют детской одеждой на центральном рынке города Исфары Сам Нозимчон кроме торговли имеет постоянную работу и поэтому в магазине в основном сидит его жена. Нозимчону 24 года. Ассортимент товаров небольшой, но включает в себя все необходимое, чтобы иметь постоянных клиентов. Нозимчон планирует немного расширить ассортимент своего бизнеса, и поэтому подал заявку на КИВА. На фото Вы видите жену Нозимчона.
texts.en:
Nozimchon and his wife sell children’s clothing at the central market in the city of Isfara. Nozimchon has a steady job in addition to selling, because of this his wife is the one who mostly sits in the store. Nozimchon is 24 years old. His product assortment is not large, but has everything necessary to have regular customers. Nozimchon plans to grow his product assortment a little bit and because of this has applied to KIVA. In the photo you can see Nozimchon’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow product assortment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
“Success is the result of our patience and hard work and our struggle to overcome failures.” says John.

This idea motivated him in bringing out his best to become a productive raiser of poultry. John is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos that will be used in the maintenance of his poultry business, which he runs in his local village of Malibabag Peñablanca, Cagayan. His wife Maymona works as hired laborer sometimes to generate extra income for their family needs. He hopes that through the loan and through proper business maintenance, John will be able to develop his business well and will able to meet his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina sells vegetables, fruits and sometimes smoked fish. She sells her products by going from house to house in their village. She is 49 years old and married to Rolly S., a taxi driver in Manila. They have no children but they have a nephew to support. He is in school and the couple considers him their child. 
Josefina  is thankful for having an average income of 150 PHP daily. However, because of an increase in costs, Josefina has to exert more effort to make her business profitable. She is requesting a loan of  5,000 PHP in order to meet her family's needs and support the education of her adopted nephew.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a beautician in their village. She is 53 years old and married to Dalmacio who is a tricycle driver and also maintains their farming business. The couple was blessed with five children. Some of them are already married while some are working in the City of Tuguegarao.

To further develop her business, Leoncia is requesting a loan from lenders amounting to PHP 11,000. She will use the loan to purchase different beauty products and materials she could use in her service. She also wants to establish a simple beauty salon in their town and through the amount she is requesting, Leoncia would be able to secure permits in order to operate a business legally.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 31 years old and is married to Enrico C. who works as a house carpenter and drives tricycle transport. Nora is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to maintain their daily income.

Nora has four children. Jenalyn is 18 years old and did not pursue her college studies because of a lack of money and is now working in Cavite as a factory worker. Jenevelyn is 15 years old and a high school senior student. Rajar Jhon is 12 years old and a high school sophomore. Enrico C. Jr. is 9 years old and in grade four.

Nora keeps doing her best to continue to provide her children with their needs for their studies. She hopes that someday in the future they will be able to start a new business but for now they must earn as much as they can with the tricycle.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children: Melirose has just graduated from college and Galiza is now in the fourth year of Nursing College. Rosemarie was so proud because, despite the hardship of life, she is managing to pay for her children’s education with her poultry raising business.

Because she lacks the financial capital needed to grow her business, which is one of her dreams, she has decided she would like to take out a loan. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She believes that sustaining the business will help her attain a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is managing a hog raising business located just beside their house. At the age of 55, Teresita keeps working in order to help her husband, Restituto, who is working as a gasoline boy, to provide for their family's basic necessities. They are blessed with two children: Wendel, 28 years old, now married and working as a bakery boy, and Juliet, now 25 years old.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 5 years now. Her goal is to make her livestock business a success; thus, Teresita is hoping to borrow 6,000 PHP from lenders to use as financial support for her business. At the moment, since her children are no longer studying and already have their own families, Teresita is hoping that her hog raising business will earn a better profit to enable her to repair her house so that she can stay more comfortable.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Phlong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phlong A. is a borrower who has been recruited to be the leader of this group by the other borrowers. She is 60, a widowed woman, and the mother of five children. Four are married and have already started their families, while the other one still lives at home.
Phlong A. currently earns her daily living by selling a variety of foods. She sells items like fruit, sweets for kids and desserts. The food she sells is bought at the local market, located not so far from her house. Phlong A. conducts her business successfully every day because she communicates well with fellow villagers. In order to meet her customer's demands, Phlong A. is looking for a Kiva loan to be used to purchase additional products to sell.
The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
P. is a pasted fish seller, who is seeking a loan to run her business more smoothly.
S. will use the loan to buy more fish to sell.
R. will be using the money to buy used goods to stock and sell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Toun's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is for four women who live in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. Mrs. Toun K., 24, has been recruited by the other members to be the group leader. Presently, she owns a workshop where she and her husband make Khmer noodles to sell out of their home. She also sells her noodles to regular customers who are market sellers who come to buy in bulk at her house.

Toun K. ran out all of the necessary raw materials from her stock. Because she lacks the capital to replenish her stock, she is applying for a loan to purchase rice for making noodles to sell.

The other three borrowers jointly taking this loan are:
Toun T., who will use the loan to buy a motor she can use to support her business and for her family’s riding needs.
Sok K., a chicken seller who will use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport chickens to sell more quickly.
Sin C., who sells Chinese noodles in the market and who will use the loan for capital to begin raising pigs at home.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make noodles to sell

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
Education is the most important inheritance Mukarram and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional support of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle. Mukarram and her family are awaiting your rapid response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
J. Musharraf is 47 years old. She is married with two children. Musharraf is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Fifteen years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances--taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $800 USD.
Be an important part of the growth of Musharraf’s business!

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida R. manages a small piggery. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children. She sold ready-to-wear (RTW) products when she was younger, but stopped trading RTW and decided to raise pigs instead.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed. The loan will greatly help her grow her piggery business. She is also planning to venture to another line of business in the future to supplement her income.

CEVI has been providing financial services to the rural poor. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Kudbiniso

texts.en:
K. Kudbiniso is a married woman who, on a daily basis, seeks for the bettering of her family. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and has been a stable source of income until this day. For more than seven years, Kudbiniso grows some production on her land with the help of her husband. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality, Kudbiniso wants to borrow money for growing onions and tomatoes on her land. For that, she needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Let’s show solidarity to this selfless mother who looks for what is best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
K. Ikromjon is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Seven years ago he started his business selling cell phones. Ikromjon believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. However, he thinks that it is expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it will save him money if he purchases the goods in China. With this purpose, Ikromjon requests $800 US Dollars. Being loaned for the first time, Ikromjon is grateful to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones from China

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
"My husband and I have done our best to start a sari-sari (a general store). At first we didn't know how to run a store but later on, we learned the business and tried to make it grow. Before, we sold fish. Because our income was not enough to take care of our needs, we pushed to have a store and sell various types of goods to our neighbors," says Lolita S., a 47-year-old mother of five children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner pioneer in the Philippines. Lolita will use the loan to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

CEVI is reaching out to help people start and have a business to support their own families. CEVI provides financial services. It also offers trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (store)

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
M. Hasan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He owns a minibus, which generates the income necessary to support his family. Hasan needs this loan to buy spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better, so as to save more money in order to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his microbus

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia C. owns a small sari-sari (store). She is 57 years old and has three children. She wants to make her business grow. Her wish is that her business will be sustainable. Alicia uses the income from her store to take care of her family's needs.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her sari-sari. "With my loan I could start expanding my business to a larger scale," she said.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides financial service to the poor. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her sari-sari (store)

loans.name: Litty

texts.en:
Litty S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 44 years old. Litty is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Litty owns and operates a business venture in the food sector: operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Litty has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Litty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Litty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Litty is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Litty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
Hoshim R. is 39 years old and the father of 4 children who are all attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Hoshim owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating onions and tomatoes in order to earn a living. On this plantation, Hoshim now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of $800 USD to buy the necessary substances. Hoshim counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, Saidjon was diligent with his fertilizer- and pesticide-selling venture. In the season mentioned, Saidjon made adequate income, which was used to improve his home and saved for his children’s education expenses. While diligently selling fertilizer that season, his land sat uncompleted and derelict. The current rainy season is a suitable time for planting. Saidjon is taking the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He has requested funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Saidjon is optimistic his venture will be successful and all his expended effort will better the family’s welfare.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
S. Abdujalil has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past 20 years, and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in. He is married and the father of two children, who are his responsibility. His son (pictured) is also engaged in the business of his father. This work is satisfying, and it enables Abdujalil to purchase goods for his home. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Abdujalil wants to buy more cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan of $800 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en:
Odelia D. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 30 years old. Odelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Odelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Odelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Odelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Odelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Odelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Odelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita F. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 59 years old. Pablita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Pablita owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Pablita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Prossie Nagawa ‘S Group

texts.en:
Prossie is a leader of five members of a group.  She is 27 and married with four children between 6 and 12 years of age. All of her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a two-room house where she stays with six people. Prossie takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Prossie operates a ladies salon in Ndeeba, one of Kampala suburbs. She works an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week. Prossie buys cosmetics and hair relaxers from Kampala city shops. She uses public transport to and from shopping.  Her major monthly expenses include medication for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last four years . Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her. Prossie has been with MCDT for over two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cream relaxers and a Hair Dryer.  Prossie aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.
.

loans.use: To buy more cream relaxers and a hair dryer

loans.name: Celea

texts.en:
Celea C. is from the village of Kapita. She is 45 years old. Celea is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Celea owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Celea has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Celea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Celea is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Celea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima P. is 66 years old. She is a widow; her husband died because of illness. What she is doing now is managing a small sari-sari (store). She wants to grow her business even more. She is working so hard to help her children who are already married.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase school supplies to sell. Enrollment is near and people will eventually buy notebooks, pencils and other school supplies for their children.

CEVI provides financial services in the community. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nakakeeto Lucy ‘S Group

texts.en:
Lucy is the leader of four other members of a group.  She is 35 and married with three children between 10 and 14 years of age. All her children go to school. She resides in, and rents, a two-room house where she is staying with five people. Lucy doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Lucy deals in spare parts in Kisekka Market, one of the markets in Kampala city. She sells to an average of four people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She uses public transport to and from work.  Her major monthly expenses include medication for the family, rent, school fees and feeding the family, She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her. Lucy has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more spare parts. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent home which will act as her business premises.
.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Zeenat Muhammad Younas Group

texts.en:
Zeenat Baji sews clothes for her neighbors to earn income. Recently, her relatives have also started giving her orders. She learned this art from her mother. Her husband, M. Y., drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zeenat Baji is a very sensitive lady. She doesn’t want to leave all the financial burden to her husband; therefore she chooses a sewing business. They have been living in Yadgar, Pakistan, a historical place, for the past 10 years. Zeenat Baji is a very hardworking lady. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she can complete dresses on time and earn more money.

Zeenat Baji is the leader of a group with four other women from her locality. Hafizan Baji wants a loan to buy cell phones to sell. Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy chairs, tables and table covers for her catering business. The other Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. The last Bushra Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia J. is a sari-sari store owner. She is 65 years old and has only one child. In addition to selling a variety of goods to her neighbors, she has been raising pigs to supplement her income. Her store opened in 2004. Now she wants to make it grow and prosper.

Eufracia would like a loan of 21,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for the sari-sari store. The loan will help her expand her business and sell more goods.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Sakina Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is the leader of this group. Her husband runs a construction supplies business. He has been in this business for the past three years. He takes order from building contractors and earns a profit. Sakina Baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies, like sand and cement, so that her husband can complete the orders of his customers.

Sarwari Baji is applying for a loan to repair her vehicle named Shahzore.

They are both very hardworking ladies. They also sew clothes to manage financial expenses. Their families are very happy with their efforts. They live in Yadgar, Pakistan --a historical place in the city of Lahore.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed between the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loan. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Bushra Muhammad Ashfaq Group

texts.en:
Arshad baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. 
Shahida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.
Bushra baji is a widow and has been a citizen of Yadgar, Pakistan for the last 15 years.  She is the group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. Bushra baji is a very brave and hardworking lady. After the death of her husband, she became the breadwinner of her family. She started a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from Multan city because clothing rates are not as high in that city and she sells to her community. She gets a good number of orders every month. Nowadays she is out of stock and is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to complete the orders of her customers. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
"My husband and I started having a business in 2004. We have a small piggery. We grow and sell pigs to our neighbors for income and to support our daily needs", says Rosita A., 63 years old, from Baclayon, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feedstock for the pigs. She is interested also to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It offers credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Abida Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Jamila Gulzar wants a loan to buy material (cosmetics, hair dryer and scissors) for her beauty salon. Kosar and Kaniz each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rani wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Abida is a 30-year old married lady and a citizen of the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 6 years. Her husband, A. is a delivery man by profession and delivers fruit, vegetables and construction supplies. He has been in this business for the past three years. Abida is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because his old cart is rough and rotting.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Members mutually guarantee the entire loan. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a donkey cart.

loans.name: Khalida Muhammad Afzal Group

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and my husband is M. A., We both have been living in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has four years of experience in this business. I also operate a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden. I’m applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify my husband’s grocery shop. I’m the group leader of six other women.

Shakeela wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen Kosar wants a loan to buy material (dry fruits, cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat selling business. Gulzaran wants a loan to buy decoration pieces to sell. Sajida Aziz wants a loan to buy stationary (pens, pencils and notebooks) to sell. Abida Parveen wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Naseem Akhtar wants a loan to buy cigarette packs to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Kosar Muhammad Awais Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is a very hardworking lady. She sells bangles to the community. Her husband, M. A., also helps her in her business. He sells bangles by going to different areas and announcing his products in a loud voice. They have been living in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Kosar Baji has been in this business for five years. She is applying for a loan to buy more bangles to expand her business.

Kosar Baji is the leader of a group of six other women from her locality. Raeesa Kanwal Baji and Shamim Akhtar Baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for their tailoring businesses. Ghafooran Baji wants a loan to buy decorations to sell. Naseeban Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Abida Hafiz Baji wants a loan to buy stationary (pens, pencils and notebooks) to sell. Naseem Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz and I have lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. I operate a sewing business because I want to share the financial burden with my husband so he can pay more attention to his work. My husband runs a construction-supply sales business. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He has a good number of customers who give him orders and he fulfills the orders on time, so he has developed a good reputation.  I am applying for a loan to buy construction supplies so that my husband is able to complete his customers' orders.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my area. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy items (tables, table covers  and chairs) for her catering business. Rafia baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sugran baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Parveen Kosar baji wants a loan to buy tea packets to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Damira

texts.en: Damira Duraković was born in 1986 and comes from the village of Omazići near the town Banovići. She is married and has one child. Her husband owns a truck and does transportation services. Damira is a housewife and stays at home taking care of the house and her child. She supports her husband every time he needs help, like by cleaning the truck, making the meals for his travels and similar. Damira`s husband has been in this business for a long time and he wants to improve it. He bought a truck trailer, not a new one, which must be repaired. Damira requested her first loan from WWI in the amount of 2000 KM to repair the trailer and register the truck. The only income in their house is that from the business with truck and Damira and her husband will invest all they can in the business. They are a young couple who want to make progress in their life.

loans.use: To repair the trailer and register the truck

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar Parveen and I have owned a two-room brick house in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. My husband, M. Ramza, runs a motorbike-rental business. Currently, he has two motorbikes. I also run a cloth-selling business to pay the utilities and to share the financial burden with my husband. My husband is very happy with me. I am applying for a loan to buy another motorbike for my husband’s business.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my area. Najma Parveen baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Munawar Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Fakhira baji wants a loan to buy goat for her animal-selling business. Khursheed Begum baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rental-bike business

loans.name: Noor Hussain Muhammad Jamil Group

texts.en:
Noor Hussain baji is married to M. J., and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Noor's husband has run a dairy business for the past 6 years. Noor baji is a simple, hard-working lady. She sews clothes for her neighbors to earn income. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk-selling business. 

She is the group leader of five other women from her area. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen Akhtar baji and Azra Parveen baji are each seeking loans to buy timber to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Nabila baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Shafqat Younas Masih Group

texts.en:
Shafqat baji is a wife of Y. M., who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines.  Shafqat's husband is a delivery man by profession and delivers different items (fruits & vegetables).  He has 3 years of experience in this business. Shafqat baji also runs a soft-toy-making business. She makes different animals (bear, cat, and dog) from cotton. Her toys are popular with kids. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband's business.  The old cart has become rough and rotted in different areas.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. Najma baji wants a loan to buy supplies (wires, switch boards and switches and tube lights) for her electric shop. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy iron for her iron-rod-making business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a delivery business

loans.name: Mukhtaran Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Mukhtaran and I have lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. My husband, M. A., runs a grocery shop in the community.  I operate a clothes-embroidery business, which provides good income.  I have saved that money for a rainy day. I’m applying for a loan to diversify my husband’s grocery shop.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my area. Rubina Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Qaisra baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rasheedan Begum baji wants a loan to buy supplies (wires, switcbboards, switches and tube lights) for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta U. is selling "choriso", a kind of processed meat products sold by dozen. She is 41 years old and has seven children. Her husband, Genaro U. is raising pigs. They work so hard to be able to meet the needs of their family.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to  purchase stocks for processed meat business. The loan will also be used to buy feed for the pigs.

Through CEVI, Aniceta and her husband were able to sustain their livelihood all the more. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for processed meat business

loans.name: Nusrat Sultana Rana Gulzar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat sultana baji has lived in Borewala in Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines, for the past fourteen years. She is uneducated because her father could not afford to pay for her education. Nusrat sultana baji is skilled in making embroidered dresses. She earns an income by making dresses for her neighbors. Her husband has an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers.

Nusrat sultana baji is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) to increase the profit of her husband’s animal-selling business. She is the leader of a group comprising two other women from her locality. Nagina parveen baji and Mumtaz baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Ceta

texts.en:
"I started my business in 2004. My husband and I decided to have a store business. We also have  piggery  at the back of our house. The pigs produced offsprings and we sell the piglets to the pig growers in our location. Before, I was just selling firewood to our neighbors", says Ceta C., the 47-year-old mother of four children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of feed for her hog business and additional merchandise for her store. The loan will help her improve her number of pigs and her store income as well.

CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store and feeds for her backyard hog-raising business

loans.name: Asia Parveen Murad Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Asia parveen and I live in Borewala in Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. I own a two-room brick house where I have lived for the past ten years. My husband, M. A., has run a timber-selling business for three years. As inflation is increasing rapidly and it is difficult for one person to cover all the expenses, I help my husband with my own business sewing clothes.

I am applying for a loan to buy more timber to expand my husband’s timber-selling business. I am the leader of a group comprising three other women from my locality. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). K. baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and taps) to sell. Noor Fatima baji wants a loan to buy a musical instrument (guitar) for her husband’s musical group.
