This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: The members also operate a business of seasonal vegetable selling and in this picture they are showing their vegetables.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Курбонова Гульнора проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 41 год. Вдова , воспитывает двоих детей одна. Живет вместе с родителями  , братьями и сестрами. Вобщем у них очень большая семья. Три года проработала в МВД, теперь занимается животноводством. Так и к нам обратилась за кредитом , для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ей развивать свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Gulnora Q. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is a 41 years old widow who is raising her two children alone. Gulnora lives together with her parents and siblings as one great family. She has worked for three years at the Ministry of Internal Affairs but currently makes her living by raising livestock. Gulnora has requested this loan in order to purchase additional animals for her herd, which will help her develop her business and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Manzooran Moula Baksh Group

texts.en:
My name is Manzooran and I have been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the last eleven years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. I own a two-room house in this city.

My husband’s name is M. B. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has four years of experience in this business. I’m applying for a loan to repair my husband’s auto-rickshaw because it’s creating trouble and it requires an urgent repair otherwise the engine becomes seized.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality:

Shahnaz begum baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

Kalsoom akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. 

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy toys for her toy shop.

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz begum baji is showing her clothes variety.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Shafqat Parveen Fazal Karim Group

texts.en:
Maqbool akhtar baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

Shafqat parveen baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. These ladies belong to a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Shafqat baji is a very good human being and her members respect her a lot.

Shafqat baji runs a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community, with three years experience. She is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To diversify her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is the mother of three children with her late husband. She was widowed at the age of 45 and has since remarried. With her new husband’s children and hers, they now have seven children. Two are married and three are still studying. They live in the rural village of Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela.

Agnes has managed and run a general store in her town for the past nine years. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 to help improve her business. She is hoping that through the loan, she will able to increase her daily income and support the education of her children. Agnes has even tried selling barbecue and snack refreshment every summer in order to generate a higher income. Agnes hopes that she remains capable of doing her business, especially since she is suffering from a goiter but does not have money for its proper medication.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 57 years old and is married to Roberto S.. They live in the village of Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. They have four children who are now all married. Her eldest child died when was 31 years old. Her second child, Joey, is 37 years old, next is Jomel who is 34 years old and the youngest, Jay, is 33 years old. Her children, unfortunately, were not able to study in high school because of financial difficulties. 

Clarita cuts hair in the village where they live. It is her main source of income, which has really been helpful in financing their daily needs. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to both add some needed supplies to her shop and start up a poultry business. She has run a poultry business before but she became ill and had to sell off all of her chicken to pay for her medication. Clarita is now the one sending her grandchild in high school since his father already passed away. She is now fine theurth year high school and she dreams to finish her studies up to college. Clarita is hoping to have her poultry business back again to able support the studies of her grandchild while also doing her hair cutting and dressing service.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
"When my husband and I decided to have a business, we faced a lot of challenges. There are times that we will have low sales. But we learned so many things from it. Now, we know how to deal with the situation. Everything that happened is charged to experience," says Anecita C., the 32-year-old mother of one child.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchased stocks of merchandise to sell. She thinks that her loan will help add more display that could attract customers.

Through CEVI she was able to sustain her store and manage it well. CEVI gives her not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Razia Shoqat Group

texts.en:
Razia S. baji is an unmarried lady who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the last ten years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Razia baji operates a clothes-sewing business. She chose this business to keep herself busy. Now she enjoys doing this work because she feels independent.

Her father runs a medical store in the community. He has six years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy medicines to increase the profit of her father’s medical store.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Ramzan baji wans a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Mumtaz A. baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy medicines for her father's medical store

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 27 years old and a resident of Barangay Cabaruan in Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Jomar who is 28 years old and a farmer in their village. They were blessed with two children. Their eldest, Josephine, is 7 years old and their youngest, John Paul, is 4 years old. Josephine is already studying in their primary school. Ester is hoping that her two children will someday able to finish their studies through college. 

Ester manages a general store in their village.  She has run the business for two years already . Because she wants the business to grow, Ester is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. She is working hard at her business for the future education of her children and also to support her father-in-law who is presently suffering from an illness. She hopes that her business will be given the chance to grow someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Leynie

texts.en:
Leynie lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 22 years old and married to Edgar A. who is 23 years old and employed as a restaurant cook. The couple is already blessed with one child, baby Shayna who is 2 months old.

Leynie has seen her neighbor’s success with a Kiva loan and thinks that she too can use one to her advantage. She is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000. She believes that through the loan she can add things to her store that will help her expand her business.

She started her store two years ago because she wanted to be able to have a higher income for their child and future children. She also wanted her business to expand into other services such retailing cell phone minutes. At the moment, Leynie’s family lives with her parents since they don’t yet have enough savings to build their own house.

loans.use: To add things to her store and expand her business

loans.name: Samina Ashiq Ali Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is the wife of A. A. and they live in Borewala, Pakistan. They feel themselves lucky to be a part of a city which is famous for its shrines. Samina baji operates a clothes-sewing business. She does this work to pay off the utilities.

Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver with three years experience. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because its repair has become essential otherwise its engine becomes seized.

Samina baji is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors and creams) for her barber shop.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 34 years old and a public teacher in their village of Cabruan Naguilian, Isabela. She has been teaching kindergarten for about five years now and receives a monthly compensation of only PHP 1,200. She is married to Loreto D. who is 40 years old and works as a farmer. They have two children who are both studying in the primary school. Valerie Kyle is the eldest while Valian Klyde is the youngest.

Marites’ compensation from teaching is not quite enough for her family’s daily expenses so she has started selling Avon and Natasha products to her co-teachers and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more products to sell and provide needed income to her family. 

According to her, “poverty is not a hindrance for success.” She is aiming for success despite the difficulties that her family is experiencing. As long as there is patience and perseverance she knows she can lift herself and her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a resident of the rural and distant village of Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. She is 33 years old and is married to Absulun Simion who is 42 years old and is a simple farmer. They are blessed with four children: the eldest is Lester who is 11 years old, Christine is 10 years old, Mark James is 8 years old, and their youngest, Aaron, is 4. The three eldest are all studying in primary school.

Mely is planning to purchase an additional piglet to raise and buy enough feed to last her until she can sell her current batch of hogs. To accomplish this she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000. One of her goals in life is to have a better standard of living by developing her only business. She also hopes to give her children a better education and to live in a comfortable house where it is safe.

loans.use: To purchase feed and an additional piglet to raise

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico, 49, is a resident of Barangay Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. He is married to Julieta D., 47, who runs a grocery store in Roxas, Isabela, away from her family. Monico is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to expand his wife’s business. He feels that by taking out this loan, he will make his wife happy and proud of him. He hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to provide for all of her children’s needs. According to him, his wife hopes to move home one day so that they can start a business selling cooked snacks like pancit bihon. He believes that someday, with their combined diligence, they can achieve their dreams.

The couple is blessed with four children, all of whom are studying. The eldest, Jemar, is 15 years old, Glydel is 13 years old, Patrick James is 8 years old and the youngest, Klydis, is 6 years old.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en: "I am a fish vendor. I sell fish in the village, in the streets and in nearby towns just to get an extra income. My only wish is that, someday I will have other businesses that will help me support my family. I’m not married yet but I am trying to save an amount from my business for my future children," says Romanita L., 49 years old and single from Maribojoc, Bohol. Romanita would like to obtain a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell. The loan will surely grow her fish business even more and will help her earn a bigger income. CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Asatillo

texts.ru: Буриев Асатилло проживает в городе ТУрсун-заде. Возраст 42 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Имеет высшее образование . По специальности зооинженер. Проработал четыре года. В данный момент работает в сельском хозяйстве. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения для посева. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет.Получаемый урожай он использует для продажи на рынке , но часть продуктов оставляет своей семье  с запасом.
texts.en:
Asatillo B. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. Asatillo has a bachelor's degree in Veterinary Engineering and four years of job experience. For the last 10 years he has been making his living as a farmer. He sells most of his harvest at the market, but keeps some of the produce for his family's own needs. Asatillo has applied for this loan in order to buy quality seeds and fertilizer for the spring planting.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia L. manages a small sari-sari (variety) store. She is 41 years old and the mother of two. She would like to grow her business even more. The income that she gets has helped much in paying the expenses at home and for the education of her children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise to sell. She thinks that by doing so, she will get a better income to support their needs. CEVI helps small businesses to grow by providing financial services to the poor. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Waziran Muhamamd Aslam Group

texts.en:
Waziran baji is the wife of M. A. who runs a clothes-selling business. They own a two-room brick house in Borewala, Pakistan, and have been living in it with her family for the last ten years. Waziran baji helps her husband by sewing clothes for her neighbors.

Her husband buys clothes from Multan and sells to the native city. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand his clothes-selling business.

Waziran baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical shop.

Razia baji and Parveen sakina baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Naziran baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Note: Two of the members, Yasmeen baji and Razia baji, also operate their artificial-flower-selling business to pay for their utilities.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Iqbal Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Iqbal baji is the wife of M. A. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from Multan and sells them in Borewala. He buys clothes from Multan because the price of clothes is not high and so he gets a profit on each dress at the time of selling. Iqbal baji operates a business sewing clothes. She gets orders from her neighbors and charges $2 per dress. Iqbal baji is applying for a loan to expand her clothes-selling business. 

Iqbal baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Razia baji and Shahnaz akhtar baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

Shazia baji and Muniran baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Note: Two of the members Razia baji and Shahnaz baji also operate their artificial-flower-selling business to pay their utilities.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: "I started running a business in 2006. I can still remember how we started. We used our small savings of Php 2,000 to buy preprocessed Tuba wine to display in our store. My husband and I are Tuba vendors. Tuba is a type of wine that originates from the coconut tree," says Leonida G., the 36-year-old mother of six children. Leonida would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She heard about Kiva and she wanted to obtain a loan to support her business. She thinks that by doing so, she could add more wine in her store to sell. This in turn will give her a bigger income for the family. CEVI helps people’s business to grow. It provides not just loans but includes training and insurance coverage to all of its clients as part of its services.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her Tuba wine business

loans.name: Kalsoom Madad Khayal Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is the wife of M. K. who owes a two-room brick house in Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. She operates a clothes-sewing business and does this work to pay off the utilities. Her husband works in a motor workshop and repairs vehicles. He wants to start his own motor workshop because he believes in his expertise. Kalsoom baji is applying for a loan to buy motor-repair tools so that her husband can start his own motor workshop.

Kalsoom baji is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Aziza baji wants a loan to buy material (scissors, mirror and creams) for her barber shop.

Sakina parveen baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.

Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy morot-repair tools for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: "My friends encouraged me to go into business. What I do now is sell vegetables to earn a little income to support my family. I sell my vegetables in Tagbilaran City. I dream that someday I will have my own farm to grow vegetables to sell," says Norma C., 49-year-old mother of three children. Norma would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. She is also interested in venturing into other lines of business. In this way, she will have enough money to support her children, especially in school. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To puchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Salma Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is the wife of A. G. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.

Her husband runs a garment-selling business for which he has a good number of customers. He sells specifically ladies’ garments which he buys from the famous markets of Lahore (named Ichra and Anarkali) and sells to different communities. He has three years of experience in this business.

Salma baji also runs a clothes-sewing business for the purpose of paying the utilities and the children’s school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy garments to expand her husband’s garment-selling business.

Salma baji is the group leader of six other women from her locality:

Haleema baji and Saira hayat baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Kosar parveen baji and Haleema baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Asia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Shahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Akbar Zulfiqar Group

texts.en:
Akbar baji is the wife of Z., who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past five years. Borewala is a city that is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. Akbar baji keeps herself busy by sewing clothes. Her activity rewards her with money, which she saves in a committee. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

Akbar baji is the leader of a group that includes two other women from her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Buriev

texts.ru: Буриев Ассадило житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 48 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Зарабатывает путем работы на частных стройках. Но работает еще и  частным предпринимателем в сфере сельского хозяйства. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные удобрения и семена для посева. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который сможет своевременно реализовать.
texts.en:
A. Buriev lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 48 years old, married and has four children. He makes his living as a builder/contractor and supplements his income by farming. He is hoping to use the loan for purchase of quality fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting. This will allow him to collect a quality harvest which will be easier to sell on the market.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia R. is a regular member under PDP-LP program and resides at Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with two children and is happy with her small business. She is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her small sari-sari store. She is also a barangay health worker. She’s thankful to Paglaum Coop for helping her avail the loan for her proposed project. She hopes to expand her store and have enough savings for her retirement.

loans.use: additioinal capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion D. resides at Sapang Dalaga and has been a regular member of PMPC’s PDP-LP program for almost two years. She is happily married with five children and her husband is a farmer and also a fisherman. She’s asking a loan of 5,000 PHP to maintain fishing boat and fishing net for her husband. She thanks PMPC for helping her financially. Her husband in pictured above on the blue boat, preparing for fishing.

loans.use: additiional capital for fishing

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn T. is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a barangay (village) councilor. They live in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. 
Marelyn is a regular member of Paglaum MPC under the Paglaum Development Program for Landless People program. She’s thankful to Paglaum for giving her the opportunity to borrow money that will be used for additional capital for her business and for having life insurance as security for their future.

loans.use: For capital for a sari-sari store

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Mrs. Gertrudes B. is a bona fide resident of East Poblacion Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married and blessed with three children who already have their own jobs.

Her business is a room-for-rent / boarding house. It started with only with three rooms available for rent. Now, she's requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used for the expansion of her rooms for rent. Her business is fully existing and running well so far. Her future plan is to make it a bigger and more comfortable boarding house.

loans.use: To extend her rooms for rent

loans.name: Nelicia

texts.en:
Dried prawns (known locally as hibi) processing and distribution is the specialty of Mrs. Nelicia A.. This couple started their business several years ago and have been able to maintain it and meet the demands of their customers, friends and neighbors. They sell on consignment at different stores like Gaisano City – Ozamiz, Lee Plaza in Dipolog and big stores in Davao City, Pagadian City and other neighboring towns and provinces.

Nelicia is 51 years old, married and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. Unfortunately, this couple was unable to have a child but they have one adopted child that they treat as their own. Her name is Cheryl. She is now a grown lady and a member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP Program (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People).

Now, Nelicia is applying for a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase prawns for hibi processing. This is her sixth loan. The couple wants to thank PMPC and Kiva for their support and financial assistance. They will be able to maximize their supplies and make bigger sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy hibi for processing and distribution

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mrs. Flora B., a 54-year-old widow, is a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is blessed with ten children but only four of them are staying with her at this time and helping her to support their daily needs.

As the breadwinner of the family, she engaged in fish and shrimp vending in order to feed her family, especially during the time since her husband passed away. She inherited this business from her parents who were fishers and vendors too. She has an existing stall at the public market. Mostly her customers are her neighbors, friends and residents of the locality. Her business still exists and is stable, despite of the global crisis we are experiencing at present.

As an active member of the PDP-LP Program, she has been able to obtain multiple loans. This time she is applying for an amount of PHP 12,000, as her 6th loan, to add to her business capital. Her only dream in life is to continue to send her children to school for their good future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish and shrimp vending business

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en: Reynilda B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 38 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Reynilda manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 34 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Reynilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Reynilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Darwisa

texts.en: Mrs. Darwisa V. is seeking a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items for her sari-sari store. She is 30 years old, married and presently living at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.She became a member of Paglaum MPC in May, 2009. She hopes to have a successful business with a concrete store. She wants her children to finish college and have a good future.

loans.use: Capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Maurita

texts.en:
Maurita R. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 49 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.

Maurita runs a food stall, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Maurita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Maurita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her house. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to have comfortable shelter for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her house

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Juana owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Celeste owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Celeste joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Celeste is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for her house. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter for the family to live in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Faridah Musoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Faridah is the leader of four members of a group. She is 45 years old and married with six children aged between 6 and 23 years, all going to school. She resides in, and owns, a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. She takes care of her aged parents. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Faridah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells sweet bananas in Bwaise. She sells to an average of fifteen people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She buys bananas from her place of work and so doesn’t incur any transportation costs. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family, She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Faridah has been with MCDT for over eight years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She is hoping to build a shop in available space so as to work from her home.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Emerson

texts.en:
Mr. Emerson C. is a bona fide member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He is 54 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He is a pensioner and his wife is a retired teacher.

Recently, he's obtaining a loan of PHP 20,000 that will used for the enrollment of his graduating student. The rest will be used for the maintenance of his motorcycle which is also their source of income.

He's thankful to the Paglaum Coop for giving him the chance to borrow the money that has answered his problem. And with Paglaum he is able to say that he can continue to support his children in school and enable them to finish college and someday find a decent and stable job.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Janat Nakabugo‘S Group

texts.en:
Janat is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 40-year-old single mother of four children aged between 11 and 17 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she is staying with six people. She takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Janat resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells bananas in Kalerwe market in one of Kampala’s suburbs and has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She sells to an average of ten people a day and sells to all categories of people. She buys bananas from her place of work and so doesn’t incur any transportation costs.

Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Janat has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla Q. is from the city of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 41 years old and single. To make a living, Perla runs her own business venture in the retail sector, selling soft drinks and alcoholic beverages, including beer and wine, in the local community. Perla has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now Perla is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional soft drinks and alcoholic beverages for sale. This loan will be her first one from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her sales business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda T. is 38 years old and lives in Balasdio. She has one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. To earn income, Luzminda runs a general store, selling a variety of food products to the local community. She started the business almost 20 years ago and earns about 10,000 pesos per month. Presently, Luzminda needs a loan of 20,000 pesos to be able to purchase of a new freezer. She hopes that the purchase will help expand the sales business and generate additional income, so that she can afford sending her child to a college.

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer for a sales business

loans.name: Sendiwanyo Oliver ‘S Group

texts.en:
Oliver, 43, is married and has 3 children, all between the ages of 14 and 20. She lives in a rented house that does not have piped water. Oliver's house and work place are located on the outskirts of Kampala. To earn income, Oliver sells charcoal at her home to an average of 20 people per day seven days a week. Oliver buys charcoal from delivery vans and therefore does not incur any transportation costs. Her main monthly expenses include rent, electricity, and school fees. She has been in this business for the last two years, and her main business challenges at present include the increasing price of charcoal and rental charges. 
Oliver is the the leader of a 5-member loan group; she has been with MCDT for over three years and is now asking for her fifth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and possibly rent her her own business premises.
.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Rahimahon

texts.ru: Маллаева Рахимахон- женщина 51 лет. Рахимахон занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота. Рахимахон на полученный займ хочет купит бычка откармливать и когда вырастить перепродать по выгодной цене. Рахимахон также является членом фермерского хозяйства от туда она  собирает сена  поэтому еда для скота ей не проблема. Также Рахимахон занимается переработкой пряжи. Муж Рахимахона работает трактористом и мало получает деньги. Рахимахон надеется что, получив займ она   улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en:
Rahimahon Mallaeve is 51 years old. She makes her living raising and feeding cattle. Rahimahon would like to take out this loan in order to buy a calf for fattening and subsequent sale at a higher price. Rahimahon is also a member of a farmer's co-op where she gets the hey for her animals, so she will have no problems feeding the calf. Additionally Rahimahon also prepares and spins wool. Rahimahon's husband works as a tractor driver and earns only a small salary. Mrs. M. is hoping that this loan will allow her to significantly improve their living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Zhuraboi

texts.ru: Нишонов Журабой- мужчина  56 лет . Журабой женат отец у него 7 –детей. У Журабоя очень большая и дружная семья. Они все вместе дружно трудятся в колхозе кроме старшего сына который находится в Российской федерации и помогает своей семье. Женщины в семье Журабоя занимаются переработкой пряжи  также у них дойная корова которая приносит доход семейному бюджету.
texts.en:
Zhuraboi N. is 56 years old. He is married and a father of 7 children. It is a big and very tight family who all work together at the farmer's co-op, except Zhuraboi's eldest son who is currently in Russia, earning money to help out his family. The women in Zhuraboi's family also prepare and spin wool and they own a milk cow which brings additional income to the family's budget.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Husain is a 23 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Hussain has owned a barber shop for four years. Hussain requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Hussain has requested a loan. 
Hussain is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty starting his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussain will use the loan to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Nassar

texts.en:
Nassar is a 22 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Nassar has owned a bakery since 1990. He does “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where you do the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Nassar requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw material for his bakery. This is the first time that Nassaer has requested a loan. 
Nassar is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. His clients are people from his region. When Nassar first started his business, he has some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation and he also wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Nassar will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Ирисбоев Салим - мужчина 53 лет. Женат отец 5-х детей. Салим занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Салима – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. С наступлением зимы Салим продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота. Ему нравятся все наши условия и он готов с нами сотрудничать
texts.en:
Salim I. is 53 years old, married and has five children. Salim makes his living raising and selling cattle. The coming of spring for Salim means purchase of young calves, since in the spring calves and food for them are cheap. As the result fattening of calves will not cost too much.With the coming of winter Salim will sell some of the grown and fattened animals but he will not spend the profits to buy more animals. Instead he purchases feed for the animals remaining in his herd for the winter. Salim likes the terms of the Kiva loan and he is excited to be working with us.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 43 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their three children. Laila has owned a clothing shop for five years. She also sells makeup. Laila requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work for the summer season. This is her second cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loan helped her diversify her merchandise. Laila is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her work because she wanted to depend on herself and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Laila will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 52 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Mhamad has owned a butcher shop. Mhamad requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new refrigerator and change the décor of his shop. This is his fourth cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Mhamad is special in his work because he does it well and is clean in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he likes it. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mhamad will use the loan to purchase a new refrigerator and change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Yigitali

texts.ru: Баротов Йигитали- мужчина 42 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей.  Йигитали занимается откормоми  купле-продажей скота . Он закупает скот и продает сразу же, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через 3-4 месяца. Таким образом Йигитали зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Ему помогают сыновья. Йигитали нам  благодарен за    финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Yigitali B. is 42 years old, married and a father of three children. Yigitali feeds and sells cattle. He purchases animals and will sell them right away if he finds a good client or keeps them for 3-4 months and sells them for a better price. Yigitali makes his living this way and his sons help him in this business. He is very grateful for the financial help Kiva has offered.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 53 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Walid has owned a grocery store since 1993. Walid requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Walid is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Walid will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Annet Nambi‘S Group

texts.en:
Annet, 48, is married and has six children, all between the ages of 15 and 30. Three of her children attend school, while the rest already work. Annet's elder brother is helping her pay the school fees. Annet also takes care of additional family members and lives in a three-room house with no piped water. She lives and works on the outskirts of Kampala. Annet earns income selling vegetables from a rented stall. She sells to an average of 30 people per day and works six days per week. Annet’s main monthly expenses include rent for the stall, school fees, and medication. She does not incur any transportation costs, because she buys the produce from a place close to her business location. Annet's main business challenges are related to the weather, especially the rainy season which disturbs the customer flow, and the seasonality of the produce that she sells. 
Annet is the leader of a 5-member loan group. She has been with MCDT for over six years and is now asking for her 12th loan which she will share with her group mates. Annet plans to use her loan share to increase the stock of produce, buying directly from farmers, and hopes to also build several rental rooms on a plot of land that she was able to buy using her previous loans.
.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 33 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Jihad has owned an accessory shop since 1991. He sells perfums, nail varnish and other beauty products. Jihad requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the summer season. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan. 
Jihad is special in his work because he sells a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jihad decided on doing his business because he likes trading. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Jihad will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Турсунов Саиджон- мужчина 47 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом скота. У Саиджона имеется  рисовые поля которые дает хороший прибыль ему. Жена Саиджона не где не работает она занимается домашнем хозяйством и присматривает за скотом. Старшую дочку Саиджон выдала замуж теперь накопив денег хочет женит сына который находится на заработках в Казахстане .
texts.en:
Saidjon T. is a 47 year old man. He is married and is the father of 2 children. He fattens livestock. Saijon has rice fields that give him a good profit. Saidjon’s wife does not have a job; she takes care of the house and watches over the livestock. Saidjon married off his older daughter and now having saved money he would like to marry off his son who is earning money in Kazakhstan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten livestock

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Thaer has been making and selling sculpture for eight years. Thaer requested a loan of 600 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his sculptures. This is the first time that Thaer has requested a loan. 
Thaer is speciA. in his work because of his creativity. His clients are engineers and graphic designers. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash. Jihad decided on doing his business because he took after his father’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by making himself known even outside his region.

loans.use: Thaer will use the loan to purchase materials for his sculptures.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is a 56 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their seven children. Taj has owned a grocery store. Taj requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Taj has requested a loan. 
Taj is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. In the future, she plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Taj will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Абдуламитов Бахтиёр- мужчина 43 лет. Женат отец 6-х детей. Бахтиёр занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Он   кредит в первый раз получает. У него пока малое количество скота. Бахтиёр надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Бахтиёр планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашей организации в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Bahtier A. is 43 years old, married and a father of six children. Bahtier raises and sells cattle while his wife sells the milk at the market and makes cheese and yogurt from it. This is his first time taking out a loan. Bahtier currently has only a few animals and would like to use the loan to expand his herd. His wife has only one milk cow and Bahtier would like to purchase another milk cow with calf for his wife. He is very grateful to this organization for making his plans possible.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is a 48 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their seven children. Hamzah has owned a grocery store for two years. He also sells fruits and vegetables. Hamzah requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Hamzah is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on starting a new business in livestock.

loans.use: Hamzah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: nogaye D. est une femme mariée née en 1961 à thies .elle vit avec sa famille à la cité sofraco de thiès;elle fait du commerce depuis les années 1980.elles vend des produits cosmétiques,des habits et des chaussures.avec ce pret ,elle envisage de compléter son fonds pour dédouaner sa marchandise qui est au port.
texts.en:
Nogaye D. is a married woman who was born in 1961 in Thies. She lives with her family in the Cité Sofraco neighborhood of Thiès. She has been in business since the 1980s. She sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes. With this loan, she expects to have enough funds to get her merchandise out of customs at the port.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: paying customs duties for her merchandise

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 30 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Hanan has owned a hairdressing salon for five years. She also does makeup and sells some beauty products. Hanan requested a loan of 800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her. This is her second cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loan helped her diversify her merchandise and improve her salon. Hanan is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her work because she wanted to depend on herself and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hanan will use the loan to purchase beauty products for her.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 49 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Adel has been working in construction for thirty years. Adel requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Adel is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his work by purchase a sophisticated machine.

loans.use: Adel will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 34 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Sami has been working as a fuel distributor for nine years. Since, in his region there is a lot of electricity shot down, the inhabitants needs to have a generator to have electricity. Sami requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase fuel. This is the first time that Sami has requested a loan. 
Sami is speciA. in his work because he serves the people in his village. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a gasoil station.

loans.use: Sami will use the loan to purchase fuel.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Il exerce le métier de tailleur depuis 1989. Après 4 ans d'apprentissage chez son frère , ce dernier lui avait donné des moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Maintenant il travaille en collaboration avec son cousin au quartier som. Il envisage d'acheter une machine à coudre et des tissus pour préparer les fêtes religieuses.
texts.en:
He has been working in the trade of tailoring since 1989 after four years of apprenticeship with his brother, who had given him the means to open a workshop. Now, he’s working in collaboration with his cousin in the Som district. He envisions buying a sewing machine and some fabrics in preparation for religious celebrations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Murad

texts.ru: Ахмедов Мурад – мужчина 44 лет. Женат отец 5-х детей. Мурад занимается откормом скота. На полученный займ он хочет купит 2 средных бычка и через 6 месяцом когда они станут большими продать. Мурад очень хороший плотник он имеет собственную бригаду. Жена и дети ухаживают за домашнем скотом. Жена и дочери Мурада занимаются переработкой пряжи. Мурод имеет 10 летный стаж работы в сфере скотоводства.
texts.en:
Murad A. is 44 years old. He is married and has five children. Murad makes his living fattening cattle for subsequent sale at the meat market. He wants to use this loan to buy two medium sized calves and when they grow up in six month he will sell them for profit. Murad is also a very skilled woodworker, he has his own team of men who work with him. Murad's wife and children take care of his herd and the women also spin wool for sale. Murad has ten years of experience in raising cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calves

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Тухтаназаров Абдувохид- мужчина 51 лет. Женат отец 5 –х детей. Абдувохид занимается откормом скота. На полученный за он хочет купит бычка и на оставшееся сумму корм для него. Абдувохид является арендатором дехканского хозяйства и настоящее время занимается сбором урожая т.е помидоров.  Абдувохид узнал о нашей организации по рекламе пришел в наш офис теперь он наш клиент.
texts.en:
Abduvohid T. is 51 years old. He is married and has five children. Abduvohid raises cattle for sale. He is planning to use this loan to buy a calf and feed for it. Abduvohid also rents land from the farmer's co-op and is currently harvesting tomatoes. Abduvohid learned about our organization from an advertisement and he came to our office to become a client.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Saadalah

texts.en:
Saadalah is a 55 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their six children. Saadalah has owned a painting shop since 1970. He also sells all type of tools. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Saadalah has requested a loan. 
Saadalah is special in his work because he has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Saadalah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife. Mohamad has owned a grocery store since 1999. Mohamad requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 
Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is a 35 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Mehdi has owned a sweet shop for a year. He does Lebanese sweets. Mehdi requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for his shop. This is the first time that Mehdi has requested a loan. 
His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because of his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Mehdi will use the loan to  purchase merchandise and raw materials for his shop.

loans.name: Atifa

texts.en:
Atifa is a 56 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Atifa has been working as a sewer since 2006. She sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. Atifa requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing. This is her fourth cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loans helped her purchase a new sewing machine and improve her work. Atifa is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Atifa will use the loan to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru: Шарипов Абдулхаким проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Абдулхаким вот уже более 15 лет занимается услугой такси. Этот вид услуги, является единственным источником дохода. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en:
Abdulhakim S. lives in the Hamadoni region of Tajikistan. He is 35 years old, married and has eight children. Abdulhakim has been working for 15 years as a taxi driver. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Abdulhakim would like to use this loan to repair his taxi cab.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of taxi cab

loans.name: Foni

texts.en:
Foni M., 42, is widowed and has 4 children who all attend school. She earns income selling foodstuffs, including cooked rice, beans, and meat, at her resturant and currently needs a loan to increase the stock of beans, rice, and meat, so that she is able to expand her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs when measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, meat, and rice for a resturant

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna M. makes a living selling soda and is seeking a loan to buy more crates of soda to sell. She is 41 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. With the extra income generated by this loan, she hopes to build her own shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu J. makes a living selling brewed alcohol, and is applying for a loan to buy more of the materials and ingredients she needs to make this beverage. She is 35 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she plans to open up a bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy brewing materials and ingredients

loans.name: Apostolico - Group 1

texts.en:
Amancia E. lives with her husband. Her children, who range in age from 23 to 40, no longer live with her or support her financially. She started selling clothes in her area in order to generate some income. She will start her sixth loan cycle with Esperanza International. The other group members not only appointed her to be the group coordinator because she is the eldest, but also because she is an example of hard work and diligence.

Amancia will use her loan to purchase some new, fresh summer clothing to sell, including women's apparel, in anticipation of Mother's Day. She hopes her business will continue succeeding as it has thanks to her five previous loans. She would also like to set up a space in her house or in a market where she can sell her merchandise without becoming exhausted.

Please help us to continue supporting Amancia and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To invest in new clothing to renew her inventory

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is 28 years old and makes a living selling bread. She is applying for this loan to open her own bakery. Her husband is a farmer, and they have four children, three boys and one girl, all of whom are in school. With the profits made possible by this loan, Poni hopes to pay for the cost of her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a bakery

loans.name: Apostolico - Group 2

texts.en:
Wendy R. is married and has three children, ages 6, 10 and 13. She lives in San Pedro D. Macoris in Southeast Dominican Republic. Wendy has some high school education, but has not been able to get a formal job, so she has a small store in her house. Wendy sells all kinds of merchandise from clothing to accessories and home products. This new loan will be used to keep her inventory in shape and meet her clientele's demands.

Wendy would like to have her own store in downtown San Pedro "where all the movement is." But she is an ambitious woman and does not expect to be a retailer forever. Wendy dreams of going to college and majoring in psychology.

Please help us continue supporting Wendy's dream so she can achieve her goals. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise to replenish inventory

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna E. makes a living selling tomatoes and green vegetables, and is applying for this loan to open up a butcher's shop. She is 35 years old and married a businessman who owns a shop in the nearby Juba market. Tuna has five children who attend school. With the extra profits made possible by expanding her business, Tuna hopes to build her own home.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a butcher's shop

loans.name: Camino A La Santidad - Group 4

texts.en:
Eransly M. is the coordinator of this group of five entrepreneurs. She is married and has six children, ages 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3. Eransly sells music CDs on the streets of San Pedro. She will use her loan to buy more CDs to sell. Eransly barely has some elementary school education.

She hopes her work will bring blessings from God for her family and that her profits will allow her to provide better for her children. She also wants to own a car to go to farther places to sell her CDs. On behalf of the Camino a la Santidad Group, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase CDs to resell

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo con señoras con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con la ayuda crediticia que será otorgada por La Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas cuentan con trabajos propios y luchan día a día para ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a la familia.  Las mismas tienen el deseo de invertir el crédito en su trabajo esto les facilitara con una herramienta para mejorar sus negocios. 

Este grupo de señoras se unierón con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida atravez de la formación grupo solidario y están dispuestas a ayudarse, cada una tiene una responsabilidad que asumen de manera conjunta, son personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, poseen el espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de progresar conjuntamente.- Algunas señoras llevan un monto de 500.000gs. Otras un  monto de 300.000 gs. 

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:  

Blanca Rosa G. - 	Almacen
Yeni Ramona B. - 	Carnicería Despensa
Enriqueta Catalina P. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Epifania B. Mereles - 	Panadería
Maura I.	-  Vendedora Ambulante-Vendedora de Planteras
Eugenia B. Insfrán - 	Almacén
Graciela A.	-  Copetín
Graciela F. - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Teodora López	-  Almacén
Virginia C.	 - Vendedora ambulante de comestibles
Benita G. - 	Kiosko
Marta M.	-  Carbonería
Virginia M. - 	Venta de Ropas Interiores
Eleria S. - 	Venta de Ajos
Maria del Rosario I. - 	Venta de Mandioca y Verduras
Miguelina López	-  Venta de Ropas
Lorenza López	-  Venta de Ropas Usadas
Blanca Beatriz M. - 	Vendedora de Cubiertos
Florentina Muñoz - 	Vendedora Ambulante de Frutas y Verduras
texts.en:
This group is formed by women driven to continue working with the financial support of Fundación Paraguaya. Each of the women has her own job and fights day after day to earn money to sustain her family. They also wish to invest credit in their work as a tool to improve their businesses. This group of women came together with the aim of improving their quality of life through a solidarity group. They are willing to help one another, and each has joint responsibilities. They are humble, hardworking people with an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to progress together. Some seek a loan of 500,000 PYG; others, 300,000 PYG. The members and their activities are: Blanca Rosa G. - Grocery store Yeni Ramona B. - Butcher's shop Enriqueta Catalina P. - Clothing sales Epifania B. Mereles - Bakery Maura I. - Door-to-door planter sales Eugenia B. Insfrán - Grocery store Graciela A. - Snack bar Graciela F. - Fruit and vegetable sales Teodora López - Grocery store Virginia C. - Door-to-door grocery sales Benita G. - Kiosk Marta M. - Fuel sales Virginia M. - Underwear sales Eleria S. - Garlic sales Maria del Rosario I. - Cassava and vegetable sales Miguelina López - Clothing sales Lorenza López - Used clothing sales Blanca Beatriz M. - Cutlery sales Florentina Muñoz - Door-to-door fruit and vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door-to-door vendors: more products to sell--fruits, vegetables, merchandise, etc.; Dressmakers: fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Apai

texts.en:
Apai F. makes a living running a shop where she sells various goods, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is 50 years old, married to a police officer and has four children, one of whom is studying management and information technology while the other three are in primary school. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Sarah Kanyike‘S Group

texts.en:
Sarah, age 50, is the group leader for a group of five members. She is a single mother of seven children, aged between 16 and 28 years. Four of her children go to school. She owns and resides in an eight-roomed house, which she shares with 13 people. Sarah also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. She ensures that the family gets three meals a day.

Sarah works and lives in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal in Bwaise market in one of Kampala's suburbs and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business premises, school fees, and food for the family. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her.

Sarah and her current group mates have been with MCDT for over four years and they are now requesting their eighth loan. Sarah wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal. She aspires toward seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premises for her charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale at market

loans.name: Amigas Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La Fundación Paraguaya briD. a este grupo de señoras la oportunidad de cambio con un apoyo crediticio, ellas cuentan con trabajos propios, son luchadoras para ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a la familia.  Las mujeres tienen el deseo de invertir el crédito en su trabajo porque esto les facilitará con una herramienta para mejorar sus negocios.

Este grupo se formo con señoras con un gran espíritu emprendedor.  Ellas se unierón con el deseo de mejorar su calidad de viD. atravez de la formación de un  grupo solidario.  Las mismas poseen caD. una un trabajo en donde invertir su  crédito y lo asumen de manera conjunta,  una responsabilidad de apoyarse y demostrar que desean progresar en lo laboral.  Ellas son personas sencillas y muy trabajadoras.  Poseen el espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de progresar conjuntamente.  Algunas señoras llevan un monto de 800.000gs. Otras un monto de 500.000 gs y 300.000gs.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son: 

SunilD. Elizabenh G. - 	Compra y Venta de Carne de Cerdo
María Isabel O. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
AgueD. M. - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras en el M. municipal
Felicia F. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Rosanna D. S. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Margarita F. -	Vendedora Ambulante de Frutas y Verduras
Fermina F.  - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Angelina Gavilán - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras

texts.en:
Fundación Paraguaya brings this group of women the opportunity for change with the help of credit. They each have their own jobs, and fight to earn money to support their families. The women wish to invest the credit in their jobs as a tool to improve their businesses. This group is comprised of women with a great entrepreneurial spirit. They came together with the desire to improve their quality of life through the formation of a solidarity group. They each have a job in which to invest credit, and they take on jointly the responsibility to help one another and demonstrate their desire to progress in their work. They are simple, hardworking people. They have an entrepreneurial spirit and the will to move forward together. Some of the women are seeking loans of 800,000 PYG; others, 500,000 PYG or 300,000 PYG. The members and their activities are: SunilD. Elizabenh G. - Purchase and sale of pork María Isabel O. - Clothing sales AgueD. M. - Fruit and vegetable sales in municipal market Felicia F. - Clothing sales Rosanna D. S. - Clothing sales Margarita F. - Door-to-door sales of fruits and vegetables Fermina F. - Clothing sales Angelina Gavilán - Fruit and vegetable sales NilD. M. - Fruit and vegetable sales in municipal market Felicia A. - Fuel sales Teodora R. - Grocery store María Concepción A. - Door-to-door sales of cassava and vegetables Sara A. - Grocery store Lucia G. - Clothing sales Ciriaca T. - Grocery store Isabel M. - Clothing sales Rosalia G. - Grocery store Zulma G. - Silver jewelry sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door-to-door vendors: more products to sell--fruits, vegetables, merchandise, etc.; Dressmakers: purchase fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina es una mujer de 30 años, que toda su vida trabajó para salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Tiene un puesto de venta de celulares en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus celulares se venden rápidamente, ya que tiene los modelos más solicitados en stock, además que es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre está de buen humor.
