A Karina lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos sobre el celular que más les convendría, ella desea tener su propia tienda de celulares, ya que la que usa actualmente es alquilada. Lleva 5 años realizando este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es cubrir la demanda que tiene de celulares, ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para incrementar su stock. Es el primer préstamo que adquiere Karina con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere causarle problemas al resto de socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy apreciada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los quinientos cincuenta nuevos soles, los invertirá en comprar más celulares, con los cuales pueda mejorar la variedad de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Karina is a 30-year-old woman who has worked her whole life to get ahead. She lives in her parents' home, and wants most to forge a good future for herself. She has a shop where she sells cellular phones on one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. Her phones sell quickly, as she has the most popular models in stock, and also because she is a very happy saleswoman, always in a good mood. What Karina likes most about her job is conversing with her customers and advising them about which phone best suits them. She would like to have her own cell phone store, as her current location is rented. She has been in this business for five years, and the most difficult part for her is meeting the demand, as she does not currently have the necessary capital to increase her stock. This is Karina's first loan with MFP. She expects that she will be punctual with her payments, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the rest of the members in her communal bank, where the responsibility she demonstrates is much appreciated. She will invest the 550 soles in the purchase of more phones, which will improve the variety of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa vive en la casa que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a sus 33 años tiene muchas ganas de progresar en la vida y sabe que con mucho trabajo lo puede lograr. Su actividad principal es la costura, se gana la vida haciendo vestidos, pantalones, chales, etc, es una costurera muy ágil y rápida, ella distribuye sus productos en las pricnicpales boutiques de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus prendas son vendidas o alquiladas rápidamente debido a los bonitos acabados que tienen sus creaciones. Rosa gusta también de realizar tejidos, sabe que mientras más lo haga, sus acabados serán mejores, lo más difícil es trabajar bajo presión, ya que muchas veces recibe pedidos que tiene que cumplir con mucha puntualidad. Con los 7 años de experiencia que tiene en este trabajo, ha decidido hacer crecer su negocio y espera para un futuro cercano tener una tienda propia, donde pueda vender sus tejidos y prendas ella misma. Es el primer préstamo de Rosa con MFP, viene ahorrando el dinero de sus ventas para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y alegre, que siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos materiales, para realizar más confecciones y generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in a house that she obtained with much effort. She is a hard-working woman. At 33 years old, she has a desire to move forward in life and knows that with a lot of work, she can succeed. She sews and makes a living producing dresses, pants, shawls, etc… She is an agile and quick seamstress. She distributes her products in the main boutiques in the city of Juliaca. Her garments are quickly sold or rented due to the beautiful finishes on her creations. Rosa also likes to make fabrics. She knows that the more she does, the better the finishes. The most difficult thing is to work under pressure. Often she receives orders that she has to complete on deadlines. With seven years of experience in this work, she has decided to expand her business and hopes to have her own shop in the near future, where she can sell her fabrics and garments herself. This is her first loan with MFP. She has been saving money from her sales so that she can make her payments on time. She is a friendly and happy member that always works for the wellbeing of her community bank. With the thousand Nuevos Soles ($350 USD) that she requests, she will buy new materials so that she can make more items and earn better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make garments

loans.name: Camino A La Santidad - Group 2

texts.en:
The members of this group are embarking on their second loan as clients of Esperanza International.

Yane D. L. R., their group representative, is 39 years old and single. She has some high school education.

Yane has a small colmado (convenience store). Her customers generally purchase the food items they need for every meal only when they need them, because they don't have refrigerators in their homes. Due to this daily sale model, she must have her business well stocked.

The best-selling items in the colmado are rice, beans, oil, and candy. Some of her clients have "accounts" and pay her on paydays, which is a challenge for her (collecting payments).

Yane believes that being a client of Esperanza will be a blessing to her life. She also wants to have a car of her own to move around and get her supplies.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy consumer goods to resell

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: A sus 20 años, Yovana tiene la necesidad de trabajar para pagar sus estudios técnicos, vive en la casa de un tío, quien la apoya desde que llegó a Juliaca de su natal Arapa (Pueblo del departamento de Puno) y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Siendo todavía joven, ha puesto en marcha un negocio que le está dando buenos resultados, tiene un restaurante, el cual es muy concurrido por los comensales de su barrio, la sazón que le pone a sus comidas y la amable atención que brinda, son las principales armas con las que cuenta para atraer a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y escuchar los halagos que recibe de algunos clientes, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que atender sola a toda la gente que asiste a su restaurante. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su negocio crezca y que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, para así poder salir adelante. Es el primer  préstamo al que accede Yovana con MFP, espera no tener problemas en pagar todas sus cuotas, en su banco comunal le tienen mucha confianza, ya que es una de las socias más serias y cumplidas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, incrementará la cantidad de sillas y mesas de su negocio, para poder atender a más personas.
texts.en:
At 20 years old, Yovana needs to work to pay for her technical studies. She lives in the house of an uncle who has supported her since she arrived in Juliaca from her native Arapa (Department of Puno). What she would like most is to forge a good future. Still young, she has started a business that is giving good results. She has a restaurant that is very popular for meals in her neighborhood. The seasonings that she puts on her food and the friendly service that she offers are her principal means of attracting customers. What she likes best is to cook and hear the compliments that she receives from her customers. She has worked in this for one year, and the most difficult for her is to have to alone serve everyone that comes to the restaurant. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and improve her income so that she can get ahead. This is the first loan that Yovana has taken with the MFP. She expects to have no problem making her payments. In her community bank, she is trusted as a serious and accomplished member. With the 800 Nuevos Soles ($275 USD), she will increase the amount of chairs and tables in her business to be able to serve more people.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Yuri es padre soltero, tiene 41 años y vive con su querido hijo Ángel de 11 años en la casa de sus familiares, trabaja muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde muy temprano lleva su mercadería hasta la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca) donde la vende de manera ambulatoria. A Yuri le gusta mucho vender ropa y ganar dinero, con el cual pueda cuidar a su hijo, anhela poner una tienda grande donde pueda vender prendas variadas y accesibles para sus clientes. Para él trasladar su mercadería hasta el lugar de venta es lo más difícil de su trabajo, ya que siempre lleva gran cantidad. Tiene 10 años en este negocio y lo que más quiere es brindarle a su hijo unos buenos estudios, para que sea un buen profesional. Es el segundo préstamo de Yuri con MFP, no quiere fallar en el pago de sus cuotas, porque sabe que eso le traería problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es uno de los socios más antiguos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas para elegir.
texts.en:
Yuri is a single father. He is 41 years old and lives with his beloved 11-year-old son Ángel in the home of his relatives. He works very hard to move up in life. Yuri makes a living selling clothing. From very early in the morning he takes his merchandise to the Explanada Laguna Temporal (where they have the flea markets in the city of Juliaca) where he sells his products outdoors. Yuri really enjoys selling clothes and making money, with which he can care for his son. His goal is to setup a big store where he can sell various and accessible garments to his customers. For him, the most difficult thing about his work is transferring his merchandise to his sales post because he's always taking a lot of items. He has 10 years experience in the business and what he wants most is to provide his son with a good education so he can grow up to be a good professional. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has never missed a payment, which he knows would present problems for his community bank, where he's one of the oldest members. With the 1500 soles he's requesting, he plans to purchase more clothing in order to offer his customers a wider selection of garments to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion - Group 1

texts.en:
Francia Castelli and the rest of this group of five live in Batey 18 in La Romana. It is a small, isolated batey (a company town where sugar cane plantation workers live); barely two streets long. Almost all of its population are Haitian inmigrants. They go to La Romana (the main town in their province) to sell their goods, because a lot of the people from the batey sell the same products.

Francia and her husband, Andres Pie Charles, have two small children, ages 3 and 2. The house in which they live is owned by the sugar cane company that runs the plantation that surrounds the batey. The type of businesses that people in the batey can operate are very limited, so with this new loan, Francia will buy home products, like towels and sheets, to sell in La Romana on market days.

Francia would like to live in a place where she can set up a store and own her house. She believes that even though she is an immigrant, she can work to make her dreams come true in the Dominican Republic.

Please help us support Francia and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase home products to resell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Greetings from Vestine D., a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband have a 3-year-old child. She lives in Gatsata sector in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Vestine owns a shop in the Nyarugenge district in which she sells different kinds of shoes. Mrs. D. is seeking her first loan of 500,000 Rwf (Rwandan francs) from Vision Finance Company, a division of World Vision Rwanda. With this loan, she will expand her business.

Vestine has four years experience in her business. She earns a monthly profit of $705 and her husband has a monthly income of $365. In her business, Mrs. D. employs one worker who helps her to run it smoothly. She starts daily operations at 8:00 a.m and finishes at 8:00 p.m. With the increased profit from her loan, she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Valentina C., quien se entero del programa Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya y le gusto mucho, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas del Asentamiento Org. Nuevo Horizonte para trabajar juntas y poder progresar. Ellas se llevan muy bien, son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, modista, realizan bordados, elaboran panificados, tienen despensa, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 515.384.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son: 

1	Valentina C..	Venta de comidas.
2	Blanca E..  Venta de comidas.
3	Rumilda V..	Venta de Zapatos.
4	Zully R..	Bordados.
5	Claudelina R..	Venta de comidas.
6	Cerena O..	Despensa.
7	Eva F..	Venta de Verduras.
8	Jorgelina C..	Venta de comidas.
9	Leopoldina O..	Venta de verduras.
10	Ana S..	Almacen.
11	Hildalicia M..	Venta de ropas.
12	Zara V..	Manicurista.
13	Zulma M..	Venta de ropa.
14	Nadia F.. 	Venta de lenceria.
15	Nelida E..	Despensa
16	Emilce F..	Venta de mandioca
17	Maria L..	Venta Verduras.
18	Zulma E..	Venta de comidas.
19	Teodora B..	Almacen.
20	Brigida B..	Venta de comidas.
21	Lidia López.	Venta de panificado.
22	Rosana G..	Modista.
23	Liza F..	Venta de Frutas.
24	Maria A..	Kiosko.
25	Leonora B..	Modista.
26	Maria S..	Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Valentina C., who entered the women's committee program with Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya and liked it a lot, and invited her friends and neighbors to form the New Horizons group to work together and make progress. The women have been doing very well. They all do different jobs such as selling clothing, selling food, selling fruit, dressmaking, embroidering, baking, running a general store, etc. Each will receive an average loan of Gs. 515.38.

The members and their occupations are:

1. Valentina C.: Food sales

2. Blanca E.: Food sales

3. Rumilda V.: Shoe sales

4. Zully R.: Embroidery

5. Claudelina R.: Food sales

6. Cerena O.: Convenience store

7. Eva F.: Vegetables sales

8. Jorgelina C.: Food sales

9. Leopoldina O.: Vegetables sales

10. Ana S.: Wholesaler

11. Hildalicia M.: Clothing sales

12. Zara V.: Manicurist

13. Zulma M.: Clothing sales

14. Nadia F.: Lingerie sales

15. Nelida E.: Convenience store

16. Emilce F.: Cassava sales

17. Maria L.: Vegetable sales

18. Zulma E.: Food sales

19. Teodora B.: Wholesaler

20. Brigida B.: Food sales

21. Lidia López: Bakery

22. Rosana G.: Dressmaking

23. Liza F.: Fruit sales

24. Maria A.: Kiosk

25. Leonora B.: Dressmaking

26. Maria S.: Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, snacks; meat; cassava; baking powder; jeans, T-shirts, skirts, shirts; fabrics; lingerie; jewelry; soft drinks; and vegetables.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion - Group 2

texts.en:
Marcelo S. lives in Batey 18, a very impoverished batey (company-run housing for a sugar cane plantation) outside of La Romana in the southeast Dominican Republic.

Batey 18 is a small community of about 20 houses, all of which are occupied by Haitian immigrants who come to work on the sugar cane fields. It is hard for them to do business in this community. The only time that people have money is during the sugar cane season when they get paid per pound of cut cane. In order to make decent profits, Marcelo has to sell on the streets of La Romana.

Marcelo will purchase house products, such as kitchen-ware, to sell. He hopes to make some good sales with Mother's day coming. Marcelo is married to Antonia Celestino and they have four children. One of his goals is to send his children to a better school so they can improve their education.

On behalf of the members of the Canal de Bendicion group, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy home use items to resell

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes Gómez P. tiene la edad de 28 años, ella es una mujer casada. María tiene 2 hijos y todavía no asisten a una escuela. María tiene la actividad económica de la venta de ropa y calzado. Dio inicio a este negocio de una manera muy humilde, por que la cantidad con la que inicio fue muy poca, esto no le impidió salir adelante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que su mayor propósito es mantener este negocio para sacar adelante a su familia. los sueños de María son de establecer un local mas amplio para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes Gómez P. is 28 years old and married. She has two children who still aren't school age. María makes a living selling clothing and footwear. She started this business very humbly with few items to sell, but this did not stop her from making headway and she has now 10 years of experience. Her main goal is to stay with the business and keep pushing ahead for her family. Her dream is to set up a larger store in order to provide a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos - Group 1

texts.en:
Cristobalina C. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to Alejandro Lopez and they have two children ages 19 and 13. She sells clothing on the street of San Pedro de Macoris. People recognize Cristobalina as a good seller who always knows what her customers want and what is currently in demand.

Because the summer is approaching and temperatures are rising, Cristobalina will use this loan to purchase light, fresh children's and women's clothing to sell. She often purchases in San Pedro, but sometimes she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital city, to purchase clothing in the commercial district.

Cristobalina is working hard to generate profits that will help her cover the expenses to finish her house. She started building a couple years ago, but has to build "one wall at a time," because construction materials are rather expensive. She hopes not only to finish her house with her business profits, but to also support her children's chidren's education and see them "achieve realization in their lives."

Please help us to continue supporting Cristobalina and the rest of this Bank of Hope. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Nadia Belén Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se conformó el grupo denominado Nadia Belén, quienes luego de interiorizarse sobre el reglamento de Comites de Mujeres Empredadoras, aceptaron y conformaron dicho comité por los múltiple beneficios que presenta el programa.  Está integrada por 15 activas y sacrificadas  mujeres, encontrándose en el quinto ciclo del programa. Pues cada una de ellas ponen lo mejor de si para mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle lo  mejor a sus respectivas familias. Sacrificándose al máximo para salir adelante, pues algunas de las integrantes están accediendo a Gs. 1.000.000, ellas consideran un monto muy importante, por que si no fuera por el programa sería imposible percibir dicho monto en forma individual.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:  

1	Miryan B..	Venta de comestibles
2	Ma. Margarita M..	Venta de verduras
3	Mariana M..	Venta de prod. avon
4	Sandra B..	Costurera
5	Dionisia A..	Empleada
6	Lidia C.	Almacén.
7	Ma. Veronica L..	Empleada
8	Estanislaa B..	Venta de bebidas
9	Eulogia L..	Venta de carne y verduras
10	Cirila F..	Empleada
11	Luisa A..	Venta de frutas
12	Gladys V..	Venta de mercería
13	Viviana M.. 	Vendedora ambulante
14	Juana L.. 	Venta de comestibles
15	Ana E.. 	Costurera
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, 15 kilometers from the office of Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya, is where the Nadia Belén group was formed. The members were trained in the ways of women's business groups and learned of the many benefits of the program. The group is made up of 15 active and selfless women and is on its fifth loan cycle. Every member does the best she can to increase their earning and provide the best for their family. They all make sacrifices to get ahead, and they agree to take on the loan because if they didn't have the group it'd be impossible to get that amount on their own.

The members and their activities are:

1. Miryan B.: Food sales

2. Ma. Margarita M.: Vegetables sales

3. Mariana M.: Selling Avon products

4. Sandra B.: Seamstress

5. Dionisia A.: Maid

6. Lidia C.: Wholesaler

7. Ma. Veronica L.: Maid

8. Estanislaa B.: Drink sales

9. Eulogia L.: Sale of meats and vegetables

10. Cirila F.: Maid

11. Luisa A.: Fruit sales

12. Gladys V.: Haberdashery sales

13. Viviana M.: Outdoor merchant

14. Juana L.: Food sales

15. Ana E.: Seamstress


Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans will be invested in every one of the members' respective activities, for instance, needles, fabric, meat, flour, sugar, baking products, vegetables, fruits, milk products, soft drinks and haberdashery products, etc.

loans.name: Erick Jose

texts.es: Erick José Núñez Juárez tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es casado. Erick tiene 1 hijo y todavía no asiste a una escuela. La actividad económica es compra y venta de ropa. Erick inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación Erick mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es que tiene que recorrer muchos kilómetros en busca de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, calzado entre otros. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar. Los sueños de Erick son de proporcionarle a su único hijo una buena profesión para que se defienda en la vida.
texts.en:
Erick José Núñez Juárez is a 26-year-old married father with 1 child who has not yet started school. He buys and sells clothing for a living. Erick started this business because he did not have a job at the time, and his wife and child needed daily sustenance. Despite how difficult his situation is, Erick keeps a cheerful attitude with his customers. He has been in business for over 6 years. The most difficult aspect of his job is having to travel many kilometers in search of customers. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase undergarments, footwear, and other merchandise. Despite the problems he faces, such as having to collect payments, Erick still dreams of providing his son with a good profession so that he can get by in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence S. is twenty-eight years old. He is not married but he has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in the primary school. He lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His children live their mother.

Lawrence is a trader. He sells all types of mobile phones and accessories such as housing, keypads, etc., in a store at the market square. Lawrence buys his goods from Kumasi. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He hopes to expand his business and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is thirty-six years of age. She is married and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. 

Gladys is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat – beef, turkey, chicken, etc. She buys the meat from big cold stores in Kumasi. Gladys has been in business for over two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her daughter to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat for her cold store

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos - Group 2

texts.en:
Danilza P. lives in La Mina, a small batey (a company town where sugar workers live) in the municipality of Consuelo, outside San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. She and her husband, Cristobal Montero, have three children. Danilza went to middle school, but did not complete it, so providing a good education for her children is extremely important to her.

Danilza sells clothing, both in her neighborhood and on the nearby streets. She sells on credit to some of her clients, and then they pay her back on their pay days. This represents a challenge for her, because not everyone pays her on time and she spends a considerable amount of time doing collections.

Danilza wants to see her business grow. She wants to set up a boutique with more varied clothing items. She hopes her children have a better future and can continue studying for the careers of their choices. On behalf of Danilza and the rest of this Bank of Hope, we thank you for your support

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam A. is fifty years of age. She is a married mother of six children – three daughters and three sons. She says some of the children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Enyonam is a food vendor. She cooks and sells kenkey (prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kinds of soup and fried fish or meat). She prepares the food in her house and sells on a table in her community. She buys bags of maize and other ingredients from shops in her town.

Enyonam has been in business for over eleven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda S. is thirty-two years of age. She is a married mother of two children – both daughters. She says both of her daughters are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Linda is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice – fried rice, rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house of residence and sells in a container (kiosk) by a roadside in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from shops in her town. She sells from morning till evening.

Linda has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Linda desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se conformó el grupo denominado San José, nombre por el cual han optado por ser miembros del barrio con dicho nombre, quienes luego de interiorizarse sobre el reglamento de Comite de Mujeres Emprendadoras de Fundacion Paraguaya, aceptaron y conformaron dicho comité por los múltiple beneficios que presenta el programa.  El comite está integrada por 16 activas y sacrificadas  mujeres, encontrándose en el sexto ciclo del programa, sacrificándose al máximo para salir adelante.  Pues cada una de ellas han invertido en sus respectivas actividades, gracias a eso han mejorado considerablemente la calidad de vida tanto de ellas como la de sus familias.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:

Juana S..	Almacén.
Edith M..	Empleada.
Cecilia D..	Venta de carbón.
Rossana C.. 	Venta de comestibles.
Vidalina O..	Venta de comestibles.
Elva V.. 	Venta de frutas y verduras.
Leonida T.. 	Empleada.
Olga Y..	Venta de frutas, verduras y carne.
Elva O..	Costurera.
Amada G..	Cria de cerdo.
Salustiana Orué. 	Kiosko.
Ignacia D..	Vendedora ambulante.
Rocio A..	Venta de comestibles.
Ma. Felisa O..	Costurera.
Gladys C..	Venta de bebidas y carne de cerdo.
Nancy Gómez.	Venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, some 15 km away from the Oficina de Paraguarí, a group called San José was formed, named by the group members who live in the neighborhood with the same name. After familiarizing themselves with the rules and regulations of the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) of Fundacion Paraguaya, the accepted the terms and joined this group because of the numerous benefits the program offers. The group is comprised of 16 active and selfless women, who are now in their sixth loan cycle. They make sacrifices so that they can get ahead since they have all invested in their respective businesses. Thanks to those investments, they have considerably improved their and their families’ quality of life.

The group members are: Juana S.: General store Edith M.: Housekeeper Cecilia D.: Charcoal sales Rossana C.: Food sales Vidalina O.: Food sales Elva V.: Fruit and vegetable sales Leonida T.: Housekeeper Olga Y.: Fruit, vegetable, and meat sales Elva O.: Seamstress Amada G.: Pig farmer Salustiana Orué: Kiosk Ignacia D.: Street vendor Rocio A.: Food sales Ma. Felisa O.: Seamstress Gladys C.: Beverage and pork sales Nancy Gómez: Fruit and vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Thread, pig feed, cornmeal, cheese, eggs, fabric, meat, flour, sugar, bread, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, beverages, candy, etc.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista Pérez tiene la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Juan tiene 2 hijos yo todos estudian. La actividad económica es zapatero. Don Juan inicio este negocio desde muy pequeño, lo cual le ha permitido obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos, actualmente la ubicación  de su negocio es en el mercado central. Los propósitos de Juan con su negocio son de brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio que pueden tener. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar productos como pega, clavos, hilo nylon entre otros todo esto es para materia prima. Los sueños de Juan son de continuar mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista Pérez is a 62-year-old married father of 2 school age children. He is a shoemaker. He started this business at a young age, and it has allowed him to earn a living so that he can support his children. His business is currently located in the central market. Juan’s business goal is to offer the best customer service possible. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase glue, nails, nylon thread and other materials. Juan dreams of continuing to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is forty-three years of age. She is the divorced mother of six children – one son and five daughters. She says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, trading in printed textiles. She buys printed textiles from the depots in Kumasi at a cost-effective price. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Akua also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Akua desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede - Group 1

texts.en:
Ana T. is 63 years old. However, her age has not stopped her from being a multi-tasking entrepreneur. She and her friends in the Dios Todo lo PueD. Group are in their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza and continue going strong. Ana has used the small education she got from elementary school to start several businesses: a cafeteria, a fruit/vegetable stand, and a clothing sales business.

Ana will invest the proceeds from the current loan in her fruit and vegetable stand. She will buy more fruits and vegetables in season (like mangoes) to sell in her small shop. She will invest this loan in her fruit and vegetable stand because food sales generate daily income. Clothing sales are more sporadic, and since clothing is often sold on credit, it can take months for her to collect all the payments.

Ana intends to remodel her house to add space for her three businesses so she won't have to move around so much. She thinks she has a responsibility as group coordinator to be a positive inspirational example, and she certainly is. Thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

(The photo shows her loan group in session with their loan officer, Elizabeth Soto.)

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia A. is twenty-two years of age. She is married and has no child at the moment. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic.

Sylvia is a trader, trading in utensils. She buys her wares from wholesalers in Kumasi at a cost-effective price. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Sylvia also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure utensils in bulk. Sylvia is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora F. is thirty-two years of age, single, and has no child. She lives with her two younger siblings in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Debora is a trader, trading in gas cylinders and their accoutrements such as the tubes, valves, pipes, etc. She sells at a gas-filling station in her town. Debora buys her wares from wholesalers in Kumasi at a cost-effective prices.

Debora has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin to be able to take proper care of her younger siblings.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Ramon Ismael

texts.es: Ramón Ismael J. tiene 49 años de edad, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Ramón es ofrecer los servicios de soldadura. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a nuevas personas y brindar el mejor servicio. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar herramientas soldador de gas, delantal, manoplas y tenazas torno. El humilde sueño de Ramón es poseer un taller con todas las herramientas necesarias ya que es por medio de ellas que logra realizar las construcciones.
texts.en:
Ramón Ismael J. is a married 49-year-old father of 2 children who are currently in school. Ramón offers welding services for a living. He has been in this business for over 5 years. What he most likes about his job is meeting new people and offering the best service. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase tools, gas soldering iron, apron, gloves, tongs, and a lathe. Ramón’s humble dream is to own a workshop with all the necessary welding tools because he needs them to get his projects done.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
CECILIA C. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. César Calvo de Araujo Nº 1030, en el distrito de Callería, tiene 40 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como profesor y tienen 3 hijos mayores.

             Ella tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cual utilizó para comprar panes, gaseosas y venderlo a sus vecinos, ella tiene la ventaja de que por el sector donde vive no venden pan.

             Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará una vitrina para exhibir los  agradables panes y biscochos que ofrece.

             Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque sin tanto trámite en comparación con otras instituciones puede obtener un crédito financiero y mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
CECILIA C. S., a member of the RICARDO PALMA Microfinance Institute, lives in the district of Callería. She is 40 years old, and her husband works as a teacher. They have 3 grown-up children together.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan to purchase bread and soft drinks so that she could sell them to her neighbors. She has the advantage of being the only person who sells bread in the area.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a showcase so that she can display the delicious bread and cakes that she sells.

She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she can obtain a loan and support her business without all the paperwork that the other institutes require.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cabinet

loans.name: Maari

texts.en:
Maari Suley is fifty-four years of age. She is a married mother of five children, one daughter and four sons. Some of her children are in the senior high school and others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Maari is a trader. She sells palm oil. She prepares palm oil and distributes it to retailers in her community. Maari also treks to other markets to sell on their market days. She buys palm nuts from farmers in the surrounding communities.

Maari has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She wants to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. is fifty-one years of age. She is a married mother of four children – three daughters and one son. Some of her children are in senior high school and others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Georgina is a trader. She sells palm oil. She prepares the palm oil and distributes to retailers in her community. Georgina also treks to other markets to sell on their market days. She buys palm nuts from farmers in the surrounding communities. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk.

Georgina hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She wants to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Fidelia Buenaventura

texts.es: Fidelia Buenaventura Rodríguez R. de 46 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Y tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Fidelia se dedica desde hace 15 años a la costura. Por lo que cuando inicio solo realizaba reparaciones de trajes y con el tiempo se fue perfeccionando. Fidelia es una mujer muy bondadosa porque además confecciona trajes para niños muy pobres y los obsequia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de materia prima telas, hilos, botones, zipper entre otros. Sus deseos son de establecer una tienda en donde se exhiban prendas elaboradas por ella.
texts.en:
Fidelia Buenaventura Rodríguez R. is 46 and married. She has three children who all work independently. Fidelia has worked as a seamstress for fifteen years. When she started she only mended clothes. With time, she was perfecting her skills. Fidelia is a very generous person; she makes clothes for very poor children and gives them to them. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy raw materials like fabric, needles, buttons, zippers, among other things. Her wish is to set up a store where she can display the clothing she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
Estefita es Socia del Banco Comunal ”LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2” vive en La Urbanización Municipal Mz. H3 Lt. 16, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos mayores de edad .
Desde muy joven Estefita vendía plátanos, la primera vez que obtuvo su préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles lo invirtió comprando abarrotes para formar su tiendita.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 surtirá mas su tiendita con abarrotes, golosinas y también comprará plátanos y así tener mas clientela.

Ella agradece Manuela Ramos por que es la única institución que le presta dinero y se siente feliz porque comparte  momentos inolvidables junto a las demás socias de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Estefita is a member of La Flor de la Canela 2 Community Bank. She lives at La Urbanización Municipal Mz. H3 Lt. 16. She is 67, and she has seven grown children. From a very early age she has sold bananas. The first time she got a loan for 300 PEN she bought groceries to set up her small store. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will stock her little store with more groceries and sweets. She will also buy more bananas, and that way she will have more customers. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is the only institution that lends her money. She feels happy because she shares unforgettable moments together with the rest of the members of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries, sweets, fruit.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Melania Pérez de 42 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua Villa Reconciliación, casada, su esposo se desempeña como albañil, tiene tres hijos. Dentro de sus planes la construcción de su casa es un hecho que ha corto plazo realizaran. Doña Melania mujer emprendedora que tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace siete años, iniciándolo con fondo propio y pocas cantidades de productos. Le da las gracias  Afodenic por la oportunidad que le brinda con el préstamo para crecer y mejorar su nivel de vida. Este es su noveno ciclo  y lo va invertir en la  compra de productos como: ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, nuevos productos de uso cotidianos para incrementar su inventario y captar nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Comprar ropa para dama y caballeros

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-four years of age. She is married and has given birth to seven children – three sons and four daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with the children and her husband in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Mary’s husband is a farmer while she is a trader. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in ladies’ secondhand clothes such as dresses, underwear, etc. She also sells bed sheets. Mary buys from Kumasi and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Mary has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Mary desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is forty-one years of age. She is married and has given birth to seven children – three sons and four daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with the children and her husband in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer while she is a trader.

Mary works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She sells provisions in a small kiosk in front of her house. She also sells vegetables. Mary buys from Kumasi. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Mary desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her kiosk

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza T. T. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es casada. María tiene 1 hijo y estudia en una escuela pública. La actividad económica de María es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, María tiene muy pocos recursos económicos y fue por una amiga decidió establecer este negocio, y mejorar su vida. Además esta agradecida por tener este humilde trabajo, que esta ubicado en su vivienda. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales y granos básicos. Su deseo es que su hijo logre terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Esperanza T. T. is 48, and she is married. María has one son; he goes to public school. María has a mini market. She has had this business for over five years. María has very few economic resources. It was because of a friend that she decided to establish this business and improve her life. Also, she is grateful to have this humble work, which is located in her home. The loan she is asking for is to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, and basic grains. Her wish is for her son to complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lukaya

texts.en:
Lukaya A. is forty years of age. She is a married mother of three children – one son and two daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Lukaya is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells it on a table by a road side in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from shops in her town. She sells from morning to afternoon.

Lukaya has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
DIANA D. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” vive en el Jr.Cesar Vallejo Mz.B.Lt.21, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 21 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es moto taxista.

Se inició en el negocio de artículos para belleza , perfumes, y la venta por catálogos, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pocos productos para poder ofertarlos a sus compañeros de la universidad, su negocio ha ido creciendo con el paso del tiempo.  

Hoy, ella está trabajando en sociedad con su hermana en un mismo local vendiendo abarrotes, perfumes y cosméticos.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos, una vitrina y nuevos productos que servirá para surtir su negocio. 

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Diana D. D. belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank. She lives at Jr.Cesar Vallejo Mz.B.Lt.21, in Pucallpa city. She is 21, has one son, and her husband is a “moto taxi” (motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment) driver. She started her business of selling beauty items and perfumes by catalog with her first loan for 300 PEN. She bought a few products to be able to offer them to her colleagues at the university. Her business has been growing with the passage of time. She is now working with her sister in the same place selling groceries, perfume, and cosmetics. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy perfume, cosmetics, a display case, and new products to stock her business. “Manuela Ramos is an ONG (non governmental agency) that supports a great number of families with small loans that let the women of this zone start or improve their businesses. I am very happy with this help,” she comments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and cosmetics.  Buy a display case.

loans.name: Nueva Alternativa Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Angelina P. P., D. 31 años D. edad, vive en la zona D. Caja D. Agua en San Juan D. Lurigancho. Ella y su pareja están en la espera D. su primer bebé que es la ilusión D. sus vidas, el motivo D. sus esfuerzos y el aliciente para el logro D. sus metas.

Ella es socia activa D. la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Alternativa” y actualmente es la Presidenta D. su grupo (en la fotografía la observamos D. pié), elegida democráticamente, en reconocimiento a sus virtudes como mujer emprendedora.

Tiene un año y medio trabajando con EDAPROSPO, inició su negocio D. venta D. útiles con muy poca mercadería, en su casa. Poco a poco y con la ayuda D. los préstamos solicitados a EDAPROSPO ella pudo comprar más mercadería, mejorar las instalaciones D. su casa para convertirla en una Librería, luego adquirió una computadora con la empezó a brindar servicios D. Internet; en un año, con esfuerzo, sacrificio y mucho ahorro, ella pudo aumentar D. una a cinco  computadoras para el servicio D. Internet.

El préstamo actual lo destinará a la compra D. 2 nuevas computadoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Angelina P. P. is 31 years old and lives in the zone of Caja D. Agua in San Juan D. Lurigancho. She and her partner are awaiting their first baby that is the illusion of their lives, the reason for their efforts and the encouragement to achieve their goals.

She is an active member of the Alcancia Communal "New Alternative" and is currently the President of the group (is the one standing up in the picture). She was democratically elected in recognition of her capacity as an entrepreneur woman.

She has been working for the last one and a half year with EDAPROSPO. She started her business at home selling few school supplies. Little by little and with the help of EDAPROSPO loans, she was able to buy more supplies, remodel her house into a book store, and then she bought a computer and began to proviD. internet services. Within a year with effort and saving a lot, she was able to increase from one to five computers with internet services.

She is asking for a loan to buy two new computers.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 new computers, school supplies and improvement of the business

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: María Azucena R. Martínez tiene 40 años, es madre soltera. Y tiene a cargo dos hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente sus padres se hacían cargo del negocio pero murieron debido a la guerra, y una tía se hizo cargo de la finca y de la manutención de María, y fue así que además de dedicarse a este negocio que le enseño su tía, es profesora en un colegio. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de concentrado. Por lo que ha experimentado que los financiamientos son de gran ayuda por que han incrementado sus ingresos para que sus hijos logren estudiar. Su mayor sueño es obtener una buena cantidad de cerdos y vacas para que realmente sea una finca donde produzca leche y otros derivados.
texts.en:
María Azucena R. Martínez, 40, is a single mother raising two minor children. She is a pork butcher. She has been doing this for more than twenty years. Previously her parents were in charge of the business. However, they died as a result of the war. An aunt took over the farm and taking care of María. In addition to running this business that her aunt taught her, she is a school teacher. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy food pellets. From her experience, the loans are a great help that have increased her earnings so that her children can go to school. Her biggest dream is to have a good amount of pigs and cows so that the farm produces milk and other derivatives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan A. is twenty-eight years old. He is married and has three children: two boys and one girl. According to him, all are currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife is a food vendor.

Alhassan is a trader. He runs a provision store which he says is by the roadside. He buys his provisions from Kumasi. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to increase his stock. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Erika Masiel

texts.es: La Señora Ericka M. tiene 25 años de edad, su casa de habitación esta situada en el barrio La Primavera en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es bodeguero en una empresa del país, tiene dos hijos de seis y cuatro años de edad, terminar la construcción de su casa para tener un patrimonio seguro y protegido para el presente y futuro de sus hijos. Doña Ericka se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de venta de joyas, zapatos y ropas desde hace seis años. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic aumentado su inventario y con este préstamo que solicita es para comprar productos como: mayores cantidades de zapatos, prendas, ropas y artículos para damas. Consolidando su negocio y a la misma vez siendo más rentable para elevar sus ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar ropa,zapatos y prendas

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es:
NOELALI G. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 638 , tiene 44 años, tiene 02 hijos mayores e independientes.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en su fuente de soda, compró gaseosas, preparo gelatina, Flan, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará una exhibidora para mostrar sus gaseosas  y postres que ella misma prepara. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos en el tiempo que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una gran ayuda que me ha permitido seguir adelante...... remarcó.
texts.en:
Noelali Gonzalez B. is 44 years old and has 2 children who are independent. She is a client of "LAS DIVINAS" community bank. Her home is located in the Jr. Salaverry N º 638. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which she invested in the purchase of a soda fountain, drinks, gelatins, caramel flans, etc. She is asking for a loan of, $400 to buy a display /refrigerator for the soft drinks and desserts that she prepares. She thanks Manuela Ramos. Because of her great help she has been able to implement her business and keep it growing, she remarked

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display/refrigerator  for desserts

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu A. is twenty-two years old. He is married and has two children: a boy and a girl. According to him, both are currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Yakubu’s wife is a trader. She trades in cereals.

Yakubu is also a trader. He deals in livestock. He sells live animals such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc. He buys all the way from the northern part of the country and sells to the butchers in his community. Yakubu has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure livestock in bulk. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock in bulk

loans.name: Benito Marin

texts.es: Benito Martín Chavarría B. tiene 63 años, Benito tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Benito es un hombre muy responsable que gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener este pequeño negocio, a pesar su difícil condición económica no deja de sonreírles a sus clientes. Con este fin solicita el financiamiento para la compra de más productos como tomates, cebollas, papas y ajo. El sueño de Benito es mejorar su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Benito Martín Chavarría B. is 63, and he is raising three children. He sells fruit and vegetables. He has been doing this for more than thirteen years. Benito is a very responsible man, and thanks to his efforts and dedication he has been able to keep this small business. In spite of his difficult economic situation, he always gives his customers a smile. He is asking for a loan to buy more products like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and garlic. Benito’s dream is to improve his home so that his children can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina R. López tiene 49 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que con mucho esfuerzos ha logrado en le colegio. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, iniciando esta actividad para el bienestar familiar ya que como es madre soltera le ha tocado llevar toda la cargo de su hogar. El financiamiento es para aumentar el negocio y proveer de mejores recursos a su familia. a pesar de que vive de una manera humilde y con ganas de salir adelante sus sueños son de establecer un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina R. López is 49. She is a single mother raising four children. With great effort she has put them in school. She sells clothes. She has been doing this for more than three years. She started the business for the well being of her family. Since she is a single mother, it falls on her to take care of her home. The loan is to expand her business and provide better resources to her family. In spite of the fact that she lives in a humble way, she has the desire to get ahead. She dreams of establishing her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angela Teodora

texts.es: Ángela Teodora S. Vanegasno tiene la edad de 68 años, es una madre soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ángela inicio este negocio por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella tiene los propósitos de seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único que le ayudo salir adelante. Últimamente ha tenido que viajar a muchos departamentos porque algunos clientes les gusta la buena atención que ella brinda. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de bolsos, calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. E sueño de Ángela de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela Teodora S. Vanegasno is 68, and she is a single mother. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than four years. Ángela started this business because she needed to increase her income. She plans to keep running this business since it is the only thing that helps her get ahead. Lately she has had to travel to a lot of departments because some of her customers like the good attention that she offers. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy bags, footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. Angela’s dream is to set up a business in her house and improve the family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Selvaticas Group

texts.es:
El grupo D. señoras  pertenecen al Banco Comunal  “Mujeres Selváticas”,  este  es un Banco Comunal Nuevo, y quien la representa es la Sra. F. D. M. D. F. Josefa con 32 años D. edad, ella vive  en  el Distrito D. Yarina Cocha en el Asentamiento Humano  Faustino Maldonado Jr. Los Rosales Mz. 26 Lt. 08

       	El Banco Comunal esta conformado por 11 socias. Ellas solicitan S/ 4,400 soles. En la actualidad ellas cuentan con diversos tipos D. negocios como: venta D. pescado, bodega, bebidas heladas , artesanía, Venta D. frutas y otros.  Con este dinero comprarán productos e insumos para el desarrollo D. sus negocios.

  	El grupo D. socias están  contentas D. poder contar con el apoyo que  están  recibiendo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos+Credi Mujer, ya que gracias a ello podrán contar con capital propio.  Es un apoyo para que puedan seguir creciendo sus negocios..
texts.en:
This group of women belongs to the Mujeres Selváticas Community Bank. It is a new Community Bank. Sra. F. D. M. D. F. Josefa, 32, represents them. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, in the Asentamiento Humano Faustino Maldonado Jr. Los Rosales Mz. 26 Lt. 08. Eleven members make up the Community Bank. They are asking for 4,400 PEN. They currently have diverse types of businesses like selling fish, grocery store, cold drinks, handicrafts, fruit sales, and others. With this loan they will buy products and supplies to develop their businesses. The group’s members are happy to be able to count on the support they are receiving from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos+Credi Mujer. Thanks to this help, they are able to have their own capital. It is a support that lets them keep expanding their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish, buy various articles for the grocery store, buy drinks, buy supplies for making handicrafts, buy fruit.

loans.name: Warren's Group

texts.en:
T. Warren is the leader of Mwino akuwa group in Jinja. He is a married man with four children (1 girl and 3 boys): all the boys are still in school and the girl is too young.

Warren has three businesses: he has rental houses in Jinja town; he has a hardware shop selling building materials; as well as having a kiosk selling cold drinks and snacks. He is so grateful that the loans help him to run and finance his three businesses every four months and with this, he is able to care for his family’s needs and upkeep.

Warren is also the Chairman LC1 for his village and this leadership responsibility helps to bring in much-needed organization and responsibility among its members. He needs a loan to help pay school fees for his children and also to recapitalize his businesses.

loans.use: To pay school fees and recapitalise his businesses

loans.name: Dominga Anastacia

texts.es: Dominga Anastacia Pérez M. tiene 55 años de edad. Es madre soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Dominga inicio este negocio por que tenia que sufragar los gastos de su familia. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración de repostería, pero este negocio no fue tan rentable como ella pensaba porque tenia que invertir una gran cantidad en materia prima. Por lo que decide incursionar en la venta de mercadería en general ya que este negocio le gusto más. Le financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, ropa interior, cosméticos entre otros.  El sueño de Dominga es poseer una mini tienda.
texts.en:
Dominga Anastacia Pérez M. is 55, and she is a single mother. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for four years. Dominga started this business because she had to pay the family expenses. Previously she made pastry. But, this business was not as profitable as she thought because she had to invest in large amounts of raw materials. That is why she decided to start selling general merchandise. She likes this business more. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy handbags, underwear, and cosmetics, among other things. Dominga’s dream is to have a mini store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro M. García tiene la edad de 38 años. Es hombre casado. Tiene tres hijos a su cargo y todos. La actividad económica de Alejandro es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, el es un hombre muy trabajador, Alejandro tiene muchas dificultades, como lo son sus condiciones económicas algunas veces no se alimenta de la mejor manera, porque algunos de sus clientes salen tempranos a sus trabajos y hace este tipo de sacrificios. Los financiamientos le han ayudado a salir adelante y educar a sus hijos. El financiamiento esta destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, pantalones, camisetas y faldas. El sueño de Alejandro es terminar de construir su vivienda y que sus hijos se conviertan en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandro M. García, 38, is married and raising three children. Alejandro sells general merchandise. He has been doing this for more than six years. He is a very hard working man. Alejandro has a lot of problems such as his economic condition. Sometimes he does not eat right. This is because some of his customers leave early for their work, and Alejandro makes this type of sacrifice. The loan is for working capital to buy handbags, pants, shirts, and skirts. Alejandro’s dream to finish building his house and that his children become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Lunitas Group

texts.es:
En la foto tenemos al  Banco Comunal  “Las Lunitas”  este  es el primer ciclo de este Banco Comunal, la mayoría vive en Jr. calleria, Distrito de Yarinacocha y quien la representa es la Sra. T. C. Loyda Lilly con 34 años de edad ella vende ropa y   vive  en el Distrito de Yarinacocha en el Jr. callaría Mz 157-A Lt. 07. 

       El Banco Comunal esta conformado por 11 socias, ellas confían mucho entre ellas y tienen muchas ganas de hacer crecer sus negocios.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,300 nuevos soles, comprarán ropa , abarrotes, bebidas heladas, plátano y otros con los que podrán hacer crecer mucho mas sus negocios.

  	Ellas  están muy satisfechas por haber ingresado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos - CrediMujer, ya que gracias a ello podrán contar con un capital propio, para darles mejor educación y alimentación a sus familias.
texts.en:
Banco Comunal “Las Lunitas” is in the photo. This is the first loan request from this group. Most of the group members live on Calleria Street, Yarinacocha District. Mrs. T. C. Loyda Lilly, 34 years old, is the leader. She sells clothing and lives at Mz 157-A Lt.07 Calleria Street, Yarinacocha District. This group is composed of 11 members. They confide in each other and wish to expand their businesses. With this loan of $1,100, they will buy clothing, vegetables, cold drinks, bananas and other items that will help their businesses to grow. They are very glad they joined the Movimiento Manuela Ramos - CrediMujer and are grateful they will be able to obtain capital in order to improve their education and feed their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, vegetables, drinks, fruits.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: La Señora Johanna O. a sus 35 años de edad, casada, habitante del barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo le ayuda económicamente ya que se desempeña como ferretero su tramo situado en unos de los mercado de Managua, tiene dos hijos. Seguir mejorando su vivienda es una de su misión. Doña Johanna mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio es una pulpería y también alquiler de cuarto, desde hace dos años y medio de experiencia en atención al cliente. Iniciándolo con fondos de financiamientos y creciendo con el apoyo y la confianza de la micro financieras. Gracia a los préstamos que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado para la cual requiere comprar zinc, reglones y clavos de acero. Ofreciéndole a su familia seguridad y protección y una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para reparar el techo

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Jannett del Socorro Ramírez García tiene 44 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene cinco hijos y tres están a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos, y estos no pasaran por circunstancias tan difíciles en la vida. Los financiamientos le han ayudado a crecer. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa para caballeros y ropa para niños. Su deseo es de brindar a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jannett del Socorro Ramírez García is a forty-four-year-old single mother. Of her five children, three are in her care. Her job for more than 20 years has been the sale of general merchandise. She began this business because she had to support her children and desired that the circumstances of their lives would not be so difficult. Loans have helped her grow. This loan will be used for the purchase of inventory: clothing, footwear, and clothes for men and children. Her desire is to give her children the support necessary to raise their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Loisi

texts.es:
LOISI R. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 667 del distrito de Callería, tiene 36 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como chofer de obras en la municipalidad.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 5 años, con él compro algunas prendas para venderlos en los pueblos rurales por el río.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir y también productos de belleza que posteriormente irá a vender a las afueras de la ciudad

En el tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
LOISI R. V. belongs to the Banco Comunal "Carmen Carbrejos." Her domicile is at 667 Adolfo Morey Street, Callería district. She is thirty-six years old and has four children. Her husband works as a driver for construction projects in the city. She has a business selling clothes and beauty products. The first time she obtained a loan of $100 was five years ago, and she used the money to purchase garments, which she sold in rural towns along the river. She will invest this loan of $675 in a variety of garments and beauty products, which she will sell in areas outside of the city. In the time that she has worked with Manuela Ramos, she is happy about the aid given to women to raise their standard of living and, above all, to help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane K. is the leader of the Lubugumu Twekembe women's group, which has been in existence for six years. She is a hard-working and devoted lady with a business of farming matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and so on, as well as making local brew for sale as a wholesaler and at a retail price for her customers at her bar at her home. She is happy that the loans help her on her farm with buying quality seeds as well as employing manpower, plus buying bananas and yeast used for making her brew. She is a married woman with 10 children, five of whom are still in school while the rest are doing various businesses. She needs a loan to help with paying her children’s school fees and buying bananas and yeast for making her local brew.

loans.use: School fees and buying bananas and yeast for making local brew

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes U. tiene la edad de 31 años, es una mujer casada. Y tiene 3 hijos a cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. María comenzó este negocio porque anteriormente comerciaba todos sus productos de manera ambulante, y con el paso del tiempo decide establecerse en su vivienda para que sus clientes no estuvieran en su búsqueda. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos ropa para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y calzado. Su deseo es aumentar su inventario para dejarles a sus hijos un medio de supervivencia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes U., 31, is married and raising three children. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than five years. María started this business because she used to sell her products on foot. As time passed, she decided to set up in her home so that her customers would not have to look for her. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy products such as women’s clothes, men’s clothes, children’s clothes, and footwear. Her wish is to expand her inventory to leave her children a means of survival.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kathy Elizabeth

texts.es: Kathy Elizabeth G. su edad es de 41 años, es una mujer casada. Kathy tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta mujer luchadora inicio por influencias familiares, el mayor desafío que tuvo con el negocio es que tenia que atender a su hijo, además tenia problemas de salud y eso le preocupaba cada ves que ella salía a ganarse la vida. Pero sin embargo ha demostrado que puede salir adelante. El dinero que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de Kathy es que su hijo termine su carrera y además sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Kathy Elizabeth G., 41, is married and has one son who goes to school. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than four years. This determined woman started her business by way of family influence. The greatest challenge she had with the business was taking care of her son. She also had health problems that worried her every time she left to earn a living. Nevertheless, she has shown that she can get ahead. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. Kathy’s dream is for her son to finish his degree and become a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
N. Beatrice is the leader of Balisiima group in Lugazi. She is 29 years of age and the mother of a child aged 8 years who is in Primary 3.

Beatrice has a stall that she has been running for eight years, ever since she divorced her husband. She sells tomatoes, egg plant, green and yellow bananas, and so on.

This is her 13th loan with her lending group and so far she has no regrets because she has been able to increase the stock on her stall, as well as buying a plot of land and building her own house, as well as caring for her child single-handedly. She also has staying with her, her young brother for whom she pays school fees. She is happy that, in addition to her persistence and hard work, the loans have made all this possible.

Beatrice needs a loan to help with restocking her stall with more produce and partly to pay school fees for her young ones.

loans.use: To restock her stall and to pay school fees for her young ones

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Sofía Esperanza S. T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Sofía tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Sofía es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la ubicación es en su casa de habitación. Doña Sofía ha recibido varios prestamos Fundación León 2000, y esto le ha ayudado a invertir cada día en su negocio. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mantener activo este negocio para que el día de mañana pueda generarle los ingresos necesarios. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo incrementando sus productos como gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos de consumo en general. El sueño de Sofía es darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofia Esperanza S. Torres is 47 years old, single, has a son and is in school. Sofia's business is a grocery store. She has been running this business from her home for the last 5 years. Doña Sofía has received various loans from Fundacion Leon 2000, which she has invested in her business. Her goal is to continue running this business so that she can continue to have income in the future. For this reason she is requesting this loan, to invest in working capital of her business in the form of merchandise such as sodas, natural beverages, bread, candies, basic grains and other general purpose products. Doña Sofía dreams of making the necessary improvements to her house so that she is prepared when the winter comes.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
