MARITZA R. N., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” vive en el Jr. Cahuide Nº 410 del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 44 años de edad, 05 hijos mayores, y su pareja es maderero.

Su trabajo es en el rubro de manualidades y venta de ropas, y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el compro en la ciudad de Lima ropas para luego traerlos a Pucallpa y ofrecerlos a sus conocidos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará pantalones, camisas, carteras, y también material para la confección de sus arreglos florales y tortas para toda ocasión que ella misma confecciona.

La ONG Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome .
texts.en:
Maritza Rodríguez N. belongs to the Carmen Cabrejos Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Cahuide Nº 410 in the Calleria distict, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 44, has five grown children, and her husband works buying and selling wood. She works in the field of handicrafts and clothing sales. With her first loan for 300 PEN from Manuela Ramos she bought clothes in Lima to later bring and sell to the people she knows in Pucallpa. With this loan for 2,000 PEN, she will buy pants, shirts, purses, and also material to make floral arrangements and cakes for all occasions. The ONG (non governmental organization) Manuela Ramos has helped me to generate more income for my family. They have helped me expand my business and to keep growing and developing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, purses, materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rita S. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, madre soltera, tiene dos hijos. Con gran esfuerzo ha salido adelante y tiene proyectado a corto plazo la construcción de su vivienda. Tiene su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace dos años lo inicio ya que la situación de encontrar trabajo esta muy difícil por tal motivo su meta es tener su tienda de variedad. Agradece a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado para crecer como comerciante. Este es su cuarto ciclo y el préstamo que solicita es para capital de trabajo con la compra de productos como: pacas de damas y variadas, zapatos, cosméticos y otros. Y poder ofertar a sus clientes una variedad de productos a si como atraer clientes nuevos.

loans.use: Comprar pacas, zapatos, cosmeticos

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Claribel M. tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica a es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, ya que no tenía mucho dinero para iniciar por lo que decide establecer una relación entre Fundación León 2000 y ella, y es através de los financiamientos que logra salir adelante por que con el primer financiamiento compro cosméticos y ropa interior. Y esto fue lo que la impulso a seguir. El dinero solicitado es para su capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, calzado, pantalones, faldas y camisetas. El sueño de Claribel es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Claribel M. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She makes a living selling general merchandise. She has been doing this for the last 15 years. She started it because she wanted to launch her own business. Since she did not have much money to begin the business, she established a relationship with Fundacion Leon 2000. Through the loans that she received, she has been able to get ahead. With the proceeds of the first loan she purchased cosmetics and underwear. This gave her the desire to continue. The current loan will finance the purchase of underwear, shoes, pants, skirts and shirts. Claribel's dream is to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El Señor Joaquín R. de 53 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene dos hijos ambos estudiando, terminar su casa plan importante y proyecto que realizar para un patrimonio seguro. Don Joaquín se desempeña como gestor de cobranza en una empresa privada desde hace dos años. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar lo materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, bloque para construir el muro en la parte de alado de su casa y brindarle seguridad ha su familia. Este es su tercer ciclo en la institución y se ha beneficiado en hacer las mejoras a su vivienda, lo cual espera a largo plazo poder enmurar todo su terreno.
texts.en:
Mr. Joaquín R. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur in the capital, Managua. He is married, his wife is a housewife, and they have two children who are studying. An important plan and project is to finish his house in order to have a safe patrimony. Don Joaquín has worked for two years as a cash collector for a private company. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, purlins, and construction blocks to build the wall next to his house to offer security to his family. It is his third season with the institution, and he has benefitted being able to improve his dwelling, and in the long run, he hopes to build a wall all around his property.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: El Señor Oscar Martínez tiene 63 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene cinco hijos dos ya casado y tres viven con ellos. Poco a poco han ido construyendo su casa, les falta todavía una parte de la casa lo cual Don oscar solicita un préstamo de vivienda. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic que es su sexto ciclo lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, bloque para construir la pared del frente de la casa y brindarle seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Martínez is 63 years old and lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur de Managua in the capital, Managua. He is married, his wife is a housewife, they have 5 children, two married and three living with them. Little by little they have been constructing their house and don Oscar is requesting a loan to be able to finish a part of the house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, which is his sixth, he will be able to buy construction material such as cement, iron, purlins, and blocks in order to build the front wall of the house and offer security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall of a house.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: La Señora Sixta Dávila tiene la edad de 52 años, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, su acompañante de vida le ayuda económicamente es comerciante ambulante, tiene cuatros hijos dos trabajan le ayudan y los otros dos estudian. Unos de sus proyectos son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean hombres de bien. Doña Sixta desde hace seis años trabaja por cuenta propia en su casa de habitación vendiendo tortillas como una de las dificultades muy vista que no tiene construido el techo para protegerse en tiempo de lluvia, lo cual le baja las ventas. Iniciando con fondos propios que tenían, el desarrollo de su trabajo es de mucho esfuerzo el cual agradece  Afodenic por apoyar  con préstamos que fomenta a crecer como pequeños empresarios. Con el préstamo que solicita que es su séptimo ciclo lograra comprar materiales de construcción como : zinc, reglones, clavos, cemento y unos bloques para realizar la construcción de un muro pequeño previniendo la entrada del agua y el techo que falta en su lugar de trabajo, sirviendo a sus clientes con mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sixta Dávila is 52 years old, she lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. Her life partner, a street vendor, helps her economiccally, she has four children, two are working and supporting her and the other two are students. One of her projects is to build her house and that her children become good human beings. Doña Sixta has worked independently for the last six years selling tortillas from her home. One of the difficulties is that it lacks roofing to protect from rain and therefore sales decrease. She started to develop her work with her own funding and a lot of effort which is appreciated by Afodenic that offers support with loans to help small businessmen and businesswomen grow. With the loan requested, her seventh, she will buy construction material such as zinc, lining, nails, cement, and some blocks to build a small wall to prevent the water from entering as well as the roof covering her working space, thus being able to serve her clients with more comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall

loans.name: Lucrecia Nury

texts.es: La Señora Lucrecia G. de 46 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, estado civil soltera, tiene dos hijos ambos trabajan y le ayudan a su madre. Como madre soltera requería una fuente de trabajo lo cual la llevo a iniciar con ventas de joyas, ropa y otros productos, desde hace treinta años ha sido el medio con que adquirir ingresos. Con planes de establecer una tienda por completo, ubicada en su casa de habitación y reactivar la bloquera en San Benito para aumentar sus ingresos y calidad de vida. Gracias al préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar una vitrina grande para colocar sus productos y establecer productos como: perfumes, tintes, cosmético y ropas interiores y poder llamar a l atención a sus clientes, como la captación de nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia G. is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital, Managua. She is single and has two children, both work and support their mother. As a single mother she needed a source of income and therefore she started selling jewellery, garments, and other products and this has been her income source for the past thirty years.She has plans to establish a store located in her dwelling and reactivate the machinery to make blocks in San Benito in order to increase her income and life quality. Thanks to the loan requested from Afodenic she will be able to buy a big display cabinet for her products and buy products such as perfumes, dyes, cosmetics and underwear and thus attract attention of her clients as well as gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, dyes, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Mrs Elida P. is a 58-year-old widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married while the other, who is 17 years old, currently lives at home. This daughter is in high school, and Mrs Elida pays for her education. Mrs Elida is a selfless person, who works selling fruits and vegetables from her cart. She goes to Abasto market herself to buy her merchandise and transports it back on the bus. She also has her own small convenience store in her house, which her daughter attends to when she goes out to sell her goods.

Mrs Elida would like to say thank you for the loans she has received from Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya. Her business is growing and so is her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Relia Edelvis

texts.es:
RELIA S. D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” vive en el Jr.Comandante espinar Nº 648. del distrito D. Calleria, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 51 años D. edad, 4 hijos mayores D. edad, y su esposo es mecánico.

Se inició en el negocio D. venta D. ropas y con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró blusas y faldas para luego venderlos en la ciudad D. Contamana, ahora está ingresando al negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos D. belleza para su stock.
 
“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
RELIA S. D. S. is a member of "Banco Comunal "CARMEN CABREJOS", she lives in Jr. Comandante Espinar No. 648, district of Calleria in the town of Pucallpa. She is 51 years old, and has 4 grown-up children, and her husband is a mechanic.

She started selling clothes and with the first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought blouses and skirts to be sold in the town of Contamana. Presently she is starting business selling beauty products.

With this loan of S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy perfumes, cosmetics and new beauty products for her stock.

"Manuela Ramos is a NGO which supports a substantial amount of families through small loans that allow the women of this area to start or improve their businesses, and I am very pleased with this support", doña Relia said.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
ROSAURA R. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” con domicilio en el Jr. ELMER FAUCETT N° 800 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 60 años, 06 hijos adultos, y su esposo es profesor jubilado.

Ella tiene un negocio D. venta D. ropa.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 8 años, con él compró algunas prendas y así comenzó su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la compra D. ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, las mismas que saldrá a vender a sus amistades y vecinos.  Además también quiere invertir en gaseosas, ahora que está empezando la estación D. verano.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, asimismo  se  siente  muy feliz  D.  poder  contribuir  en  la  economía D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosaura R. D. P. is a member of the communal bank “Ricardo Palma.” Her home is in Callería and she is a 60-year-old mother of six adult children. Her husband is a retired teacher. She has a business selling clothing that she began eight years ago with the money (300 soles) from her first loan. With this new loan of 2,300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing. She will then go out to sell the clothing to her friends and neighbors. She would also like to invest in soft drinks since summer is beginning. In the short time she’s been with Manuela Ramos, she’s felt happy for the help that Manuela Ramos gives women so they can get ahead. She is also happy to be able to contribute money to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.  Compra de gaseosas.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.en: Mrs Pabla is 55 years old and has three children, one of whom has a mental disability. All of her children work in her bakery and put in a great effort to make it a success. In this way the family can afford an education for the children. Mrs Pabla is a single mother and has raised her children by herself. She thanks Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, for its support and the opportunity it has given her to accomplish a dream. She says that it was the only institution that believed in her.

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast and butter

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Mrs Teodora Q. is 63 years old, and has four adult children who have all left home. She also has several grandchildren. Mrs Q. has had a small grocery store for more than 27 years. She started her business with small sales on the street but after a few years, with a little bit of saving and the help of her older children, she bought her own house. From this house she started her small grocery store. Currently, she has a well-formed clientele, to whom she tries to give her best attention every day by stocking a variety of products. She is applying for credit in order to purchase more merchandise, such as sugar, herbs, noodles, breads and beverages.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, noodles, breads and beverages

loans.name: Pabla Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla is 36 years old and married. She has two school-aged children and lives in her own house. Mrs. Pabla is the owner of a tailor shop in a very important neighborhood in Limpio. The business has been open for more than 10 years and she works with her two sisters.

She started working in a tailor shop owned by a Korean citizen and little by little she bought sewing machines with the help of her mother, who died three years ago. With the help of her sisters, she created their own tailor shop, which is the pride of the family. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity to buy more machines and to employ local girls as help.

loans.use: The purchase of fabric

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos A. is 40 years old and married to Mrs. Ramona Cabañas, who is 30 years old and with whom he has five school-aged children.

He has been working selling milk and making cheese since 1998. In order to start this activity he received some help from his father, who gave him a cow and calf. From there he began to sell his products from a bicycle, which he used as a way to deliver his products every morning.

It’s due to the purity and quality of the product that the demand is so high. Currently he has four milk-producing cows with calves and a well-formed clientele to provide for every morning.

The credit applied for is to buy a motorcycle because his clientele has increased and he needs to be able to deliver milk faster and in time for families’ breakfast. One of his goals is to be able to buy his own land with some space, as he is currently living in his parents’ house.

loans.use: The purchase a motorcycle for milk delivery

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eluteria B. is 51 years old, and she is a single mother of two older children. She sells basic necessities at her grocery store for a living. When she began this business 10 years ago, she built a little house in front of a cotton-processing factory with the help of her sister, who lives in Argentina. After doing this for some time, she was able to acquire some land, where she currently has a house and her small grocery store. Additionally, she makes Chipa, a traditional, bread-like Paraguayan dish, which she sells on the streets of the city and its suburbs.

She is now seeking a loan in order to purchase various raw materials, such as rice, noodles, sugar, herbal tea, breads, starch, corn, soda, and Chipa-making ingredients. Eluteria’s goal is to expand her business so that she will be able to provide more goods and services to her clientele.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials (e..g, starch, corn, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: La Señorita Brenda S. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Reparto López en la capital de Managua, soltera, vive con su madre. Con planes a corto plazo de mejorar su nivel de vida y seguir ayudando a su mamá. Joven con iniciativa para alcanzar sus objetivos ya que desde hace siete años tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, zapatos y otros productos de uso personal, con proyecciones grandes de desarrollo para su negocio, ya que tener una cadena de tiendas esta dentro de sus planes a futuros. Le da las gracias  Afodenic por la oportunidad que se le  brinda en abrir su puerta y permitirle solicitar un préstamo el cual será utilizado para comprar mercaderías como: cosmético, joyas, zapatos, ropas y articulo para damas como: pañoletas, cinturones. Siendo los pequeños pasos para cumplir sus proyectos.
texts.en:
33-year old Señorita Brenda S. lives in the López neighbourhood of the capital city Managua. She is single and lives with her mother. Her short-term plan is to improve her standard of living and to continue helping her mother. This young woman shows the enterprise needed to reach her goals as she has run her own business selling clothes, shoes and other personal items for seven years. She has big plans for the development of the business, with a chain of stores among her future plans. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Afodenic, for opening the door to her and giving her the opportunity to ask for a loan which she will use to buy merchandise such as cosmetics, jewellery, shoes, clothing, as well as items for women like shawls and belts. From small steps big projects grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewellery, and shoes

loans.name: German

texts.en:
Mr. German G. is a 52-year-old, married man. He is married to Mrs. Mirna Aguiar, who is 46 years old. They have three sons, two of whom no longer live at home, and one of whom is still in school.

German has a automobile- and tractor-repair shop, which he has operated since 1994--ever since his father passed away and left the business to German. His workshop is always very busy and he credits his success to his singular focus. Specifically, he notes that he is one of the only mechanics in the area who has studied only one profession. As a result of his business endeavors, German has been able to buy his own house, own a vehicle, and ensure that his children go on to their own professional careers.

German is now seeking a loan in order to buy a stronger engine for the vehicle he uses for towing purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a stronger engine for his towing vehicle

loans.name: Jurgen Greyley

texts.es: Jurgen es casado de 36 años de edad, realiza actividad de compra y venta de ganado, habita en estos momentos en casa de los padres de su esposa, esta solicitando este credito para utilizarlo en la construccion de una tapia en la casa que tiene en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, ya que quiere darle mas seguridad a su esposa, porque ella tendira que estar sola, pues el sale mucho por la actividad que realiza, no tienen hijos, pero su interes es darle mayores condiciones a su vivienda para cuando lleguen los hijos.  Plantea que una vez cancelado este credito continuara trabajando con la institcion, porque le faltan muchos detalles importantes a su casa, una vez concluidos etaran habitandola con mas comodidades.
texts.en:
36-year old Jurgen is married, and his job is buying and selling cattle. At the moment he lives with his parents-in-law. He is asking for a loan to construct a wall around the house that he owns in the neighbourhood of Bosques de Juigalpan. It would provide his wife with greater security because she tends to stay there alone as he is often away because of his work. They don’t yet have any children, but he would like to give them a better place to live in when they do arrive. Once the loan is paid back, Jurgen plans to continue working with the institution (Kiva partner, Afodenic) because his house lacks many important details. When he has completed them, the family will have a much more comfortable house to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
MILKA S. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Comandante espinar N° 646 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 39 años, 03 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como conductor D. una moto taxi (Transportista).

Tenía un negocio D. venta productos D. bisutería y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 años, con él, compro sus productos (bisuteria) que luego los vendió a sus vecinos.

Ahora amplio su negocio y además venD. ropas como; blusas, pantalones, toallas, colchas, carteras, etc. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra D. mas mercaderías (ropa) y parte del dinero lo usara para comprar repuestos D. su moto taxi.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Milka S. D. is a member of the community bank “CARMEN CABREJOS”. She lives at #646, Comandante Espinar Street in the district of Callería. She is 39 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a driver of a motorbike taxi. Milka used to have a business selling imitation jewellery only. The first time she obtained a loan of S/.300 with her husband, two years ago, she bought jewellery which she sold to her neighbours. Now her business has grown; she also sells clothing such as blouses and pants, as wells as towels, bedspreads, purses etc. She will use part of the S/.1,000 loan to buy more merchandise (clothing), and part of it will also go to the purchase of spare parts for the motorbike taxi. In the short time that she has been with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy because of the help that the organisation offers to women who want to get ahead, or to help their husbands and children, and to contribute to the family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing. To buy spare parts for a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan N. is a 58-year-old, married man. He is married to Mrs. Casilda Ortiz, with whom he was two younger children.

For a living, he sells cow’s milk. He started this business in 1999 with the help of his mother. In particular, his mother helped him buy his first cows, and she worked alongside him for some time. At first, he was milking 3 cows, which would produce about 3 liters of milk per day. Now, he has 6 cows, which produce a much larger quantity of milk. He sells the milk in the city, and he notes that his milk is in high demand in this area and is known for its high quality. On account of his successful business, he has been able to buy his own land, where he currently houses his cows.

He is now applying for a loan in order to purchase another milking cow that is being offered for a good price. His goal is to generate an increase in his income by providing milk to more families.

loans.use: To expand his business and to provide for more families by purchasing another milk-producing cow

loans.name: Nestor Jose

texts.es: Nestor Jose está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( Hecharle la ceramica a la casa), trabaja como  contador en la corte suprema de Justicia  desde hace 2 años y ocho meses,   tiene una hija de 9 años de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria y el hijo mayor de 15 años de edad estudia su 5to año de educacion secundaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos,  don Nestor se caracteriza por ser honesto, trabajador, de buenas costumbres, sociable y  muy responsable en su centro de trabajo y en sus compromisos adquiridos, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que sus hijos  estudian, no les falte nada y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Nestor Jose is requesting his first credit to invest in home improvements (to tile his house). He has worked as an accountant for the Supreme Court for the past 2 years and 8 months. He has one daughter who is 9 years old and is in 5th grade in primary school, and an older son who is 15 years old and is in his 5th year of secondary school. His wife is in charge of the household and is also in charge of caring for their children. Nestor characterizes himself as honest, hard working, well-mannered, sociable, and very responsible when it comes to his job and commitments. His dreams are to finish building his home and in that way enjoy the best living conditions, that his children study, that they lack nothing, and that he have job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile his home.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
MARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo morey nº 666, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos profesionales, y su esposo es operador de maquinaria forestal (jubilado).

	Ella  tiene una pequeña bodega y además vende productos de belleza, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de golosinas, y desde hace 9 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha ido muy bien y sus productos salen cada vez mas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza, gaseosas y una vitrina para ampliar su negocio y surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”. Her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 64 years old, has 4 professional children, and her husband is a forestry machinery operator (retired). She has a small grocery store and also sells beauty products. The first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos program was of 300 PEN, which she invested in purchasing sweets. For the past 9 years that she has been working with the Manuela Ramos program things have gone well for her and her products sell more and more every day. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of more beauty products, soft drinks, and a display case to expand her business and add variety to her store. Maria thanks the Manuela Ramos program for being an institution that serves the community with the service it provides and for what it contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, soft drinks, and a display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cow fodder

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos  está solicitando  su 1er credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Pintar y repellar la cocina), trabaja en la corte suprema de Justicia desde hace 3 años, no tiene hijos pero se encarga del cuido de su ancianita mama y de los gastos del hogar,  es un  joven humilde, responsable, honesto, trabajador  y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y su comunidad, actualmente esta estudiando su 1er año en la universidad Martin Lutero,  este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, vive en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población, su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda para asi tener mejor comodidad y vivir en un ambiente agradable , seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un excelente profesional, estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is requesting his first loan to invest in home improvements (to paint and re-plaster the kitchen). He has worked for the Supreme Court for the past 3 years, and does not have any children, but is in charge of caring for his elderly mother and household expenses. He is a humble young man, responsible, honest, hard working, and very loved by his work peers and community. Currently he is in his 1st year at the Martin Lutero University. He plans on improving his housing little by little and lives in a neighborhood where every day he sees the population increasing. His dreams are to improve his housing and in that way live more comfortably and in a pleasant environment, to continue studying to become an excellent professional, and to have job and health stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint and re-plaster the kitchen.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
MANUELA M. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Malecón hoyada Mz.116.Lt.15. Distrito de Calleria, tiene 47 años, 02 hijos, y su esposo es chofer .

	Ella  tiene el negocio en su casa, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en la compra de algunos abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desde hace 9 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha ido creciendo su negocio cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en  la compra de mas abarrotes y mercadería como zapatos y prendas de vestir (ropa) que luego venderá a sus clientes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Manuela M. D. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 47 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is a chauffeur. She has a business in her home, and the first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos program was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of groceries to add variety to her small grocery store. For the past 9 years that she has been working with the Manuela Ramos program and her business has continued growing each time and because of that she has found it necessary to increase her loan amount. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of more groceries, and merchandise such as shoes and clothing, which she will later sell to her clients. She thanks the Manuela Ramos program for being an institution that serves the community with the service it provides and for what it contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
ZAIDA G. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS”, su domicilio está ubicado en el Carmen cabrejos Nº 834 Distrito de Calleria, tiene 40 años, 2 hijos y su esposo es chofer (transportista).

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió para la compra de artículos de pasamanería, los cuales vendió en el puerto de la hoyada, pero no le resulto como esperaba, por lo tanto cambio de actividad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega (arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar, etc.)

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 8 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó.
texts.en:
Zaida G. S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 40 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is a chauffeur. The first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos program was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of decorative fringe items that she sold in the port of La Hoyada; this business did not turn out as she expected, and for the meantime she has changed activities. With this loan of 1,300 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of groceries to add variety to her small grocery store (rice, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.). She thanks the Manuela Ramos program, and remarks that the 8 years that she has worked with the program have permitted her to establish her business, which has been an interesting form of help that has allowed her to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as noodles, rice, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lineth

texts.es: Lineth está solicitando  su primer credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es pintar y acondicionar el dormitorio,  esta cliente labora como secretaria administrativa de la corte suprema de Justicia de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 2 años y 8 meses, actualmente esta estudiando un postgrado en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea,  Lineth es responsable, honesta y con muncho deseos de superación personal y profesional, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, en el barrio  Linda Vista, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria, a pesar que ella no recibe ayuda del padre de su hijo ha luchado para que no le falte nada,  Lineth es una mujer trabajadora, por las tardes cuando sale  de su trabajo  se dedica a ayudar a su hijo con las tareas  y a salir  a vender cosmeticos para asi obtener mejores ingresos y tener mejor comodidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, tener  una vivienda bonita y que su hijo estudie para que sea personas de bien.
texts.en:
Lineth is requesting her first loan to invest in home improvements such as painting and installing air conditioning in a room. Lineth has worked as an administrative secretary in the Supreme Court of New Guinea for the past 2 years and 8 months, and currently is carrying out her postgraduate studies at URACCAN University in the New Guinea precinct. Lineth is responsible, honest, and has great hopes of getting ahead in her personal and professional life. She lives in Zone #1 in New Guinea in the Linda Vista neighborhood, and has a 10-year-old son who is in 5th grade in primary school. Even though she does not receive any help for her son’s father, she has fought so that her son lacks nothing. Lineth is a hardworking woman, and in the evenings when she leaves work she dedicates herself to helping her son with his homework and also goes out to sell cosmetics to earn more and live more comfortably. Her dreams are to have job stability, a nice household, and that her son study to become a good person.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint and install air conditioning in a room.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia E. is 24 years old, single, and has been working from a very young age. Two years ago, with money that she received, she invested in an idea that she had been thinking about for a long time, which was the sale of home electrical products. It was in this manner that she started her own small business which, in the small time it has been open, has been very successful. She now needs more capital to continue in this industry.

For this reason she asked for a loan from the Paraguay Foundation so that she could continue the dream she once had and that she is currently carrying out thanks to the confidence and support of the Foundation.

loans.use: To purchase more home electrical products to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 667 interior, del distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo es profesor.

Tenía un negocio de venta frutas, pastelitos y la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 años, compró frutas para vender en la vereda de su casa.  Actualmente se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de ropas para luego venderlo por las comunidades del rio Ucayali. Además ella prepara juanes especiales (comida típica de la región) y los vende a sus vecinos.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisca D. R. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 35 years old, has 4 children, and her husband is teacher. She had a business in the sale of fruits and small pastries; the first loan that she obtained 2 years ago was of 300 PEN, which she used to buy fruit to sell on the sidewalk in front of her house. Currently she dedicates herself to the business of selling clothing. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of clothing that she will later sell to the communities of Rio Ucayali. She also prepares special “Juanes” (traditional food of the region), which she sells to her neighbors. In the little time that she has been with the Manuela Ramos program she has felt happy for the help it gives women to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Prode Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía PROD. (Pro Desarrollo Económico) esta formada por 10 socias que en su mayoría vive en el AA HH San Martín en el Distrito D. LOS OLIVOS – LIMA – PERÚ, se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo y cada una D. sus integrantes son madres D. familias que se levantan muy temprano para dedicarse a sus negocios (venta D. pollo, productos D. belleza, entre otros) y luego  por la tarD. estar con sus hijos, el préstamo D. cada una D. ellas es para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios.
La señora Q. C., Nelly D. 40 años, es la fundadora del grupo ( la señora D. verD. en la primera fila D. la foto); ella venD. pollo en el mercado Huandoy en Los Olivos, y junto a su hijo José Luis, quien venD. CDs por la mañana y maneja un mototaxi por las tardes, han decidido sacar adelante a la familia. Con su esfuerzo y sacrifico, ella desea terminar D. construir su casa para poder alquilar cuartos y hacer profesionales a cada uno D. sus hijos.
Por otro lado encontramos a la Tesorera del grupo, la señora R. S., Flor (la señora D. buzo azul D. la primera fila)  una joven madre D. dos pequeños D. 7 y 3 años  quien con el deseo D. obtener una casa propia  para sus hijos; ya que vive con sus suegros; sale todos los días por las mañanas a vender sus productos D. belleza, lencería, etc. 
Por ultimó y no menos importante esta la Secretaria del grupo la señora F. P., Esmeralda ( la señora D. rosado en la primera fila); ella se dedicaba en un principio a vender D. todo ambulatoriamente, pero con su gran esfuerzo a conseguido tener su propio puesto D. pollo en el mercado, al inicio fue difícil por que no sabía como picar el pollo pero ahora le encanta su trabajo, con el préstamo recibido por EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD sigue invirtiendo en el negocio para que en un futuro pueda comprar su terrenito y hacer profesional a sus tres pequeños.
texts.en:
The PROD. (Pro Economic Development) group consists of 10 members, the majority of whom live in San Martín, district of Los Olivos, Peru. The group is on its fourth loan cycle, and every one of the members is a mother who gets up very early to dedicate herself to her businesses (selling chicken, beauty products, among other items) and in the afternoon spends time with her children. Each member will use the loan to continue investing in her business.

The founder of the group, Nelly Q. C. (the woman in green in the first row of the photo), sells chicken in the Huandoy market in Los Olivos, and along with her son José Luis, who sells CDs in the mornings and drives a mototaxi in the afternoons, works hard to make headway for her family. With her hard work and sacrifice, Nelly wants to complete construction on her home so she can rent the rooms and make professionals out of all her children.

The treasurer of the group, Flor R. S. (the woman in the blue sweater in the first row), is a young mother of two small children, ages 7 and 3, who wants to have her own home, since she currently lives with her in-laws. She goes out every morning to sell beauty products, lingerie, etc.

Finally, but no less important, is the group's secretary, Esmeralda F. P. (the woman in pink in the first row). She used to sell all kinds of items outdoors, but with a lot of effort she was able to get her own post selling chicken in the market. At first it was difficult because she didn't know how to carve the chicken, but now she loves her job. With the loan from Kiva partner EDAPROSPO she will continue investing in her business so that in the future she'll be able to buy a small plot of land and make professionals out of her three small children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow their businesses

loans.name: Emilce

texts.en:
The client is 24 years old, single, and has been living in Coronel Oviedo for five years. She had to leave Ciudad del Este when she was young in order to find work, and finished the sixth grade while working during the day and studying at night.

She currently lives in Coronel Oviedo, accompanied by her grandmother, who due to her age cannot be very active. Miss Emilce is a natural-born entrepreneur, and knowing that cell phones and their accessories is a good industry, she decided to open a business from the house where she and her grandmother live. The business is currently doing very well, as it is the only cellphone store in the area where she lives.

She applied for this loan to be able to travel to buy more accessories for her business, and in this way advance her life.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories

loans.name: Juana Ruth

texts.es: La Señora Juana S. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur un Barrio de la Capital de Managua, tiene nueve hijos de los cuales cuatro son menores y están estudiando, su esposo su mano derecha en su pequeña microempresa de elaboración de   camas, roperos y otros artículos a base de hierro. Juntos como matrimonio tiene sus planes de continuar creciendo como empresario y ofreciéndoles mejores condiciones de vida. Desde hace ocho años iniciaron su empresa de metalúrgica, se han encontrado con dificultares por falta de financiamiento, por lo cual se siente agradecido con Afodenic por el préstamo que le aprobado este es su décimo ciclo que será utilizado para la compra de materia prima como: hierro, resortes, pinturas y otros que se utilizan para crear camas. Permitiendo vender mayores cantidades e incrementando sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Juana S. is 49 years old, and lives in Laureles Sur a neighborhood in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She has nine children of which four are younger and studying; her husband is the right hand of her small micro-enterprise in which they manufacture beds, dressers, and other iron based pieces. As a couple they have plans to continue expanding their enterprise, which would afford them with better living conditions. For the past eight years running their metallurgy business, they have run into difficulties having to do with a lack of financing for which they have been thankful for the loans that Afodenic has granted them. This will be their tenth loan cycle, which will be used to purchase basic materials such as: iron, springs, paints, and other items that they use to manufacture beds. This will allow them to sell higher quantities and increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase iron, springs, and paint to manufacture beds.

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
GLORIA C. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 665 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, 6 hijos, y su esposo es carpintero.

Ella tiene una cochera y hace 3 años es socia de Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo empleó para algunos arreglos de su cochera, aunque el préstamo fue pequeño pero la ayudo bastante, ya que de lo contrario no seguiría en el negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una moto bomba, ya que sus clientes le piden que brinde también el servicio de lavado de vehículos, por ello necesita la moto bomba, para que pueda dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Desde que esta con Manuela Ramos, siente que hay un apoyo cercano y está conforme con los préstamos que ha recibido, y por ello ella no se atrasa en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gloria C. A. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 48 years old, has 6 children, and her husband is a carpenter. She has a car garage, and 3 years ago she became a member of the Manuela Ramos program; her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she used to fix up her car garage. Though her first loan was small it helped a lot, given that without it she would not have been able to continue in this business. With this loan of 1,300 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of gasoline powered pump given that her clients have asked her to also offer car wash services, because of this she needs the pump to be able to give her clients the best service. Since she has been with the Manuela Ramos program she has felt that there is support nearby and has been happy with the loans that she has received, because of this she never delays in her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pump to provide carwash services.

loans.name: Gloria Graciela

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Graciela B. D. M. is 45 years old, married, and has been working from a very young age. 
Five years ago she started to run a used shoe stand in the market, seeing that she needed to help her husband with expenses. Just a short time after opening her stand she began to be very successful, giving her a demand for more capital to be able to continue her business.  
She is married to Mr. Isidoro M., who is 47 years old and works making shoes.  In this way, they buy shoes, he fixes, shines and dyes them, and she sells them.  They are a humble family that are able to pay day-to-day expenses, as well as the expenses for elementary school for their three children.

loans.use: the purchase of footwear

loans.name: Iris Amelia

texts.es: Doña Iris Amelia  está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (ponerle cielo razo a la casa y acondicionar habitacion), trabaja como Responsable de recursos Humanos en la corte suprema de justicia en  la Zona Urbana de Nueve Guinea desde hace 2 años y siete meses, esta clienta  tiene un  hijo de 10 el cual estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria, su esposo trabaja en la alcaldia de el Almendro como consejal, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, ella  los dias de la semana vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en el Barrio Linda Vista este barrio recientemente se pobló y cada día se va aumentando su población y los fines de semana se va para su casa en el Almendro, ya que por la distancia no puede viajar todos los dias,  Iris es una mujer profesional  con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral,  responsable,  que ama su trabajo,  su sueño  es estudiar el proximo año una maestría,  tener estabilidad, salud  y tener su casa con todas la condiciones  como todo cuidadano aspira, pues es el patrimonio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Iris Amelia is asking for her first loan to improve her home (put a ceiling in the house and fix up a room). She has worked in human resources in the supreme court of justice in the Urbana de Nueve Guinea zone for two years and six months. She has a ten year old son who is in the fifth grade of elementary school. Her husband works in the Almendro town hall as a councilman. They both share the home expenses. Because of her commitments, during the week she lives in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea in the Linda Vista neighborhood. This neighborhood is recently populated, and every day the population is increasing. On the week ends she goes to her house in Almendro. It is too great a distance to travel every day. Iris is a professional woman with a great spirit for personal and work improvement. She is responsible, and she loves her work. Her dream is to next year study for her master’s degree, have stability, health, and have a house with all of the conditions that a citizen aspires to. It is, after all, her son’s legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a ceiling and fix up a room

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Martha O. tiene 37 años de edad, reside en  Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, los dos mayores trabajan y le ayudan, como madre soltera se le ha sido muy duro y difícil salir adelante con sus hijos teniendo como planes mejorar su nivel de vida, hacer mejoras en su vivienda y aumentar sus ventas. Desde hace ochos años estableció su negocio de tortillería, permitiendo obtener un ingreso mas fijo. Se ha encontrado con dificultades de falta de financiamientos para agrandar el negocio. Le da las gracias Afodenic por extenderle una mano amiga para seguir creciendo, con el préstamo solicitado comprara maíz, leña, y también iniciar a vender queso, cuajadas, crema. Para captar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Martha O. is 37 years old and lives in Laureles Norte in Managua, the capital. She is single and has 4 children; the two eldest work and help her. As a single mother it has been very difficult raising her children, wanting to improve their standard of living, make improvements on their home and increase her sales.
She started her tortilla business 8 years ago, allowing her to make a more steady income. She has run into some difficulties raising enough funds to expand her business.
She thanks Afodenic for offering her a friendly hand to help her to continue to grow. With the requested loan, she will purchase corn, firewood, and also start selling cheese, cheese curds and cream to attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood and dairy products

loans.name: Ofilio

texts.es: El Señor Ofilio Torrez tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, su compañera de vida vende comida casera, tiene cuatro hijos los dos mayores trabajan. La terminación de su vivienda es unos de sus planes para beneficiar a su familia. Don Ofilio se desempeña como albañil desde hace dos años tiene su trabajo fijo y seguro, que le permite invertir en la seguridad de su hogar. Ha tenido dificultares para el desarrollo de sus proyectos de la construcción de su casa por falta de financiamiento. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y perlines. Terminando un muro que se requiere para mayor seguridad y protección de su familia ya que hasta el momento lo tiene forrado con zinc.
texts.en:
Mr. Ofilio Torrez is 39 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He has four children, the two eldest of whom work. His partner sells homemade food for a living. He is trying to help his family by finishing their home. Ofilio works in construction and has had a secure job for two years. This allows him to invest in his home’s security. He has had some difficulty building his home because of lack of money. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he will buy construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, and timber. He is finishing a wall needed for more protection and greater security for his family. It’s covered with zinc right now.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un muro

loans.name: San Juan Masias Group

texts.es:
La Alcom “SAN JUAN MASIAS” se encuentra ubicada en la urbanización San Juan Masías en la región del  CALLAO – LIMA – PERU;  tiene 3 años de constituida y  está conformada por 11 socios, todos grandes emprendedores y con deseos de superación dedicados a diversas actividades económicas como la venta de productos de belleza, ropa, comida, etc. Entre los cuales encontramos al señor T. R., Rafael Fortunato (a quien lo podemos observar sentado en la foto adjunta); Presidente de la alcancía desde hace 03 años; él es   un ancashino de 54 años que debido a un despido improvisto y al no encontrar trabajo tuvo que salir a trabajar  junto a su esposa  vendiendo jugos ambulatoriamente.
Al inicio fue difícil, como el lo comenta, debido a que el señor estaba acostumbrado a trabajar en oficina, pero era mayor la necesidad económica que tuvo que seguir adelante.
Hoy después de 11 años mira con satisfacción sus logros obtenidos ya que ahora él cuenta con un puesto de comida en un mercado y ha logrado que su hija, acompañada de su esposa, estudie en el extranjero. Con los S/. 2,000.00 otorgados por EDAPROSPO piensa seguir incrementado su negocio y trabajar más arduamente para lograr su sueño de tener un restaurante y de ese modo seguir apoyando a sus hijos y a su nietecito.
texts.en:
The San Juan Masías group is located in the town of San Juan Masías in the region of Callao, Peru. It has been together for three years and is made up of 11 members, all great businesspeople with desires to move up in life. The members make a living in diverse economic activities, such as selling beauty products, clothing, food, etc. Among the members are Rafael T. R. (seen seated in the photo), who has been the group's president since it was formed. He is from the Ancash region of Peru and is 54 years old. After he was laid off unexpectedly he could not find a job, so he started working with his wife selling juices at outdoor stands. At first, he says it was difficult because he was accustomed to working in an office, but out of major economic necessity he had to keep making headway. Now, 11 years later, he looks at what he has achieved with satisfaction. He now has a food stand in a local market and has seen his daughter, accompanied by his wife, study abroad. With 2,000 soles from the group loan approved by Kiva partner EDAPROSPO, he plans to continue growing his business and working even harder to fulfill his dream of having a restaurant, and in this way he can continue supporting his children and his young grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow their businesses

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es: La joven Dolores López de 26 años de edad, con su casa de habitación situado en el barrio Camilo Chamorro de la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de apenas un año de vida. Madre soltera trabajadora, luchadora por la igualdad de oportunidades y reguardadora de los derechos de la niñez, de principios éticos y morales, por lo cual ha escogido la profesión de maestra. Desde hace cuatro años labora en una escuela de la capital en donde se desempeña enseñando a los futuros profesionales de nuestro país. Tiene como planes de corto plazo la construcción de un cuarto para tener mayor seguridad y protección. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, zinc, clavos, hierro, bloque, perlines y piso. Realizando su cuarto que es de mucho beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores López is 26 years old and has one child who is barely a year old. Her house is located in the Camilo Chamorra neighbourhood in the capital, Managua.
She is a hardworking single mother, who, as an ethically and morally principled advocate for equal opportunities and defender of children’s rights, has chosen the teaching profession. For four years she has worked at a school in the capital, where she teaches the future professionals of our country.
Her short term plans are to construct a room that will give her better security and protection. Thanks to this loan through Afodenic, she will be able to purchase construction materials like: cement, zinc, nails, iron, blocks, beams and flooring. Completing this room will be very beneficial for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De La Alborada Group

texts.es:
VILMA tiene 43 años, su esposo es el señor  Oscar  Reyes D. 45 años, que en forma conjunta apoyan a la educación D. sus  dos hijos D. 21 y 16 años para que ha futuro sean grandes profesionales.
VILMA es natural D. Lima  tiene  un pequeño negocio D. abarrotes ubicado en su domicilio: Calle las Ciruelas 169 La Alborada, Comas,  trabaja con Edaprospo poco mas D.  tres años perteneciendo a la Alcancía Comunal  SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA,  tiene el cargo D. presidenta, que en este mes culminó su primera fase y graduación  renovando su crédito grupal por el monto D. S/. 7,800.00.

La Alcancía  Comunal  esta conformada por 10 socios los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades y rubros, el 60% a la venta D. comida, el 20% a la prestación D. servicio vehicular y el otro 20% al rubro D. producción textil. Todos  saben que en estos tiempos la competencia  en el negocio es fuerte, pero trabajando organizadamente y en grupo los alienta a poner mayor esfuerzo en su trabajo y en la inversión D. capital que la institución les ofrece.
texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old, her husband is Mr. Oscar Reyas, 45 years old, and together they support the education of their children, 21 and 16 years old, so that in the future they will be great professionals.

Vilma is a native of Lima and has a small grocery business located in her home: 169 Las Ciruelas St, La Alborada, Comas. She has worked with Edaprospo a little more than three years, belonging to the SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA (Always United from the Dawn) Communal Bank where she has the position of President and which this month completed its first phase and graduated, renewing its group loan in the amount of 7,800 PEN.

The communal bank is composed of ten members who are in different businesses and areas: 60% in the sale of food, 20% offering vehicular services, and the other 20% in the area of textile production. All of them know that in these times the competition is strong, but working together in a group they are encouraged to put greater effort into their businesses and in the investment of capital that the institution (Edaprospo) offers them.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Filadelfo Jose

texts.es: El Señor Filadelfo Chavarría tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, casado su esposa tiene una pulpería, tiene cuatros hijos. Como padre de familia lo importante es la seguridad de sus seres queridos. Don Filadelfo se desempeña como conductor desde hace 25 años de experiencia en conducir con mucho cuidado y precaución. Como toda persona desea lo mejor para su familia y las mejores condiciones. Le da las gracias  Afodenic por el apoyo el cual le permitirá que con el préstamo que solicita es para comprar inodoro y lava manos, para cambiar el actual que esta en mal estado y estar con una buena higiene.
texts.en:
Mr. Filadelfo C. is 44 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino, and has 4 children with his wife, who owns a small local grocery store. As the head of his household, the most important thing to him is the security of his loved ones. Don Filadelfo has worked as a taxi driver for the past 25 years, and drives with care and caution. Like everyone, he wants the best for his family. He is grateful to Afodenic for its help, which will allow him to buy a new toilet and sink so that his family can have a clean and hygienic home.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a toilet and sink

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria L. socia D. la alcancía comunal  Grupo Unido
tiene 45 años, es natural D. la Libertad y se dedica a la venta D. comida en la Zona D. Nueva  América del Distrito D. Carabayllo, lugar donD. resiD. hace mas D.  15 años.  Maria es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a quienes ha sacado adelante con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo en el negocio. Maria es conocida en su localidad por los ricos potajes que prepara para el deleite D. su clientela, permitiéndole también desarrollarse personalmente. 
 
Hace 4 años se inicia como socia D. la Alcancía Comunal  buscando apoyo para invertir en el mejoramiento D. su negocio, logrando su objetivo, no solo por el apoyo financiero que le brinda Edaprospo sino también por el trabajo conjunto que imparte en la organización donD.  es líder y presiD..

Actualmente, la Alcancía Comunal grupo unido,  se encuentra en el primer ciclo D. la segunda fase  desembolsando  el monto D. s/ 7,700.00, con un total D. 10 socios, que en su  mayoría se dedican a la venta D.  productos lácteos (leche y queso) adquiridos en D. la provincia  D. canta por la cercanía y el bajo costo del producto que les genera mayor utilidad.

la meta D. Maria es tener su Restaurant donD. pueda brindar  mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes y a la vez generar mejores ingresos para el progreso y bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Maria L. is a member of the Grupo Unido Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and was born in La Libertad. She sells food in the Zona D. Nueva América, in the District of Carabayllom, where she has lived for 15 years. Maria is a single mother who has raised her two children by working hard at her business. Maria is known in her town for the delicious stews she prepares to the delight of her customers, allowing her to also grow personally.
She started as a member of the Communal Bank 4 years ago, looking for support to invest in the improvement of her business. She achieved her goal thanks not only to Edaprospo’s financial support, but also to the team work offered by the group that she leads. The Grupo Unido Communal Bank is currently in the second phase of their first loan cycle, disbursing the amount of S/.7,700.00 to a total of 10 group members. They mostly sell dairy products (milk and cheese) from Canta Province because it is nearby and the low product costs generate better profits.
Maria’s goal is to have a restaurant where she could proviD. her customers better service and comfort, while also generating a better income for the growth and well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gloria de los Ángeles M. L. tiene 43 años, ella es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que Gloria se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de planchado y lavado, pero se enfermo ya que cuando recurría a la casa de sus clientes, y se trasladaba a su vivienda tenia que caminar muchas cuadras, por lo que mas tarde decide incursionar en el negocio de la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, ropa para niños y ropa para damas.
texts.en:
Gloria de los Angeles M. L. is 43 years old; she is married and has a dependent child. She is engaged is the sale of general merchandise and has been in this business for more than 8 years. She was previously dedicated to providing ironing and washing services, but she got sick because of the long walks to get to her clients homes. So she decided to break into the business of selling general merchandise.

She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams and clothes for kids and ladies that she will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Silvia Elena Z. F. Z. tiene 35 años, es una madre soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Silvia es una mujer muy emprendedora y siempre le ha gustado el negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de gorras al por mayor. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decidió hacerse cargo del negocio al fallecer su esposo, porque tenia que sacar a su hijo adelante. Actualmente su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central, decide trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por que los financiamientos le han servido de ayuda para el negocio. es por eso que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que ella viaja a otros departamentos para buscar el producto de manera mas favorable.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena Z. F. is 35 years old and a single mother with one child that she supports. Silvia is an entrepreneur woman and has always liked the business arena. Her business is the wholesale of caps and has been doing it for more than 4 years. She decided to take over the business after her husband’s death, because she had to provide for her son. Her business is currently located in the central market.

She decided to work with Fundación Leon 2000 because the funding has helped the business. The loan requested is for working capital since she travels to other states to find better priced merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Reyna Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Reyna esta conformado por las personas Reyna Isabel S. O. y Luis Alberto M.. La actividad económica de Doña Reyna es la venta de tortillas y venta de frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio con fondos propios, y le fue muy difícil por que no tenía a una persona que se encargara de vender sus tortillas, por lo que después de elaborarlas Salía a recorrer las diferentes cuadras para venderlas. Los financiamientos le han ayudado para sacar adelante a su negocio, el dinero será destinado para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Sus sueños son de terminar de construir su casa. En cambio Don Luis tiene 79 años la actividad económica de Luis es la venta de leña. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Luis inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, por lo que este fue uno de los negocios que más le gusto. El financiamiento será utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de medicinas para su caballo ya que es su mejor herramienta para facilitarle su trabajo. el sueño de Don Luis es que su negocio se mantenga activo.
texts.en:
The solidarity Group Reyna is conformed by Reyna Isabel S. O. and Luis Alberto M.. Mrs. Reyna economic activity is the sale of tortillas and baked beans. She has been in the business for over 20 years and started it with her own funding. It was very difficult since she was the one who made them and then went out to sell them.

The loans have helped her to improve her business. The loan will be used to purchase corn, wood and salt. Her dreams are to finish building her house.

Mr. Luis is 79 years old and has been selling firewood for over 15 years. He started his business on his own, because this was one of the businesses he liked the most. The funding will be used for working capital to buy medicine for his horse which he depends on for his work. Mr. Luis's dream is that his business remains active

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
With special skills in technology, particularly in cellular phone upgrading and repair, he is our featured story. He is Mr. Jaime M., 33 years old, married and residing in Bitoon, Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is blessed with two children who are still minors. His wife also works together with him as the store manager for their employer’s cell phone units and cell phone accessories display stall in one of our shopping centers here in Ozamiz City.
He started this kind of work five years ago. He learned this skill from a vocational school (TESDA). They also are engaged in selling cell cards, games and music down loading on mobile phones. With a good credit record on his first loan, now he is applying for an amount of P40,000.00 as his second loan under the regular loan program. He wants to add to their capital in their cellular card-selling business and also to purchase additional equipment to be used in their cellphone repair shop. His future plan in business is to establish his own stall for cell phone and cell  accessories displays and cell phone repair.

loans.use: Additional capital for cell phone business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mrs. Irene A. is separated and lives at Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband separated because they were incompatible. She has no children.

Irene has had to strive hard on her own; that’s why she ventured into selling dried fish and vegetables. She received additional working capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. Today, she is applying for php 14,900 to buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: Buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane R. is 24 years old, married, and presently resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She intends to use her loan to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since last April 2009, and she admits that PMPC-Microfinance has helped her quite a bit in financing the needs of raising her hogs. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday and have a happy family for whom she can provide a decent life.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Lorema

texts.en:
Lorema A. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Lorema is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorema owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling cosmetics and home products including flowers. While this is not her only means of generating revenue, it is the main source of income from her business, which she sells to the local community. Lorema has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately Php5000 a month from her sales.

In 2000, Lorema joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorema has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Lorema is requesting a new loan of Php14,900, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 26th loan Lorema has received from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell
